JAP: We have taken more casualties...
FR: Un autre villageois a péri...
OUPS: We have taken more casualties...

JAP: They just keep coming!
FR: Les Ombres sont partout !
OUPS: They just keep coming!

JAP: Are you truly going to abandon them?
FR: Comptes-tu vraiment les abandonner#?
OUPS: Are you truly going to abandon them?

JAP: We'll be attacked again unless we move.
FR: On nous attaquera de nouveau si nous restons ici.
OUPS: We'll be attacked again unless we move.

JAP: Look at him... Look what they've done to him!
FR: Regarde...! Regarde ce qu'elles lui ont fait !
OUPS: Look at him... Look what they've done to him!

JAP: The Shades are even attacking the village now.
FR: Les Ombres s'infiltrent même dans le village maintenant.
OUPS: The Shades are even attacking the village now.

JAP: And armored ones, no less.
FR: Et en plus, elles portent une armure !
OUPS: And armored ones, no less.

JAP: This village of yours seems to be changing for the worse.
FR: Ton village semble se détériorer à vue d'œil.
OUPS: This village of yours seems to be changing for the worse.

JAP: We didn't ask for this; it's all the Shadowlord's fault! That one day changed everything...
FR: Nous n'avons pas provoqué tout ce chaos#! C'est la faute du Maître des Ombres#! Tout a changé ce jour-là…
OUPS: We didn't ask for this; it's all the Shadowlord's fault! That one day changed everything...

JAP: Five long years...
FR: Cinq longues années...
OUPS: Five long years...

JAP: *Sob...sob...*
OUPS: *Sob...sob...*

JAP: Best to leave her be.
FR: Nous ferions mieux de la laisser tranquille.
OUPS: Best to leave her be.

JAP: You look exhausted. Remember, you can't help Yonah if you don't take care of yourself.
FR: Tu as l'air épuisé. N'oublie pas, tu ne pourras pas aider Yonah si tu ne prends pas d'abord soin de toi-même.
OUPS: You look exhausted. Remember, you can't help Yonah if you don't take care of yourself.

JAP: It's not just you, you know? Our whole village is worried about Yonah!
FR: Tu n'es pas le seul à t'inquiéter pour Yonah, tu sais... Tout le village se fait du souci.
OUPS: It's not just you, you know? Our whole village is worried about Yonah!

JAP: Maybe today is the day we finally find her.
FR: Qui sait#? C'est peut-être aujourd'hui que tu retrouveras enfin Yonah.
OUPS: Maybe today is the day we finally find her.

JAP: Those creatures destroyed my crops! Oh, what am I going to do now?
FR: Ces créatures ont détruit ma récolte#! Oh, que vais-je faire maintenant#?
OUPS: Those creatures destroyed my crops! Oh, what am I going to do now?

JAP: Please, my baby is starving. I'll take a crust of bread or an apple seed...anything!
FR: Je t'en supplie#! Mon bébé meurt de faim... J'ai besoin de nourriture. Un quignon de pain, des graines, n'importe quoi...!
OUPS: Please, my baby is starving. I'll take a crust of bread or an apple seed...anything!

JAP: My neighbor has been stealing vegetables from me! I know it!
FR: Mon voisin m'a volé des légumes#! J'en suis certain#!
OUPS: My neighbor has been stealing vegetables from me! I know it!

JAP: People say the family over there is hoarding food in their basement!
FR: D'aucuns disent que cette famille, là-bas, amasse des réserves de nourriture dans leur sous-sol#!
OUPS: People say the family over there is hoarding food in their basement!

JAP: Shame! Shame on them all!
FR: Ils devraient avoir honte#!
OUPS: Shame! Shame on them all!

JAP: They burned my house down! They said I'd been stealing vegetables, but it's not true!
FR: Ils ont brûlé ma maison#! Ils disent que j'ai volé des légumes, mais ce n'est pas vrai,
OUPS: They burned my house down! They said I'd been stealing vegetables, but it's not true!

JAP: I swear it!
FR: je te le jure#!
OUPS: I swear it!

JAP: I don't have anything for you! Go home already!
FR: Je n'ai rien à t'offrir#! Rentre chez toi#!
OUPS: I don't have anything for you! Go home already!

JAP: Whoa. You look pretty run down.
FR: Ouh là, tu as l'air à bout de force.
OUPS: Whoa. You look pretty run down.

JAP: Just old, is all.
FR: Je suis vieux, voilà tout.
OUPS: Just old, is all.

JAP: If you say so. By the way, Popola said she had a letter for you or something.
FR: Si tu le dis. Au fait, Popola aurait paraît-il une lettre pour toi.
OUPS: If you say so. By the way, Popola said she had a letter for you or something.

JAP: Just look at you. You look terrible. I know you're worried about Yonah,
FR: Tu devrais te voir. Tu as vraiment mauvaise mine. Je sais que tu t'inquiètes pour Yonah,
OUPS: Just look at you. You look terrible. I know you're worried about Yonah,

JAP: but you're going to kill yourself!
FR: mais si tu continues ainsi, tu ne survivras pas longtemps#!
OUPS: but you're going to kill yourself!

JAP: I'm fine. Just tired, is all.
FR: Je vais bien. Je suis fatigué, voilà tout.
OUPS: I'm fine. Just tired, is all.

JAP: We can't all stay as young and pretty as you, Popola.
FR: Nous ne pouvons pas tous rester aussi jeune et jolie que toi, Popola.
OUPS: We can't all stay as young and pretty as you, Popola.

JAP: Well, aren't we feeling saucy today?
FR: Oh, tu te sens dragueur, aujourd'hui#?
OUPS: Well, aren't we feeling saucy today?

JAP: No, it's true. You look the same as the day I first met you.
FR: Non, c'est la vérité. Tu n'as pas du tout changé depuis le jour où je t'ai rencontrée.
OUPS: No, it's true. You look the same as the day I first met you.

JAP: Okay, now you're just embarrassing me.
FR: Arrête, tu vas me faire rougir.
OUPS: Okay, now you're just embarrassing me.

JAP: Here. This is from Emil.
FR: Tiens, c'est de la part d'Émile.
OUPS: Here. This is from Emil.

JAP: Perhaps the time has come to save Kainé.
FR: Le moment est peut-être venu de porter secours à Kainé.
OUPS: Perhaps the time has come to save Kainé.

JAP: Does this mean you'll be leaving the village?
FR: Est-ce que ça veut dire que tu vas quitter le village#?
OUPS: Does this mean you'll be leaving the village?

JAP: Sorry... I know things have been rough lately.
FR: Désolé... Je sais que les temps sont durs dernièrement.
OUPS: Sorry... I know things have been rough lately.

JAP: It's okay. Go. We know you're doing it for Yonah.
FR: C'est bon, vas-y. Nous savons que c'est pour Yonah que tu te bats.
OUPS: It's okay. Go. We know you're doing it for Yonah.

JAP: I feel confident that the child still lives.
FR: Je suis certain que ta fille est toujours en vie.
OUPS: I feel confident that the child still lives.

JAP: I know she's alive. She has to be. If she isn't...
FR: Je sais qu'elle est vivante. Elle doit l'être. Si elle ne l'est pas...
OUPS: I know she's alive. She has to be. If she isn't...

JAP: Welcome, sir. Master Emil is waiting in his chambers.
FR: Bienvenue. Monsieur Émile vous attend dans ses appartements.
OUPS: Welcome, sir. Master Emil is waiting in his chambers.

JAP: We need to talk to Emil first.
FR: Nous devons d'abord parler à Émile.
OUPS: We need to talk to Emil first.

JAP: Oh! Hey there, guys!
FR: Oh ! Bonjour !
OUPS: Oh! Hey there, guys!

JAP: Hey there, Emil. How goes the search for a cure?
FR: Salut, Émile. Comment avancent tes recherches sur le remède ?
OUPS: Hey there, Emil. How goes the search for a cure?

JAP: Nothing yet. But I did find this...
FR: Je n'ai pas encore réussi, mais j'ai trouvé ceci.
OUPS: Nothing yet. But I did find this...

JAP: There's a section of this manor called the Planning Room, and I think—
FR: Il y a une partie du manoir appelée « Salle des projets » et je crois que...
OUPS: There's a section of this manor called the Planning Room, and I think—

JAP: You think this room will let you harness the ability to control all forms of magic.
FR: Tu crois que tu pourrais y découvrir comment maîtriser toute forme de magie.
OUPS: You think this room will let you harness the ability to control all forms of magic.

JAP: Correct?
FR: Est-ce exact ?
OUPS: Correct?

JAP: Actually...yeah. Or even if it doesn't, something there might point us in the right direction.
FR: À vrai dire, oui... Ou du moins, y trouver quelque chose qui nous indiquera que faire ensuite.
OUPS: Actually...yeah. Or even if it doesn't, something there might point us in the right direction.

JAP: Sounds like a plan.
FR: C'est une bonne idée.
OUPS: Sounds like a plan.

JAP: There's an entrance in the courtyard. It's not far.
FR: On peut y entrer en passant par la cour. Ce n'est pas très loin.
OUPS: There's an entrance in the courtyard. It's not far.

JAP: All right. Let's go find it.
FR: D'accord, allons-y.
OUPS: All right. Let's go find it.

JAP: Is this it?
FR: C'est ici ?
OUPS: Is this it?

JAP: Warning: This facility...
FR: « Avertissement : ce laboratoire... » Je n'arrive pas à déchiffrer le reste.
OUPS: Warning: This facility...

JAP: ...I can't read the rest. Something about a seal?
FR: ... Ça dit qu'il y a un sceau ?
OUPS: ...I can't read the rest. Something about a seal?

JAP: If someone bothered to attach a warning to this room, I doubt they will appreciate us
FR: La personne qui a pris la peine d'afficher un avertissement à l'entrée de cette salle ne souhaiterait sans doute pas
OUPS: If someone bothered to attach a warning to this room, I doubt they will appreciate us

JAP: forcing our way inside.
FR: que nous y entrions de force.
OUPS: forcing our way inside.

JAP: Ngh...
FR: Oh...
OUPS: Ngh...

JAP: Emil? What is it?
FR: Émile ? Qu'y a-t-il ?
OUPS: Emil? What is it?

JAP: Nothing. ...It's nothing. I'm fine.
FR: Rien... Ce n'est rien. Je vais bien.
OUPS: Nothing. ...It's nothing. I'm fine.

JAP: What's this? A scrap of paper?
FR: Qu'est-ce que c'est ? Un bout de papier ?
OUPS: What's this? A scrap of paper?

JAP: It would appear this used to be some manner of magical laboratory.
FR: Il semblerait que cet endroit était autrefois une sorte de laboratoire magique.
OUPS: It would appear this used to be some manner of magical laboratory.

JAP: This must have been where I was... Ngh!
FR: Ce doit être l'endroit où je suis… Ah !
OUPS: This must have been where I was... Ngh!

JAP: Urgh...
OUPS: Urgh...

JAP: Emil?
FR: Émile ?
OUPS: Emil?

JAP: I'll...I'll be okay. We need to keep going.
FR: Ça... ça ira. Nous devons continuer.
OUPS: I'll...I'll be okay. We need to keep going.

JAP: I'm sorry...
FR: Je suis désolé.
OUPS: I'm sorry...

JAP: Project Number 6? Was this some sort of weapons laboratory?
FR: Le projet Numéro 6 ? Cet endroit était-il un laboratoire de fabrication d'armes ?
OUPS: Project Number 6? Was this some sort of weapons laboratory?

JAP: Something from the old world, I guess.
FR: Je suppose que c'est un autre des vestiges de l'époque des Anciens.
OUPS: Something from the old world, I guess.

JAP: Nnnghh... What was I...doing here...?
FR: Oooh... Que... qu'est-ce que... je faisais ici...?
OUPS: Nnnghh... What was I...doing here...?

JAP: I have doubts as to whether or not Emil will be able to continue.
FR: Je ne suis pas certain qu'Émile puisse continuer.
OUPS: I have doubts as to whether or not Emil will be able to continue.

JAP: I'm fine! Let's just go.
FR: Je me sens bien ! Continuons.
OUPS: I'm fine! Let's just go.

JAP: Nngh... Unnngh...
FR: Ooooh... Aah...
OUPS: Nngh... Unnngh...

JAP: Hey, Emil. You sure you're okay?
FR: Es-tu sûr que ça va, Émile ?
OUPS: Hey, Emil. You sure you're okay?

JAP: I'm a...weapon? What does that even mean? ...What am I?
FR: Je suis... une arme ? Je ne sais même pas ce que ça veut dire !... Que suis-je ?
OUPS: I'm a...weapon? What does that even mean? ...What am I?

JAP: It seems as if he's trying to remember something.
FR: On dirait qu'il essaie de se rappeler quelque chose.
OUPS: It seems as if he's trying to remember something.

JAP: You're going to be okay.
FR: Tu n'as pas à t'inquiéter.
OUPS: You're going to be okay.

JAP: Am I? Am I really?
FR: Vraiment ? Tu en es certain ?
OUPS: Am I? Am I really?

JAP: Your past makes no difference. We'll support you no matter what.
FR: Ton passé ne change rien. Nous resterons à tes côtés quoi qu'il arrive.
OUPS: Your past makes no difference. We'll support you no matter what.

JAP: At any rate, you would hardly be the first member of our merry band to have issues.
FR: De toute façon, tu ne serais pas le premier membre de notre groupe à avoir quelques problèmes.
OUPS: At any rate, you would hardly be the first member of our merry band to have issues.

JAP: No! Don't! Don't look at me!
FR: Non ! Ne... ne me regardez pas...!
OUPS: No! Don't! Don't look at me!

JAP: I know this is how I look now.
FR: Je sais que c'est ainsi que je suis désormais.
OUPS: I know this is how I look now.

JAP: I was terrified at first, but I think I'm okay with it.
FR: J'étais terrifié au début, mais maintenant, je l'accepte.
OUPS: I was terrified at first, but I think I'm okay with it.

JAP: I have the magic I wanted, and I can use it to bring Kainé back to life.
FR: J'ai les sorts dont j'avais besoin et je peux les utiliser pour libérer Kainé.
OUPS: I have the magic I wanted, and I can use it to bring Kainé back to life.

JAP: Emil...
FR: Émile...
OUPS: Emil...

JAP: We should hurry. She's waiting.
FR: Dépêchons-nous. Elle nous attend.
OUPS: We should hurry. She's waiting.

JAP: I sure hope seeing me doesn't petrify her.
FR: J'espère seulement qu'elle ne sera pas pétrifiée en me voyant.
OUPS: I sure hope seeing me doesn't petrify her.

JAP: ...You know? In fear?
FR: ... De peur, je veux dire.
OUPS: ...You know? In fear?

JAP: I see this transformation has not stolen your terrible sense of humor!
FR: Je vois que cette transformation ne t'a pas dépouillé de ton charmant sens de l'humour.
OUPS: I see this transformation has not stolen your terrible sense of humor!

JAP: We are here to see Emil, yes?
FR: Nous sommes venus rendre visite à Émile, non#?
OUPS: We are here to see Emil, yes?

JAP: We need to go to the courtyard.
FR: Nous devons aller dans la cour.
OUPS: We need to go to the courtyard.

JAP: Oh. ...That's a long time.
FR: Oh... Ça fait un bail.
OUPS: Oh. ...That's a long time.

JAP: Any luck with Yonah?
FR: Et Yonah ?
OUPS: Any luck with Yonah?

JAP: We are still no closer to finding her. We need a way to locate the Shadowlord.
FR: Nous sommes toujours à sa recherche. Nous devons trouver un moyen de découvrir où se cache le Maître des Ombres.
OUPS: We are still no closer to finding her. We need a way to locate the Shadowlord.

JAP: This is for you.
FR: Tiens.
OUPS: This is for you.

JAP: Lunar Tears...? Did you make this?
FR: Des larmes lunaires...?... Tu les as fabriquées toi-même ?
OUPS: Lunar Tears...? Did you make this?

JAP: Just a little welcome-back gift. It's not much, I know.
FR: Ce n'est qu'un cadeau pour célébrer ton retour. Ce n'est pas grand-chose, je sais.
OUPS: Just a little welcome-back gift. It's not much, I know.

JAP: It's nothing like the one Grandma used to make, but... Ah, hell. Thanks.
FR: Elles arrivent pas à la cheville de celles de ma grand-mère, mais… Ah, peu importe. Merci.
OUPS: It's nothing like the one Grandma used to make, but... Ah, hell. Thanks.

JAP: Um, excuse me?
FR: Euh, pardon...
OUPS: Um, excuse me?

JAP: Popola! We did it! We freed Kainé!
FR: Popola ! Nous avons réussi ! Nous avons libéré Kainé !
OUPS: Popola! We did it! We freed Kainé!

JAP: That's great. Listen, can I talk to you for a minute?
FR: C'est merveilleux. Puis-je vous parler un instant ?
OUPS: That's great. Listen, can I talk to you for a minute?

JAP: This doesn't make sense!
FR: Ça n'a aucun sens !
OUPS: This doesn't make sense!

JAP: Please try to understand.
FR: S'il te plaît, essaie de comprendre.
OUPS: Please try to understand.

JAP: People are tired and scared, and...
FR: Les villageois sont épuisés et terrifiés... Je suis désolée.
OUPS: People are tired and scared, and...

JAP: I'm sorry. I'm sorry you have to bear the brunt of that.
FR: Je regrette que tu aies à en subir les conséquences.
OUPS: I'm sorry. I'm sorry you have to bear the brunt of that.

JAP: It's crap!
FR: C'est de la connerie !
OUPS: It's crap!

JAP: It's okay.
FR: Ce n'est pas grave.
OUPS: It's okay.

JAP: We can sleep outside.
FR: Nous pouvons dormir à l'extérieur.
OUPS: We can sleep outside.

JAP: No one's sleeping outside!
FR: Personne ne va dormir à l'extérieur !
OUPS: No one's sleeping outside!

JAP: You and Kainé saved this village, and now they want to run you out!?
FR: Vous avez sauvé le village, toi et Kainé, et maintenant ils veulent vous en chasser ?!
OUPS: You and Kainé saved this village, and now they want to run you out!?

JAP: People are afraid of us. And really, I understand. I mean, look at me.
FR: Les villageois ont peur de nous. À vrai dire, je les comprends. Regarde-moi.
OUPS: People are afraid of us. And really, I understand. I mean, look at me.

JAP: As long as you're still with us, I can deal with it.
FR: Tant que tu demeures notre compagnon, je peux l'accepter.
OUPS: As long as you're still with us, I can deal with it.

JAP: Right, Kainé?
FR: N'est-ce pas, Kainé ?
OUPS: Right, Kainé?

JAP: I'm used to sleeping outside.
FR: J'ai l'habitude de dormir à l'extérieur.
OUPS: I'm used to sleeping outside.

JAP: I'm...sorry.
FR: Je suis désolé...
OUPS: I'm...sorry.

JAP: We'll see you later.
FR: À plus tard.
OUPS: We'll see you later.

JAP: We're sorry...
FR: Nous sommes navrées...
OUPS: We're sorry...

JAP: What is the matter?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il ?
OUPS: What is the matter?

JAP: Kainé always sleeps outside. I never thought about that until just now.
FR: Kainé dormait toujours à l'extérieur. Je n'y avais jamais pensé avant aujourd'hui.
OUPS: Kainé always sleeps outside. I never thought about that until just now.

JAP: How could I have not noticed that? How selfish am I?
FR: Comment ai-je pu ne pas le remarquer ? Suis-je donc si égoïste ?
OUPS: How could I have not noticed that? How selfish am I?

JAP: What the hell is wrong with me?
FR: Qu'est-ce qui me prend ?
OUPS: What the hell is wrong with me?

JAP: ...We should turn in.
FR: Nous devrions rentrer.
OUPS: ...We should turn in.

JAP: ...I didn't get much sleep that night.
FR: ... Je n'ai pas bien dormi cette nuit-là.
OUPS: ...I didn't get much sleep that night.

JAP: I wanted to blame Devola for everything.
FR: Je voulais tenir Devola responsable de tout ce qui était arrivé.
OUPS: I wanted to blame Devola for everything.

JAP: I wanted to grab Popola and strangle her.
FR: Je voulais étrangler Popola.
OUPS: I wanted to grab Popola and strangle her.

JAP: But anger won't accomplish anything.
FR: Mais la colère n'accomplit rien.
OUPS: But anger won't accomplish anything.

JAP: They said and did what they did for the sake of the village.
FR: Elles ont agi pour le bien des villageois.
OUPS: They said and did what they did for the sake of the village.

JAP: For the sake of protecting it from the horrifying threat of the Shades.
FR: Elles ont voulu les protéger de la terrible menace des Ombres.
OUPS: For the sake of protecting it from the horrifying threat of the Shades.

JAP: If Devola and Popola are to blame...
FR: Si Devola et Popola ont eu tort...
OUPS: If Devola and Popola are to blame...

JAP: Then I am equally at fault.
FR: Alors, je suis coupable moi aussi.
OUPS: Then I am equally at fault.

JAP: For not stopping for a moment to think about Kainé and Emil...
FR: Car je n'ai pas pensé un instant à Kainé ou Émile...
OUPS: For not stopping for a moment to think about Kainé and Emil...

JAP: Sleep well?
FR: As-tu bien dormi#?
OUPS: Sleep well?

JAP: Sure.
FR: Oui.
OUPS: Sure.

JAP: ...Well, if you say so.
FR: ... Si tu le dis.
OUPS: ...Well, if you say so.

JAP: I need to go see Devola and Popola.
FR: Je dois aller parler à Devola et Popola.
OUPS: I need to go see Devola and Popola.

JAP: ...Very well.
FR: ... Très bien.
OUPS: ...Very well.

JAP: I should talk to to Devola first.
FR: Je devrais d'abord aller parler à Devola...
OUPS: I should talk to to Devola first.

JAP: Hey.
FR: Salut.
OUPS: Hey.

FR: ... Salut.

JAP: I kinda thought you'd never talk to us again.
FR: J'étais presque convaincue que tu ne nous adresserais plus jamais la parole.
OUPS: I kinda thought you'd never talk to us again.

JAP: This is bigger than you or Popola. It's about the whole damn village.
FR: Je n'en veux personnellement ni à toi ni à Popola. C'est contre tout le village que j'éprouve de la rancœur.
OUPS: This is bigger than you or Popola. It's about the whole damn village.

JAP: I know. ...But regardless, you should go talk to Popola. I think she wanted to discuss the Shadowlord with you.
FR: Je sais. Toutefois, tu devrais aller voir Popola. Je crois qu'elle voulait discuter du Maître des Ombres avec toi.
OUPS: I know. ...But regardless, you should go talk to Popola. I think she wanted to discuss the Shadowlord with you.

JAP: I can do that.
FR: D'accord.
OUPS: I can do that.

JAP: Oh, and also...
FR: Oh, et...
OUPS: Oh, and also...

JAP: Yeah?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Yeah?

JAP: Sorry about yesterday. I kind of flew off the handle.
FR: Je veux m'excuser pour hier. Je n'aurais pas dû m'emporter.
OUPS: Sorry about yesterday. I kind of flew off the handle.

JAP: No you didn't. Besides, it was our fault in the first place.
FR: Non, ce n'était pas ta faute.
OUPS: No you didn't. Besides, it was our fault in the first place.

JAP: Let Emil and Kainé know that we're sorry, all right?
FR: Dis à Émile et Kainé que nous sommes désolées, d'accord#?
OUPS: Let Emil and Kainé know that we're sorry, all right?

JAP: I'll do that.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: I'll do that.

JAP: Let Emil and Kainé know that we're sorry, all right?
FR: Dis à Émile et Kainé que nous sommes désolées, d'accord#?
OUPS: Let Emil and Kainé know that we're sorry, all right?

JAP: I'll do that.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: I'll do that.

JAP: Popola?
FR: Popola#?
OUPS: Popola?

JAP: Oh. Hello.
FR: Oh. Bonjour.
OUPS: Oh. Hello.

JAP: Look, I want to apologize for yest─
FR: Écoute, je veux m'excuser de...
OUPS: Look, I want to apologize for yest─

JAP: Stop. Don't you dare. You had every right to be upset.
FR: Pas un mot de plus. Il était parfaitement normal que tu sois en colère.
OUPS: Stop. Don't you dare. You had every right to be upset.

JAP: I understand why you did what you did. ...Even if I don't agree.
FR: Je comprends pourquoi tu as pris cette décision... même si je ne suis pas d'accord.
OUPS: I understand why you did what you did. ...Even if I don't agree.

JAP: You're just trying to protect the villagers. It's not your fault.
FR: Tu essaies de protéger les villageois, voilà tout.
OUPS: You're just trying to protect the villagers. It's not your fault.

JAP: Well, I still feel terrible. Just so you know.
FR: Eh bien, moi, je m'en veux beaucoup.
OUPS: Well, I still feel terrible. Just so you know.

JAP: Ahem! I believe there was something you wished to discuss with us?
FR: Hum, ne voulais-tu pas discuter d'un sujet particulier avec nous#?
OUPS: Ahem! I believe there was something you wished to discuss with us?

JAP: Oh, right. Yes, about that.
FR: Euh, ah oui...

FR: Kainé ignora la question et scruta plutôt la girouette. Celle-ci pointait toujours vers l'est, comme si elle était tout à fait certaine du destin qu'elle avait choisi pour la jeune fille.

FR: La vieille femme la serra plus fort et essaya de réprimer le tremblement de sa voix.

Les premières années n'avaient pas été faciles. <STOP>Toutefois, au fil des ans, Kainé et sa grand-mère étaient devenues plus proches.
OUPS: As the words hit home, Kainé was struck by the force of her love for the old woman. <STOP>As a young child, she didn't even know of her grandmother, but when her parents died, the woman quickly accepted her as her own. <STOP>Grandma, as Kainé called her, was cunning, vulgar, and quick to violence—and their first few years together had not been easy. <STOP>But with each year that passed, Kainé and her grandmother had grown closer.

JAP: Do...do I make you sick, Grandma?
FR: Est-ce que je te dégoûte, mamie#?

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>I...I have to be strong.</FONT>

OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>I...I have to be strong.</FONT>

JAP: She chanted those words to herself over and over as she slowly made her way. <STOP>Finally, her eyes settled on a rotund older woman who was angrily waving her arms in the air and telling anyone who would listen exactly what she thought of Kainé's presence.<PAGE>
FR: Elle se répéta ces paroles tout en avançant. <STOP>Elle finit par remarquer une vieille femme rondelette qui gesticulait en criant à qui voulait bien l'entendre ce qu'elle pensait de Kainé.<PAGE>
OUPS: She chanted those words to herself over and over as she slowly made her way. <STOP>Finally, her eyes settled on a rotund older woman who was angrily waving her arms in the air and telling anyone who would listen exactly what she thought of Kainé's presence.<PAGE>

JAP: Hey, lady, said Kainé with a bravado she did not feel. "Where's the apothecary?"
FR: Dites, madame, demanda Kainé avec plus de courage qu'elle n'en avait. Où est l'apothicaire#?
OUPS: Hey, lady, said Kainé with a bravado she did not feel. "Where's the apothecary?"

JAP: The woman's flabby cheeks shook in bewildered anger. <FONT=ITALIC>How dare this...this</FONT> thing <FONT=ITALIC>speak to me!</FONT> they seemed to say. But Kainé saw that her eyes held a different emotion: fear.
FR: Les joues pendantes de la vieille femme tremblèrent de colère. <FONT=ITALIC>Comment cette... cette...</FONT> créature <FONT=ITALIC>ose-t-elle s'adresser à moi#?!</FONT> semblaient-elles vouloir dire. Mais Kainé reconnut l'émotion qui voilait ses yeux#: la peur.
OUPS: The woman's flabby cheeks shook in bewildered anger. <FONT=ITALIC>How dare this...this</FONT> thing <FONT=ITALIC>speak to me!</FONT> they seemed to say. But Kainé saw that her eyes held a different emotion: fear.

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>Yeah, we're both scared, lady. Trust me on this one.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Ouais, on a aussi peur l'une que l'autre. Tu peux me croire.</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>Yeah, we're both scared, lady. Trust me on this one.</FONT>

JAP: Which way? Kainé repeated.
FR: Où est-il#? répéta Kainé.
OUPS: Which way? Kainé repeated.

JAP: The woman pointed at a small building to her right before hitching up her dress and stumbling off in the other direction. <STOP>Kainé cringed, expecting a stone to come flying from the assembled crowd, but none came.
FR: La vieille femme pointa une petite hutte à sa droite, puis retroussa sa jupe et prit ses jambes à son cou dans la direction opposée. <STOP>Kainé se recroquevilla, s'attendant à ce qu'un membre de la foule qui s'était assemblée autour d'elles lui lance une pierre. Personne ne le fit.
OUPS: The woman pointed at a small building to her right before hitching up her dress and stumbling off in the other direction. <STOP>Kainé cringed, expecting a stone to come flying from the assembled crowd, but none came.

JAP: Her mind was filled with a strange sense of pride as she made her way to the apothecary. But the new emotion had little time to take root, for as soon as she opened the door, she noticed a familiar customer at the counter.
FR: Une étrange fierté l'envahit alors qu'elle s'approchait de la demeure de l'apothicaire. Cependant, cette nouvelle émotion n'eut pas le temps de s'épanouir, car elle aperçut une silhouette familière lorsqu'elle ouvrit la porte.
OUPS: Her mind was filled with a strange sense of pride as she made her way to the apothecary. But the new emotion had little time to take root, for as soon as she opened the door, she noticed a familiar customer at the counter.

JAP: It was Dimo. He'd clearly been sent here on some kind of family errand, because his gang of followers was nowhere to be found.
FR: Dimo se tenait devant le comptoir. On l'avait sans doute envoyé faire des courses, car sa bande n'était nulle part aux alentours.
OUPS: It was Dimo. He'd clearly been sent here on some kind of family errand, because his gang of followers was nowhere to be found.

JAP: Oh my go... he sputtered.  "I mean, uh... What are you doing here, freak!?"
FR: Oh non...! bredouilla-t-il. Euh, je veux dire... Qu'est-ce que tu fais ici, sale monstre#?!
OUPS: Oh my go... he sputtered.  "I mean, uh... What are you doing here, freak!?"

JAP: The insult was delivered without force, and Kainé happily ignored it. Stretching on tiptoes to see over the counter, she asked the shopkeeper for the medication.<PAGE>
FR: L'insulte avait été proférée sans venin et Kainé l'ignora. Elle se mit sur la pointe des pieds pour voir au-delà du comptoir et demanda à l'apothicaire les médicaments dont elle avait besoin.<PAGE>
OUPS: The insult was delivered without force, and Kainé happily ignored it. Stretching on tiptoes to see over the counter, she asked the shopkeeper for the medication.<PAGE>

JAP: Ha! barked Dimo. "That old bitch finally keel over!?"
FR: Ha#! aboya Dimo. La vieille bique a finalement décidé de crever#?!
OUPS: Ha! barked Dimo. "That old bitch finally keel over!?"

JAP: Go to hell, Dimo!
FR: Va te faire foutre, Dimo#!
OUPS: Go to hell, Dimo!

JAP: The boy's eyes grew so wide they seemed ready to fall out of his head. But before he could let fly a comeback—or worse, a punch—the apothecary told them to knock it off before he kicked them out of the store.
FR: Les yeux du garçon, écarquillés de surprise, semblaient vouloir sortir de leurs orbites. Avant qu'il ne puisse répliquer ou l'attaquer, l'apothicaire intervint et leur fit vite comprendre qu'il les jetterait dehors s'ils continuaient ainsi.
OUPS: The boy's eyes grew so wide they seemed ready to fall out of his head. But before he could let fly a comeback—or worse, a punch—the apothecary told them to knock it off before he kicked them out of the store.

JAP: Dimo slunk out of the shop, cursing Kainé under his breath. <STOP>Once he was gone, she allowed herself to breathe once more, taking a brief tour of the shop while the owner prepared her medication.
FR: Dimo sortit du magasin en maudissant Kainé à voix basse. <STOP>Quand il fut parti, Kainé respira de nouveau et prit quelques moments pour admirer les étalages pendant que l'apothicaire préparait ses médicaments.
OUPS: Dimo slunk out of the shop, cursing Kainé under his breath. <STOP>Once he was gone, she allowed herself to breathe once more, taking a brief tour of the shop while the owner prepared her medication.

JAP: Countless tiny bottles filled the cramped store, each with a label written in some indecipherable language. An ocean of aromas assaulted her nose, creating a scent that was exotic, but not altogether unpleasant. <STOP>Seeing such a variety of supplies gave Kainé a sense of peace. Surely, in a world so vast, there would be a place that she could call home.
FR: Les étagères qui meublaient la salle exiguë étaient encombrées d'une multitude de petites bouteilles, chacune portant une étiquette dans une langue inconnue. Une bouffée d'odeurs variées assaillit les narines de Kainé, se mélangeant pour créer un parfum exotique et plutôt agréable. À ses yeux, une telle variété de marchandises était rassurante. Elle pourrait sûrement trouver sa place dans un monde aussi vaste et divers.
OUPS: Countless tiny bottles filled the cramped store, each with a label written in some indecipherable language. An ocean of aromas assaulted her nose, creating a scent that was exotic, but not altogether unpleasant. <STOP>Seeing such a variety of supplies gave Kainé a sense of peace. Surely, in a world so vast, there would be a place that she could call home.

JAP: On the far wall, behind the counter, rested a portrait of a stunning young girl. <STOP>The picture had once contained bright, vibrant colors, but time had worked its magic, and they were beginning to fade. The beauty of the work, however, remained undiminished.
FR: Le portrait d'une jeune fille ravissante était accroché au mur derrière le comptoir. Le temps avait fait pâlir ses couleurs autrefois éclatantes, mais sa beauté rayonnait toujours.
OUPS: On the far wall, behind the counter, rested a portrait of a stunning young girl. <STOP>The picture had once contained bright, vibrant colors, but time had worked its magic, and they were beginning to fade. The beauty of the work, however, remained undiminished.

JAP: You like that picture?
FR: Ce dessin te plaît#?
OUPS: You like that picture?

JAP: Kainé turned to find the apothecary with a small vial of medicine in his hand. His eyes were gentle but sad, and they seemed to stare through her and into nothing as he spoke.
FR: Kainé se retourna et aperçut l'apothicaire, une bouteille de médicaments en main.Son regard était doux, mais triste et il sembla ne pas vraiment la voir lorsqu'il continua#:
OUPS: Kainé turned to find the apothecary with a small vial of medicine in his hand. His eyes were gentle but sad, and they seemed to stare through her and into nothing as he spoke.

JAP: That's my daughter. I sketched it when she was just a little girl. ...She's been dead a long time now.
FR: C'est ma fille. J'ai dessiné son portrait quand elle était petite. Il y a longtemps qu'elle n'est plus de ce monde...
OUPS: That's my daughter. I sketched it when she was just a little girl. ...She's been dead a long time now.

JAP: Kainé didn't know how to respond; she just stared at the portrait and tried to come up with the right words.
FR: Kainé ne sut que répondre. Elle fixa plutôt le portrait, en quête d'inspiration.
OUPS: Kainé didn't know how to respond; she just stared at the portrait and tried to come up with the right words.

JAP: Pictures are wonderful things, continued the shopkeeper. "They let the ones closest to you live on forever."
FR: Un portrait est une chose merveilleuse, déclara l'apothicaire. Il permet à ceux qui nous sont chers de vivre éternellement.
OUPS: Pictures are wonderful things, continued the shopkeeper. "They let the ones closest to you live on forever."

JAP: He shook his head slightly, then looked down at Kainé and smiled. Handing her the medicine, he reached into his sizeable green apron and produced a handful of old wax crayons.
FR: L'homme secoua doucement la tête, regarda Kainé et sourit. Il lui donna la fiole de médicaments, puis sortit une poignée de vieux crayons de cire de son grand tablier vert.
OUPS: He shook his head slightly, then looked down at Kainé and smiled. Handing her the medicine, he reached into his sizeable green apron and produced a handful of old wax crayons.

JAP: You should have these. There's no one left that I wish to draw.<PAGE>
FR: Tiens, prends-les. Je n'ai plus personne à dessiner.<PAGE>
OUPS: You should have these. There's no one left that I wish to draw.<PAGE>

JAP: Kainé took an instinctive step back, causing the shopkeeper's face to darken.
FR: Kainé recula instinctivement et le visage de l'apothicaire s'assombrit.
OUPS: Kainé took an instinctive step back, causing the shopkeeper's face to darken.

JAP: Yes, I've heard the rumors about you, he said. "It's a small village, and word travels quickly. <STOP>Between you and me, I'm not sure which of them to believe...but I also don't think they matter much. <STOP>I knew your grandmother Kali, and I think the way she was driven out of this town is just deplorable."<PAGE>
FR: Oui, j'ai entendu les rumeurs qui courent à ton sujet, dit-il. C'est un petit village et les nouvelles se propagent rapidement. <STOP>À vrai dire, je ne sais que croire... mais je ne pense pas qu'elles soient importantes. Je connais Kali, ta grand-mère, et je n'aime pas qu'on l'ait exilée ainsi du village.
OUPS: Yes, I've heard the rumors about you, he said. "It's a small village, and word travels quickly. <STOP>Between you and me, I'm not sure which of them to believe...but I also don't think they matter much. <STOP>I knew your grandmother Kali, and I think the way she was driven out of this town is just deplorable."<PAGE>

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>Grandma's name is Kali?</FONT> thought Kainé suddenly. <STOP>She was still mulling this new fact over in her mind as she reached out and gently took the crayons from the apothecary's hands.
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Mamie s'appelle Kali#?!</FONT><STOP> Kainé réfléchit à cette découverte tout en prenant avec précaution les crayons des mains de l'apothicaire.
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>Grandma's name is Kali?</FONT> thought Kainé suddenly. <STOP>She was still mulling this new fact over in her mind as she reached out and gently took the crayons from the apothecary's hands.

JAP: Your grandmother is an old friend of mine, he said as Kainé scooted away yet again, "and I owe her much."
FR: Ta grand-mère est une amie, expliqua-t-il tandis que Kainé reprenait ses distances. Je lui dois beaucoup.
OUPS: Your grandmother is an old friend of mine, he said as Kainé scooted away yet again, "and I owe her much."

JAP: I'm willing to wager that she would like it if you drew a picture of her. <STOP>Yes, I think she would like that very much.<PAGE>
FR: Je parie qu'elle aimerait que tu lui dessines son portrait. <STOP>Oui, j'en suis convaincu.<PAGE>
OUPS: I'm willing to wager that she would like it if you drew a picture of her. <STOP>Yes, I think she would like that very much.<PAGE>

JAP: Kainé murmured a quiet agreement, but inside her heart was bursting. Never before had a villager treated her with anything but complete contempt. <STOP>It was a tiny, almost imperceptible step, but it was a step nonetheless—and with enough tiny steps, she might one day discover the rest of the world.
FR: Kainé acquiesça d'un murmure, mais son cœur allait exploser. Jamais un villageois ne l'avait traitée avec autre chose que le mépris le plus écrasant. C'était un pas vers l'avant, un pas minuscule, presque imperceptible, mais tout de même une amélioration.<PAGE>Avec une multitude de pas comme celui-ci, elle pourrait peut-être un jour découvrir le monde.
OUPS: Kainé murmured a quiet agreement, but inside her heart was bursting. Never before had a villager treated her with anything but complete contempt. <STOP>It was a tiny, almost imperceptible step, but it was a step nonetheless—and with enough tiny steps, she might one day discover the rest of the world.

JAP: When Kainé returned home, she found her grandmother asleep in her bed. Her feet were blackened and raw—even bleeding a bit in places—leading Kainé to think that she had been pacing around the room until exhaustion finally caught up with her.
FR: Lorsqu'elle rentra chez elle, sa grand-mère était endormie dans son lit. Ses pieds étaient noirâtres, meurtris et même ensanglantés par endroits. Kainé se douta qu'elle avait fait les cent pas dans la pièce jusqu'à ce qu'elle ne tombe d'épuisement.<PAGE>
OUPS: When Kainé returned home, she found her grandmother asleep in her bed. Her feet were blackened and raw—even bleeding a bit in places—leading Kainé to think that she had been pacing around the room until exhaustion finally caught up with her.

JAP: She placed the medicine by her grandmother's pillow and turned to leave, but found the old woman's hand clasped around her arm.<PAGE>
FR: Elle plaça le flacon de l'apothicaire près de son oreiller et tenta de s'éloigner, mais la vieille femme l'attrapa du bras.
OUPS: She placed the medicine by her grandmother's pillow and turned to leave, but found the old woman's hand clasped around her arm.<PAGE>

JAP: Back already, are you? asked her grandmother with a yawn. "Come here, let me have a look at you."
FR: Déjà rentrée, hum#? demanda-t-elle en bâillant. Viens ici que je te regarde.
OUPS: Back already, are you? asked her grandmother with a yawn. "Come here, let me have a look at you."

JAP: Grandma sat up and examined Kainé from head to toe. Finally satisfied that nothing terrible had befallen her grandchild, she leaned back and allowed herself to relax.<PAGE>
FR: Elle s'assit sur son lit et examina Kainé de la tête aux pieds. Satisfaite que rien ne fût arrivé à sa petite-fille, elle se recoucha et se détendit un peu.
OUPS: Grandma sat up and examined Kainé from head to toe. Finally satisfied that nothing terrible had befallen her grandchild, she leaned back and allowed herself to relax.<PAGE>

JAP: Well, how was it? Did those bastards give you any trouble?
FR: Alors, comment ça s'est passé#? Est-ce que ces salauds t'ont causé des ennuis#?
OUPS: Well, how was it? Did those bastards give you any trouble?

JAP: It was kinda fun, said Kainé with a small smile. <STOP>"No, seriously, it was."
FR: C'était plutôt amusant, répondit Kainé en souriant. <STOP>Non, c'est vrai#!
OUPS: It was kinda fun, said Kainé with a small smile. <STOP>"No, seriously, it was."

JAP: It was fun, was it? asked her grandmother in a voice which implied she believed anything but.
FR: C'était... amusant#? répéta sa grand-mère avec incrédulité.
OUPS: It was fun, was it? asked her grandmother in a voice which implied she believed anything but.

JAP: Uh-huh. So anytime you need me to run an errand, just let me know!<PAGE>
FR: Ouaip. Alors si t'as besoin de quoi que ce soit du village, dis-le-moi#!<PAGE>
OUPS: Uh-huh. So anytime you need me to run an errand, just let me know!<PAGE>

JAP: As she spoke, Kainé removed the crayons from her pocket. After a brief explanation of their source, she informed her grandmother that she was going to sketch her portrait.
FR: Kainé sortit les crayons de cire de sa poche. Après avoir expliqué où elle les avait obtenus, elle annonça qu'elle allait faire le portrait de sa grand-mère.
OUPS: As she spoke, Kainé removed the crayons from her pocket. After a brief explanation of their source, she informed her grandmother that she was going to sketch her portrait.

JAP: A portrait of me? Ridiculous. No one wants to stare at a wrinkled old crone.
FR: Mon portrait#? Ridicule#! Qui voudrait admirer mon visage ridé#?
OUPS: A portrait of me? Ridiculous. No one wants to stare at a wrinkled old crone.

JAP: But Grandma! It'll make you live forever!
FR: Mais mamie#! Grâce à lui, tu pourras vivre pour toujours#!
OUPS: But Grandma! It'll make you live forever!

JAP: Horse manure! said her grandmother, throwing back the sheet from her bed. "Livin' forever would just piss me off. Now put those crayons away and help with dinner!"
FR: Foutaises#! répliqua sa grand-mère en rabattant ses draps. Vivre pour toujours serait trop emmerdant. Range ces crayons et viens m'aider à préparer le dîner#!
OUPS: Horse manure! said her grandmother, throwing back the sheet from her bed. "Livin' forever would just piss me off. Now put those crayons away and help with dinner!"

JAP: But Kainé would not relent, and in the end, Grandma found herself leaning against the wall of their house as if posing for a master artist.
FR: Toutefois, Kainé refusa d'abandonner et la vieille femme se retrouva plus tard immobile dans une position inconfortable, comme si elle posait pour un artiste célèbre.
OUPS: But Kainé would not relent, and in the end, Grandma found herself leaning against the wall of their house as if posing for a master artist.

JAP: Kainé took up the crayons and eyed her subject carefully...
FR: Kainé scruta attentivement son sujet, crayon à la main...
OUPS: Kainé took up the crayons and eyed her subject carefully...

JAP: Just as her grandmother was about to nod off, Kainé finished the work. After staring at it for a bit, she released it from her grip and let it slowly drift to the floor.
FR: Elle termina son croquis alors que sa grand-mère commençait à somnoler. La jeune fille le regarda quelques instants, puis le laissa tomber sur le sol.
OUPS: Just as her grandmother was about to nod off, Kainé finished the work. After staring at it for a bit, she released it from her grip and let it slowly drift to the floor.

JAP: It's...terrible! It doesn't look like you at all.
FR: C'est affreux...! Ça te ressemble pas du tout.
OUPS: It's...terrible! It doesn't look like you at all.

JAP: I'm sorry, Grandma. I thought these crayons would...you know? Make drawing easy or something
FR: Je suis désolée, mamie. Je croyais que ces crayons m'aideraient à mieux dessiner...
OUPS: I'm sorry, Grandma. I thought these crayons would...you know? Make drawing easy or something

JAP: The old woman's eyes narrowed at her granddaughter's disappointment. "Let me be the judge of that," she said, ignoring the pain in her back and reaching for the paper.
FR: Les yeux de la vieille femme se plissèrent en lisant la déception sur le visage de Kainé. C'est à moi d'en juger, affirma-t-elle tout en s'étirant pour ramasser le dessin sans se soucier de son dos endolori.
OUPS: The old woman's eyes narrowed at her granddaughter's disappointment. "Let me be the judge of that," she said, ignoring the pain in her back and reaching for the paper.

JAP: The sketch could have been a person's face. It also could have been a boulder, a lump of clay, or an incredibly misshapen loaf of bread—all rendered in a chaotic array of colors.
FR: Cela aurait pu être un visage, un rocher, une motte d'argile ou encore une miche de pain difforme, le tout dans un assortiment de couleurs inharmonieuses.
OUPS: The sketch could have been a person's face. It also could have been a boulder, a lump of clay, or an incredibly misshapen loaf of bread—all rendered in a chaotic array of colors.

JAP: The old woman stared at the picture for a long time, then slowly wheezed out a laugh.
FR: La vieille femme y jeta un coup d'œil et faillit s'étouffer de rire.
OUPS: The old woman stared at the picture for a long time, then slowly wheezed out a laugh.

JAP: Oh, Kainé! she said between laughter. "You truly are my blood! You're as clumsy as me, and I love it!"
FR: Oh, Kainé#! s'esclaffa-t-elle. Ça fait aucun doute, t'es ma petite-fille#! T'es aussi malhabile que moi, c'est formidable#!
OUPS: Oh, Kainé! she said between laughter. "You truly are my blood! You're as clumsy as me, and I love it!"

JAP: But—
FR: Mais...
OUPS: But—

JAP: Hush. I won't hear any more bull about how ugly you think it is. It came from the heart, and I'll treasure it always.<PAGE>
FR: Ça suffit. Je veux plus t'entendre répéter combien il est laid et d'autres conneries du genre. Tu l'as dessiné avec amour et je le chérirai toujours.<PAGE>
OUPS: Hush. I won't hear any more bull about how ugly you think it is. It came from the heart, and I'll treasure it always.<PAGE>

JAP: True to her word, the old woman gave the picture a place of honor above the kitchen table. <STOP>In the days that followed, Kainé would often catch her staring at the portrait with a strange smile on her face—an action she interpreted as silent, mocking laughter. <STOP>A week later, Kainé could stand it no more, and asked her grandmother to take the artwork down.<PAGE>
FR: Fidèle à sa promesse, la vieille femme l'accrocha au mur à la tête de la table. <STOP>Par la suite, Kainé la surprit plusieurs fois fixant le portrait, un étrange sourire aux lèvres. Elle crut que la vieille femme s'en moquait silencieusement. <STOP>Une semaine plus tard, Kainé ne put plus le supporter et demanda à sa grand-mère d'enlever le dessin du mur.<PAGE>
OUPS: True to her word, the old woman gave the picture a place of honor above the kitchen table. <STOP>In the days that followed, Kainé would often catch her staring at the portrait with a strange smile on her face—an action she interpreted as silent, mocking laughter. <STOP>A week later, Kainé could stand it no more, and asked her grandmother to take the artwork down.<PAGE>

JAP: Posh! said the old woman. "I'll take this down when they roll me in my shroud!" She pondered this for a bit, then turned to Kainé and dropped to one knee.
FR: Fi#! s'exclama la vieille femme. Il restera où il est jusqu'à ce qu'on m'emmène dans mon cercueil. Elle réfléchit un peu, puis s'agenouilla devant Kainé pour mieux la regarder dans les yeux.
OUPS: Posh! said the old woman. "I'll take this down when they roll me in my shroud!" She pondered this for a bit, then turned to Kainé and dropped to one knee.

JAP: Listen to me, girl. Seein' this picture makes me happy in a way I've never felt before. <STOP>And it makes me want to go on, so that someday you can feel the same happiness.
FR: Écoute-moi bien, ma petite. Admirer ce dessin me rend heureuse comme je l'ai jamais été... et il me donne l'envie de continuer à vivre. J'espère qu'un jour tu trouveras quelque chose qui te rendra aussi heureuse.
OUPS: Listen to me, girl. Seein' this picture makes me happy in a way I've never felt before. <STOP>And it makes me want to go on, so that someday you can feel the same happiness.

JAP: It was a moment that burned itself in Kainé's memory: a perfect blend of pride and love and joy that came together to form a lifelong remembrance. <STOP>She swore to never forget this moment; to never forget the old woman who had made her place in the world possible.<PAGE>
FR: Cet instant se figea dans les souvenirs de Kainé, un mélange parfait de fierté, d'amour et de joie le rendant ineffaçable. Elle se promit de ne jamais l'oublier ni d'oublier la vieille femme qui lui avait donné une place dans le monde.<PAGE>
OUPS: It was a moment that burned itself in Kainé's memory: a perfect blend of pride and love and joy that came together to form a lifelong remembrance. <STOP>She swore to never forget this moment; to never forget the old woman who had made her place in the world possible.<PAGE>

JAP: Time moves on. People and memories come in and out of a life like ghosts passing through a hall. <FONT=ITALIC>But this moment will be different,</FONT> Kainé swore, <FONT=ITALIC>because I will remember it forever.</FONT>
FR: Le temps s'écoule inlassablement. Les gens et les événements traversent une vie comme des fantômes parcourant un long couloir. <FONT=ITALIC>Mais cet instant sera différent,</FONT> se jura Kainé, <FONT=ITALIC>car je m'en souviendrai toujours.</FONT>
OUPS: Time moves on. People and memories come in and out of a life like ghosts passing through a hall. <FONT=ITALIC>But this moment will be different,</FONT> Kainé swore, <FONT=ITALIC>because I will remember it forever.</FONT>

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>...Forever.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Toujours...</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>...Forever.</FONT>

JAP: Kainé listened to the sound of crackling firewood and stared at the black object on her plate. She'd been pushing it around the wooden disc for a good ten minutes, ignoring the bemused stare of her grandmother. <STOP>Finally, she summoned her courage and gave the object a brief sniff. A sharp, bitter scent flew up her nostrils and made its home there, causing her face to twist with disgust.
FR: Kainé écoutait le crépitement du feu tout en observant la chose noire dans son assiette. Elle la poussait de sa fourchette depuis dix minutes, ignorant le regard amusé de sa grand-mère. <STOP>Rassemblant tout son courage, elle renifla enfin l'objet. Une odeur âcre et pénétrante l'assaillit et son visage se convulsa de dégoût.
