JAP: Kainé looked up, tears in her eyes. The sky seemed smaller somehow. Darker. <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>Is this because of that...Shade? Is this how they see the world?</FONT><PAGE>
FR: Kainé regarda le ciel, les larmes aux yeux. Celui-ci semblait plus petit... plus sombre.<STOP><FONT=ITALIC>Est-ce la faute de cette... Ombre#? C'est comme ça qu'elles perçoivent le monde#?</FONT><PAGE>
OUPS: Kainé looked up, tears in her eyes. The sky seemed smaller somehow. Darker. <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>Is this because of that...Shade? Is this how they see the world?</FONT><PAGE>

JAP: So, uh, listen, purred the voice. "I know this whole possession thing seems a bit sudden, but it ain't all bad. There's plenty in it for you, too."
FR: Alors, écoute, susurra la voix. Je sais que c'est un peu soudain, mais être possédée est pas si mal que ça. Ça a aussi ses avantages.
OUPS: So, uh, listen, purred the voice. "I know this whole possession thing seems a bit sudden, but it ain't all bad. There's plenty in it for you, too."

JAP: I'm a very powerful creature, Sunshine. And now that power belongs to you.
FR: Je suis une créature très puissante, ma chérie, et ma force t'appartient, désormais.
OUPS: I'm a very powerful creature, Sunshine. And now that power belongs to you.

JAP: You got enemies? People you wanna kill? I can make it happen! <STOP>That little fat kid who kept picking on you? That big ol' Shade that squashed your granny? We'll wrap 'em up in their own assholes! <STOP>No more abuse for you, Sunshine! No more pain!
FR: La voix continua : T'as des ennemis#? Des gens dont tu veux te débarrasser#? Je te donnerai un coup de main#! <STOP>Tu sais cette petite brute qui t'embêtait#? L'Ombre gigantesque qui a écrasé ta mamie#? On leur fera avaler leur trou du cul#! Tu te feras plus jamais malmener, ma chérie#! <STOP>Finies les souffrances#!
OUPS: You got enemies? People you wanna kill? I can make it happen! <STOP>That little fat kid who kept picking on you? That big ol' Shade that squashed your granny? We'll wrap 'em up in their own assholes! <STOP>No more abuse for you, Sunshine! No more pain!

JAP: W-wait, said Kainé. "You're a Shade. Why would you help me kill another Shade?"
FR: Une... une seconde, répondit Kainé. Tu es une Ombre, non#? Pourquoi tu m'aiderais à tuer une de tes semblables#?
OUPS: W-wait, said Kainé. "You're a Shade. Why would you help me kill another Shade?"

JAP: What, ya think I'm some kind of racist? Some killing snob? <STOP>I don't give a good goddamn who ya murder, honeypants. I just wanna drink from the well.
FR: Quoi, tu crois que je pourrais faire preuve de discrimination#? Que je m'abaisserais pas à faire une chose pareille#? Je me fous de ce que tu tues, ma chérie. <STOP>Tout ce que je demande, c'est de participer.
OUPS: What, ya think I'm some kind of racist? Some killing snob? <STOP>I don't give a good goddamn who ya murder, honeypants. I just wanna drink from the well.

JAP: Kainé considered this as she struggled to her feet, the power of the Shade coursing through her. <STOP>The smoke from her house was drifting away with the wind, and she enjoyed the way the cool evening breeze felt on her new left arm.<PAGE>
FR: Kainé se leva péniblement en réfléchissant, la force de l'Ombre parcourant ses veines. <STOP>Le vent dissipait peu à peu la fumée des ruines de sa maison. Elle savoura la caresse de la brise fraîche du soir sur son nouveau bras.<PAGE>
OUPS: Kainé considered this as she struggled to her feet, the power of the Shade coursing through her. <STOP>The smoke from her house was drifting away with the wind, and she enjoyed the way the cool evening breeze felt on her new left arm.<PAGE>

JAP: After a long pause, the voice spoke up again.
FR: Après un long moment, la voix reprit#:
OUPS: After a long pause, the voice spoke up again.

JAP: So, uh, how 'bout it? You and me? We could have some good times together. <STOP>Look, I'll even take care of the bloody part if you don't want—
FR: Alors#? Qu'en dis-tu#? On pourrait s'amuser toi et moi. <STOP>Écoute, je peux même me charger de la violence, si tu veux pas...
OUPS: So, uh, how 'bout it? You and me? We could have some good times together. <STOP>Look, I'll even take care of the bloody part if you don't want—

JAP: Fuck off, asshole, muttered Kainé. "I'll handle the killing."
FR: Va te faire foutre, enculé#! répliqua Kainé les dents serrées. Je m'occuperai du carnage.
OUPS: Fuck off, asshole, muttered Kainé. "I'll handle the killing."

JAP: Bwaaah hah hah! screamed the voice. "Look at you go! Oh, Sunshine, we're gonna have <FONT=ITALIC>so much fun!"</FONT>
FR: Gah ha ha ha ha ha#! exulta la voix. Eh bien, dis donc#! Oh, ma chérie, on va s'amuser comme des FOUS#! L'Ombre gloussa de satisfaction.
OUPS: Bwaaah hah hah! screamed the voice. "Look at you go! Oh, Sunshine, we're gonna have <FONT=ITALIC>so much fun!"</FONT>

JAP: So listen, my name's Tyrann. And if you ever need me, I'll just be hanging out in this piece of meat you call a heart. <STOP>Now get to it! The more you kill, the more your heart turns rotten and sour...and I <FONT=ITALIC>like</FONT> rotten and sour!
FR: En passant, moi c'est Tyrann. Si t'as besoin d'un coup de main, je serai dans cet organe inutile que tu appelles ton cœur. <STOP>Allez, qu'est-ce que tu attends#? Plus tu tues de gens, plus ton âme deviendra souillée et corrompue... C'est formidable, tu verras#!
OUPS: So listen, my name's Tyrann. And if you ever need me, I'll just be hanging out in this piece of meat you call a heart. <STOP>Now get to it! The more you kill, the more your heart turns rotten and sour...and I <FONT=ITALIC>like</FONT> rotten and sour!

JAP: Kainé found herself nodding at the voice. "Yeah," she said. "Yeah, I think this can work."
FR: Kainé acquiesça sans s'en rendre compte. Ouais, répondit-elle. Je crois que ça pourrait marcher.
OUPS: Kainé found herself nodding at the voice. "Yeah," she said. "Yeah, I think this can work."

JAP: I'm gonna find that Shade, and I'm gonna strangle it with its own guts.
FR: Je vais trouver cette Ombre et l'étrangler avec ses propres boyaux.
OUPS: I'm gonna find that Shade, and I'm gonna strangle it with its own guts.

JAP: And when I'm done, I'm gonna do the same to you, Tyrann. Count on it.
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>... Et quand j'aurai fini, je te ferai souffrir le même sort, Tyrann. Sois-en certain.</FONT>
OUPS: And when I'm done, I'm gonna do the same to you, Tyrann. Count on it.

JAP: Hah! laughed Tyrann. "I've shit bigger than you, so good luck with that. <STOP>Oh, and hey. One more thing. Right now, you and me are sharing this body, but if you ever run out of hate, if you ever...you know? Go soft? <STOP>Then I'm gonna take over everything."<PAGE>
FR: Ha#! s'esclaffa Tyrann. J'ai chié des crottes plus dangereuses que toi, alors bonne chance#! <STOP>Oh, et un dernier truc... Pour le moment, on partage ce corps, mais si un jour tu viens à manquer de haine, si tu te ramollis... <STOP>Je prendrai le dessus.<PAGE>
OUPS: Hah! laughed Tyrann. "I've shit bigger than you, so good luck with that. <STOP>Oh, and hey. One more thing. Right now, you and me are sharing this body, but if you ever run out of hate, if you ever...you know? Go soft? <STOP>Then I'm gonna take over everything."<PAGE>

JAP: So keep on killin', Sunshine! And watch your back!
FR: Alors, fais durer le massacre, ma chérie#! Et surtout, fais gaffe, je serai toujours prêt à prendre la relève#!
OUPS: So keep on killin', Sunshine! And watch your back!

JAP: The voice grew fainter and gradually faded away. <STOP>Fading to somewhere deep inside Kainé herself.
FR: La voix s'affaiblit et s'éteignit, se réfugiant sans doute dans les profondeurs de l'esprit de Kainé.
OUPS: The voice grew fainter and gradually faded away. <STOP>Fading to somewhere deep inside Kainé herself.

JAP: Kainé waited until she was sure the voice was gone, then waved her new left arm around a few times. <FONT=ITALIC>It feels perfectly normal,</FONT> she thought. <FONT=ITALIC>It feels...like mine.</FONT> <STOP>Desperately, she began poking and prodding at the new limb, determined to find something wrong with it. <STOP>She didn't want it to feel normal. That would mean the creature inside her had already won.<PAGE>
FR: Kainé attendit quelques instants pour s'assurer que la voix était partie, puis étira son bras gauche devant elle. <FONT=ITALIC>Il a l'air parfaitement normal,</FONT> pensa-t-elle. <FONT=ITALIC>Je jurerais que c'est le mien...</FONT><STOP>Elle frappa et pinça son nouveau bras avec ardeur, bien décidée à y découvrir un défaut. <STOP>Elle ne voulait pas qu'il lui paraisse normal. Cela voudrait dire que la créature qui résidait désormais en elle avait déjà gagné.<PAGE>
OUPS: Kainé waited until she was sure the voice was gone, then waved her new left arm around a few times. <FONT=ITALIC>It feels perfectly normal,</FONT> she thought. <FONT=ITALIC>It feels...like mine.</FONT> <STOP>Desperately, she began poking and prodding at the new limb, determined to find something wrong with it. <STOP>She didn't want it to feel normal. That would mean the creature inside her had already won.<PAGE>

JAP: <FONT-ITALIC>I am not a Shade. I am Kainé.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Je suis pas une Ombre. Je suis Kainé.</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT-ITALIC>I am not a Shade. I am Kainé.</FONT>

JAP: Repeating this mantra in her mind, she slowly began digging through the rubble of her house, being careful to ignore a certain red-stained spot in the corner. <STOP>Finally, after what seemed like an eternity of heartbreaking work, she found what she was looking for.
FR: Répétant sans cesse ces mots dans sa tête, elle fouilla les ruines de sa maison en faisant bien attention de ne pas s'approcher de la masse rougeâtre gisant dans un coin. <STOP>Après ce qui lui sembla être une éternité, elle trouva enfin ce qu'elle cherchait.
OUPS: Repeating this mantra in her mind, she slowly began digging through the rubble of her house, being careful to ignore a certain red-stained spot in the corner. <STOP>Finally, after what seemed like an eternity of heartbreaking work, she found what she was looking for.

JAP: It was the wreath of Lunar Tears.
FR: C'était la couronne de larmes lunaires.
OUPS: It was the wreath of Lunar Tears.

JAP: Though it had been through hell and back, the garland's petals were as bright as ever.
FR: Même après avoir survécu au désastre, ses pétales étaient plus resplendissants que jamais.
OUPS: Though it had been through hell and back, the garland's petals were as bright as ever.

JAP: Kainé started to place it in her hair, then slowly lowered the wreath and stared at it.
FR: Kainé la leva machinalement vers ses cheveux, mais elle s'arrêta à mi-chemin. Elle rabaissa sa main lentement et admira les fleurs séchées.
OUPS: Kainé started to place it in her hair, then slowly lowered the wreath and stared at it.

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>I'm sorry, Grandma. I'm so sorry.</FONT> <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>But I don't deserve to wear this anymore.</FONT> <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>I'm possessed. Corrupted. A freak.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Mamie, je suis désolée... Je mérite plus de la porter.</FONT> <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>Je suis possédée. Je suis un monstre.</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>I'm sorry, Grandma. I'm so sorry.</FONT> <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>But I don't deserve to wear this anymore.</FONT> <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>I'm possessed. Corrupted. A freak.</FONT>

JAP: <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>And this time, I don't think there's any going back.</FONT>
FR: <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>Cette fois, c'est vrai. Je pourrai plus jamais le nier.</FONT>
OUPS: <STOP><FONT=ITALIC>And this time, I don't think there's any going back.</FONT>

JAP: Holding the flowers to her heart, Kainé fell to the ground and sobbed. <STOP>As night gradually lightened to dawn and the people of The Aerie arose to their daily lives, she remained in that position, as if tears could somehow wash away the horror that now infected her world.
FR: Kainé s'effondra sur le sol et fondit en larmes, tenant les fleurs contre son cœur. <STOP>Elle était toujours dans cette position lorsque les premières lueurs du jour illuminèrent au loin l'horizon et les villageois de l'Aire s'attelèrent à leurs activités quotidiennes. Elle pleurait comme si ses larmes pouvaient laver la souillure qui infectait désormais son âme.
OUPS: Holding the flowers to her heart, Kainé fell to the ground and sobbed. <STOP>As night gradually lightened to dawn and the people of The Aerie arose to their daily lives, she remained in that position, as if tears could somehow wash away the horror that now infected her world.

JAP: So ya went and caught the fish, did ya?
FR: Alors, t'as attrapé le poisson-shaman dont t'avais besoin, c'est ça#?
OUPS: So ya went and caught the fish, did ya?

JAP: Well, since yer so insistent, I suppose I better reveal one'a my fishin' secrets.
FR: Eh bien, puisque t'insistes tant, je suppose que je devrais te révéler une de mes techniques de pêche.
OUPS: Well, since yer so insistent, I suppose I better reveal one'a my fishin' secrets.

JAP: I wasn't insisting that you—
FR: Je ne vous ai rien demandé...
OUPS: I wasn't insisting that you—

JAP: Oh, fine! Twist my arm some more, why don't ya?<PAGE>Well, if you can catch ten sardines, I'll reveal one of my most closely-guarded secrets.
FR: Oh, d'accord, d'accord#! Mais tu me forces la main#!<PAGE>Si t'arrives à attraper dix sardines, je te révélerai une de mes techniques les plus secrètes.
OUPS: Oh, fine! Twist my arm some more, why don't ya?<PAGE>Well, if you can catch ten sardines, I'll reveal one of my most closely-guarded secrets.

JAP: Hey, old timer. I got the fish you wanted.
FR: Hé, vieil homme. J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous m'aviez demandés.
OUPS: Hey, old timer. I got the fish you wanted.

JAP: So ya did, so ya did. Well then, here's a piece of advice for ya...
FR: Oui, oui, je vois. Eh bien, je vais te donner un bon conseil...
OUPS: So ya did, so ya did. Well then, here's a piece of advice for ya...

JAP: Well? Have your fishing fortunes improved?
FR: Eh bien#? T'es-tu amélioré#?
OUPS: Well? Have your fishing fortunes improved?

JAP: I guess. But anyone could get better if they did nothing but fish for two days in a row.
FR: Oui, mais n'importe qui pourrait le faire en pêchant sans arrêt pendant deux jours de suite.
OUPS: I guess. But anyone could get better if they did nothing but fish for two days in a row.

JAP: Go! Catch me ten sardines, and be quick about it!
FR: Va m'attraper dix sardines, et que ça saute#!
OUPS: Go! Catch me ten sardines, and be quick about it!

JAP: Hello again. I have another fishing assignment for you.
FR: Te revoilà. J'ai une autre tâche pour toi.
OUPS: Hello again. I have another fishing assignment for you.

JAP: Hold on. I don't think I agreed to—
FR: Un instant, je n'ai jamais accepté de...
OUPS: Hold on. I don't think I agreed to—

JAP: You're so insistent! It really is too much!<PAGE>Well, your next task is to catch seven blowfish! If you can do that, I'll part with another of my invaluable lessons.
FR: Quel acharnement#! C'en est trop#!<PAGE>Eh bien, ta nouvelle tâche est d'attraper sept poissons-globes#! Si tu arrives à le faire, je t'offrirai un autre de mes précieux conseils.
OUPS: You're so insistent! It really is too much!<PAGE>Well, your next task is to catch seven blowfish! If you can do that, I'll part with another of my invaluable lessons.

JAP: I got your fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: I got your fish.

JAP: Mmmm... There's nothing like a good blowfish soup, let me tell you.
FR: Hum... Y a rien de plus délicieux qu'une soupe de poisson-globe, crois-moi#!
OUPS: Mmmm... There's nothing like a good blowfish soup, let me tell you.

JAP: Well, as promised, here's your next secret. And this one won't take me two days to pass down! Heh heh heh!
FR: Eh bien, comme promis, voici une autre technique secrète. Et cette fois, je te la transmettrai en moins de deux jours#! Hé, hé, hé#!
OUPS: Well, as promised, here's your next secret. And this one won't take me two days to pass down! Heh heh heh!

JAP: By the way, what are you doing with all these fish, old timer?
FR: Au fait, que faites-vous de tous ces poissons#?
OUPS: By the way, what are you doing with all these fish, old timer?

JAP: Eh? I'm eating them! What else would you do with such tasty morsels?
FR: Hein#? Je les mange, pardi#! Qu'est-ce que je pourrais bien en faire d'autre#?
OUPS: Eh? I'm eating them! What else would you do with such tasty morsels?

JAP: Did you catch seven blowfish for me?
FR: As-tu attrapé sept poissons-globes#?
OUPS: Did you catch seven blowfish for me?

JAP: ...Eh? Oh, right. The next assignment. Go and catch me seven rainbow trout, would ya?
FR: ... Hein#? Ah oui, ta prochaine tâche. Attrape-moi sept truites arc-en-ciel#!
OUPS: ...Eh? Oh, right. The next assignment. Go and catch me seven rainbow trout, would ya?

JAP: Gah, another assignment? Though you are doubtless a true man of the sea, I fail to comprehend how you can possibly consume all the fish we are bringing your way.
FR: Encore une tâche#?!<PAGE>Vous êtes un véritable homme de mer, cela ne fait aucun doute, mais je n'arrive pas à croire que vous puissiez vraiment avaler tout le poisson que nous vous apportons.
OUPS: Gah, another assignment? Though you are doubtless a true man of the sea, I fail to comprehend how you can possibly consume all the fish we are bringing your way.

JAP: What I don't eat I sell. But I can eat a lot! Heh heh heh!<PAGE>Now get moving, greenhorn! Them fish won't catch 'emselves!
FR: Je vends ce que je mange pas, mais j'ai un appétit de loup#! Hé, hé, hé#!<PAGE>Allez, qu'est-ce t'attends, marin d'eau douce#? Les poissons mordront pas à l'hameçon tout seuls#!
OUPS: What I don't eat I sell. But I can eat a lot! Heh heh heh!<PAGE>Now get moving, greenhorn! Them fish won't catch 'emselves!

JAP: I've got the fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: I've got the fish.

JAP: Well scratch my back and call me Sally! Them's some rainbow trout, all right! Yer gettin' better, young one!
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! C'est bien de la truite arc-en-ciel#! Tu t'es amélioré, jeunot#!
OUPS: Well scratch my back and call me Sally! Them's some rainbow trout, all right! Yer gettin' better, young one!

JAP: Right! Time for me to teach ya some new pearls'a wisdom. Let's head over to the harbor there.
FR: Bien#! Le moment est venu de partager d'autres trésors de sagesse. Allons sur le quai.
OUPS: Right! Time for me to teach ya some new pearls'a wisdom. Let's head over to the harbor there.

JAP: Fine work, son, fine work. Yer a true man of the sea now, and no denyin'.
FR: Bon travail, jeunot. T'es désormais un homme de mer, toi aussi.
OUPS: Fine work, son, fine work. Yer a true man of the sea now, and no denyin'.

JAP: *Huff... Puff...* I can't...believe...you made me work...on a fishing boat... I oughta...cut you in half...
FR: Aaah... Ooooh... Je n'arrive... pas à croire... que vous m'ayez... forcé à travailler... sur un bateau de pêche... Je devrais... vous pourfendre de mon épée...
OUPS: *Huff... Puff...* I can't...believe...you made me work...on a fishing boat... I oughta...cut you in half...

JAP: The old man is more fearsome than we thought.
FR: Ce vieil homme est plus redoutable que nous ne le pensions.
OUPS: The old man is more fearsome than we thought.

JAP: Right-o! I'll be expectin' my seven rainbow trout, then!
FR: Très bien#! J'ai hâte de déguster mes sept truites arc-en-ciel#!
OUPS: Right-o! I'll be expectin' my seven rainbow trout, then!

JAP: Listen, I'm sorry 'bout that whole fishin' boat thing earlier, but I thought it the best way to teach ya! ...And it worked, yeah?
FR: Écoute, je suis désolé de t'avoir forcé à travailler sur un bateau de pêche, mais c'était vraiment la meilleure façon de t'apprendre mes techniques. T'en es la preuve#!
OUPS: Listen, I'm sorry 'bout that whole fishin' boat thing earlier, but I thought it the best way to teach ya! ...And it worked, yeah?

JAP: This time I got a hankerin' for five bream. Catch 'em, and I'll teach ya one'a my most secret techniques!
FR: Cette fois, j'ai envie de daurade. Si t'en attrapes cinq, je t'enseignerai une de mes techniques les plus secrètes#!
OUPS: This time I got a hankerin' for five bream. Catch 'em, and I'll teach ya one'a my most secret techniques!

JAP: Here's your fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: Here's your fish.

JAP: Well, swab the deck and call me Ishmael! I knew ya could do it! Hand 'em over, whippersnapper!
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! Je savais que t'en serais capable#! Allez, donne-les-moi, jeunot#!
OUPS: Well, swab the deck and call me Ishmael! I knew ya could do it! Hand 'em over, whippersnapper!

JAP: I think these are worth more on the open market than the rainbow trout I caught earlier...
FR: Je crois que ces poissons valent plus que les truites arc-en-ciel que j'ai attrapées la dernière fois...
OUPS: I think these are worth more on the open market than the rainbow trout I caught earlier...

JAP: Worth ain't squat! It's whatcha learn from the catchin' that matters!<PAGE>Now stop all this fool talk 'bout yer wallet and get to practicin'!
FR: Elles valent rien du tout#! C'est ce que t'as appris qui compte#!<PAGE>Arrête de penser seulement à ta bourse et entraîne-toi#!
OUPS: Worth ain't squat! It's whatcha learn from the catchin' that matters!<PAGE>Now stop all this fool talk 'bout yer wallet and get to practicin'!

JAP: *Huff huff* Hey...old timer... What does...200 sit-ups...have to do...with fishing...?
FR: Ouf... Ouf... Dites... qu'est-ce que... 200 tractions... peuvent bien avoir à faire... avec la pêche...?
OUPS: *Huff huff* Hey...old timer... What does...200 sit-ups...have to do...with fishing...?

JAP: Ya won't be catchin' anything with those scrawny arms. We got to buff 'em up!
FR: Tu pourras rien attraper avec des bras aussi frêles#! Il faut les renforcer#!
OUPS: Ya won't be catchin' anything with those scrawny arms. We got to buff 'em up!

JAP: Off you go! I want to see five bream!<PAGE>And don't start poutin', or a seagull's gonna walk on yer lip!
FR: Ouste#! Je veux cinq daurades#! Et fais pas la moue comme une fillette, les mouettes pourraient venir s'y poser#!
OUPS: Off you go! I want to see five bream!<PAGE>And don't start poutin', or a seagull's gonna walk on yer lip!

JAP: Today's assignment is five black bass! Go and give it everything ya got, rookie!
FR: Aujourd'hui, ta tâche est de pêcher cinq perches noires#! Fais de ton mieux#!
OUPS: Today's assignment is five black bass! Go and give it everything ya got, rookie!

JAP: I trust that you are not abusing our labors for the purpose of easy profit, old man?
FR: J'espère que vous n'abusez pas de nos efforts afin de faire des profits, vieillard#!
OUPS: I trust that you are not abusing our labors for the purpose of easy profit, old man?

JAP: Oh, and would a little compensation be a bad thing? I'm teachin' invaluable techniques here, ya floating magazine!
FR: Oh, tu refuserais de me payer ce à quoi j'ai droit#? Je lui enseigne pourtant des techniques inestimables, espèce de brochure volante#!
OUPS: Oh, and would a little compensation be a bad thing? I'm teachin' invaluable techniques here, ya floating magazine!

JAP: Lies! It is clear that money is your ultimate goal.<PAGE>And I am NOT to be referred to as a magazine!
FR: Vous mentez#! Votre but est manifestement de vous enrichir.<PAGE>...#Et je ne suis pas une brochure#!
OUPS: Lies! It is clear that money is your ultimate goal.<PAGE>And I am NOT to be referred to as a magazine!

JAP: I caught the fish, old timer.
FR: J'ai attrapé les poissons que vous vouliez.
OUPS: I caught the fish, old timer.

JAP: Well, raise the mainsail and call me Cletus! That's some nice work, youngster.<PAGE>Keep it up, and ya just might have a chance of catching...The Fish.
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! Bon travail, petit#!<PAGE>Si tu continues ainsi, tu pourras peut-être attraper... le Poisson.
OUPS: Well, raise the mainsail and call me Cletus! That's some nice work, youngster.<PAGE>Keep it up, and ya just might have a chance of catching...The Fish.

JAP: Which fish?
FR: Quel poisson#?
OUPS: Which fish?

JAP: Never ya mind! Time ain't right yet. Now lemme show ya the next technique...
FR: C'est pas important#! Le moment est pas encore venu. Laisse-moi te montrer une autre technique...
OUPS: Never ya mind! Time ain't right yet. Now lemme show ya the next technique...

JAP: Yer on a whole different level now, ya wee minnow! Don't ya agree?
FR: Tu maîtrises de plus en plus l'art de la pêche, jeunot#! Tu trouves pas#?
OUPS: Yer on a whole different level now, ya wee minnow! Don't ya agree?

JAP: No, I've certainly improved. I just don't understand why you wouldn't tell me so unless I bought you drinks in the local tavern.
FR: Je ne peux pas nier que je me suis amélioré. Cependant, je ne comprends pas pourquoi vous l'affirmez sans que je ne vous aie payé un verre à la taverne.
OUPS: No, I've certainly improved. I just don't understand why you wouldn't tell me so unless I bought you drinks in the local tavern.

JAP: Quit frettin'! You'll go bald.
FR: Arrête de t'inquiéter pour rien#! Ça rend chauve#!
OUPS: Quit frettin'! You'll go bald.

JAP: Do ya have my five black bass?
FR: M'as-tu apporté cinq perches noires#?
OUPS: Do ya have my five black bass?

JAP: (Excuse me, sir. I have an urgent request.)
FR: (Excusez-moi. J'ai une requête urgente à vous transmettre.)
OUPS: (Excuse me, sir. I have an urgent request.)

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: (We've received word that bandits are breaking into the Barren Temple. However, the rules prevent us from entering the temple and dispatching the intruders.)
FR: (Nous avons entendu dire que des pillards se sont infiltrés dans le temple stérile. Cependant, la loi nous empêche d'y pénétrer afin d'éliminer les intrus.)
OUPS: (We've received word that bandits are breaking into the Barren Temple. However, the rules prevent us from entering the temple and dispatching the intruders.)

JAP: (Therefore, we would like you to eliminate the thieves in our stead.)
FR: (Pourriez-vous vous en occuper#?)
OUPS: (Therefore, we would like you to eliminate the thieves in our stead.)

JAP: Finally! A job with some killin'!
FR: Enfin un travail avec de l'action#!
OUPS: Finally! A job with some killin'!

JAP: (Please be careful. It's bad enough that the bandits are in our most sacred place, but if they were to touch the seal...)
FR: (Soyez prudents#! Si les pillards touchent au sceau du temple...)
OUPS: (Please be careful. It's bad enough that the bandits are in our most sacred place, but if they were to touch the seal...)

JAP: ...What seal?
FR: ... Quel sceau#?
OUPS: ...What seal?

JAP: (Legend tells of a powerful Shade that has been sealed away in a section of the temple.)
FR: (La légende raconte qu'une Ombre puissante est scellée quelque part dans le temple.)
OUPS: (Legend tells of a powerful Shade that has been sealed away in a section of the temple.)

JAP: (If they stumble across it during their search for treasure...)
FR: (S'ils brisent le sceau en cherchant des trésors...)
OUPS: (If they stumble across it during their search for treasure...)

JAP: Mmm, yes, that would be bad. ...And for the bandits as well.
FR: Hum, oui, cela serait désastreux et pas seulement pour les pillards.
OUPS: Mmm, yes, that would be bad. ...And for the bandits as well.

JAP: Okay, so we have to hurry. Got it.
FR: D'accord, nous ferions mieux de nous dépêcher.
OUPS: Okay, so we have to hurry. Got it.

JAP: (Please dispatch the bandits for us!)
FR: (S'il vous plaît, éliminez les pillards#!)
OUPS: (Please dispatch the bandits for us!)

JAP: Hmm? Someone's in front of the temple.
FR: Tiens, il y a quelqu'un devant le temple...
OUPS: Hmm? Someone's in front of the temple.

JAP: H-help! Heeeeeelp!
FR: À l'aide#! À l'aiiiiiide#!
OUPS: H-help! Heeeeeelp!

JAP: You one of the guys trying to bust up the temple? Why should I help you?
FR: N'es-tu pas un des pillards#? Pourquoi devrais-je te porter secours#?
OUPS: You one of the guys trying to bust up the temple? Why should I help you?

JAP: Th-there's a huge Shade inside! We were just looking for treas...<PAGE>I mean, um...<PAGE>Anyway, it's HUGE!
FR: Y a une Ombre gigantesque à l'intérieur#! On était à la recherche de tré...<PAGE>Euh, je veux dire...<PAGE>Elle est vraiment énorme, cette Ombre#!
OUPS: Th-there's a huge Shade inside! We were just looking for treas...<PAGE>I mean, um...<PAGE>Anyway, it's HUGE!

JAP: I made it out, but my fellow thiev...<PAGE>I mean, uh...<PAGE>But my friends are still in there!
FR: J'ai réussi à trouver la sortie, mais les autres vol...<PAGE>Euh, je veux dire...<PAGE>... mes compagnons sont toujours à l'intérieur#!
OUPS: I made it out, but my fellow thiev...<PAGE>I mean, uh...<PAGE>But my friends are still in there!

JAP: It seems the worst-case scenario has come to pass.
FR: Il semblerait que le pire soit arrivé.
OUPS: It seems the worst-case scenario has come to pass.

JAP: Screw these guys. They made their bed, now let 'em shit in it.
FR: Qu'ils aillent se faire foutre. Ils peuvent récolter eux-mêmes la merde qu'ils ont semée.
OUPS: Screw these guys. They made their bed, now let 'em shit in it.

JAP: If that Shade is as big as they claim, it's too dangerous to let it live.
FR: Si cette Ombre est aussi énorme qu'il le prétend, nous ne pouvons pas la laisser vivre.
OUPS: If that Shade is as big as they claim, it's too dangerous to let it live.

JAP: Let's go in and take care of the Shade.
FR: Allons nous en débarrasser.
OUPS: Let's go in and take care of the Shade.

JAP: That Shade's got my friends! You gotta help 'em out!
FR: L'Ombre a attaqué mes amis#! Vous devez les aider#!
OUPS: That Shade's got my friends! You gotta help 'em out!

JAP: They had it coming, I'd say.<PAGE>And if you try to run, I'll have my friend Kainé show you what pain really is. Got it?
FR: À mon avis, ils méritent bien leur sort.<PAGE>Oh, et si tu essaies de t'enfuir, Kainé te fera endurer le paroxysme de la douleur. Compris#?
OUPS: They had it coming, I'd say.<PAGE>And if you try to run, I'll have my friend Kainé show you what pain really is. Got it?

JAP: I'm getting outta here before those guys get ba—
FR: Je ferais mieux de filer avant que ces...
OUPS: I'm getting outta here before those guys get ba—

JAP: Oh ho! I'm afraid you came up with that brilliant scheme a little too late!
FR: Oh, ho#! J'ai bien peur qu'il ne soit trop tard pour exécuter ton plan de génie#!
OUPS: Oh ho! I'm afraid you came up with that brilliant scheme a little too late!

JAP: Gahh! Dammit!
FR: Gaaah#! Merde#!
OUPS: Gahh! Dammit!

JAP: Augh!
FR: Aaaaah#!
OUPS: Augh!

JAP: Oh, knock it off.
FR: Oh, mais arrête de faire l'idiot#!
OUPS: Oh, knock it off.

JAP: Shut up, you!
FR: La ferme#!
OUPS: Shut up, you!

JAP: I'll get you! I'll get you for this!
FR: Vous me le paierez, vous m'entendez#! Vous me le paierez#!!
OUPS: I'll get you! I'll get you for this!

JAP: Hey, asshole. There's a kid back in town who wants to play marbles, but he's two short. Think you can help?
FR: Hé, trouduc. Y a un môme en ville qui veut jouer aux billes, mais il lui en manque deux. Ça te dirait de l'aider#?
OUPS: Hey, asshole. There's a kid back in town who wants to play marbles, but he's two short. Think you can help?

JAP: Eeeeek! Keep her away from me!
FR: Aaaah#! Arrêtez-la#!
OUPS: Eeeeek! Keep her away from me!

JAP: That was some excellent restraint on your part, hussy. I expected a foul-mouthed tirade of epic proportions!
FR: Je ne savais pas que tu pouvais faire preuve d'autant de retenue, dévergondée. Je m'attendais à une de tes célèbres tirades grossières#!
OUPS: That was some excellent restraint on your part, hussy. I expected a foul-mouthed tirade of epic proportions!

JAP: Cram it up your index, book.
FR: Va te faire foutre, bouquin.
OUPS: Cram it up your index, book.

JAP: You guys done?<PAGE>Then let's tie this guy up and report back.
FR: Vous avez terminé#?<PAGE>Ligotons-le et retournons à Façade.
OUPS: You guys done?<PAGE>Then let's tie this guy up and report back.

JAP: I heard you threw that bandit in the clink. ...Probably better than he deserves.
FR: J'ai entendu dire que vous avez mis le pillard en prison. Il méritait probablement une peine plus sévère...
OUPS: I heard you threw that bandit in the clink. ...Probably better than he deserves.

JAP: The seal was open when we got there, but we managed to defeat the Shade.
FR: Quand nous sommes arrivés, le sceau était brisé, mais nous avons réussi à vaincre l'Ombre.
OUPS: The seal was open when we got there, but we managed to defeat the Shade.

JAP: (Thank you. I knew you were up to the task.)
FR: (Merci beaucoup. Je savais que vous en seriez capable.)
OUPS: (Thank you. I knew you were up to the task.)

JAP: (The king sends this payment with his compliments.)
FR: (Le roi vous est reconnaissant et désire vous offrir cette récompense.)
OUPS: (The king sends this payment with his compliments.)

JAP: Hey, you got a moment?
FR: Dites...
OUPS: Hey, you got a moment?

JAP: You used to be friends with the lighthouse lady, right?
FR: Vous étiez l'ami de la vieille femme du phare, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: You used to be friends with the lighthouse lady, right?

JAP: As I remember it, we basically hated each other.
FR: Si je me souviens bien, nous nous détestions mutuellement.
OUPS: As I remember it, we basically hated each other.

JAP: Oh. ...Well, you at least talked to her, right? Could I ask you for a favor?
FR: Oh...#Bah, au moins vous lui adressiez la parole, non#?<PAGE>Pourriez-vous me rendre service#?
OUPS: Oh. ...Well, you at least talked to her, right? Could I ask you for a favor?

JAP: What's the job?
FR: Vous voulez m'offrir du travail#?
OUPS: What's the job?

JAP: The lighthouse is in good shape now, but it's going to wear out eventually; we'd like to have replacement parts ready.
FR: Le phare est en bonne condition actuellement, mais il faudra bien le rénover un de ces jours.<PAGE>Nous aimerions nous procurer les matériaux nécessaires pour être prêts le moment venu.
OUPS: The lighthouse is in good shape now, but it's going to wear out eventually; we'd like to have replacement parts ready.

JAP: Can you get the parts from the Junk Heap?
FR: Pourriez-vous aller les chercher dans la montagne des robots#?
OUPS: Can you get the parts from the Junk Heap?

JAP: I'm sure the lighthouse lady would be appreciative, wherever she is.
FR: Je suis certain que la vieille femme du phare apprécierait votre aide, où qu'elle soit désormais.
OUPS: I'm sure the lighthouse lady would be appreciative, wherever she is.

JAP: I can't believe I'm helping her again. ...But all right. I'll do it.
FR: Qui aurait cru que je l'aiderais de nouveau...?<PAGE>D'accord, j'accepte.
OUPS: I can't believe I'm helping her again. ...But all right. I'll do it.

JAP: Thank you. I think we'll need ten broken lenses and ten broken batteries.
FR: Merci. Je crois que nous aurons besoin de dix lentilles brisées et dix batteries à plat.
OUPS: Thank you. I think we'll need ten broken lenses and ten broken batteries.

JAP: And while you're at it, ten mysterious switches would be nice, too.
FR: Et pourquoi pas dix leviers mystérieux pendant que vous y êtes#!
OUPS: And while you're at it, ten mysterious switches would be nice, too.

JAP: I've got your gear.
FR: J'ai les matériaux dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I've got your gear.

JAP: Thanks. Here's your payment.
FR: Merci bien. Voici votre récompense.
OUPS: Thanks. Here's your payment.

JAP: The old lady's gone now, but we need to keep this lighthouse going.
FR: La vieille femme n'est plus de ce monde, mais nous devons tout de même entretenir le phare.
OUPS: The old lady's gone now, but we need to keep this lighthouse going.

JAP: We'll need ten broken lenses, ten broken batteries, and ten mysterious switches.
FR: Nous aurons besoin de dix lentilles brisées, dix batteries à plat et dix leviers mystérieux.
OUPS: We'll need ten broken lenses, ten broken batteries, and ten mysterious switches.

JAP: Ah, it's you! I've heard a great many stories about you. Making quite the name for yourself, hmm?
FR: Ah, c'est vous#! J'ai entendu plusieurs histoires intéressantes à votre sujet. Vous vous êtes fait toute une réputation#!
OUPS: Ah, it's you! I've heard a great many stories about you. Making quite the name for yourself, hmm?

JAP: I don't know about that.
FR: Si vous le dites.
OUPS: I don't know about that.

JAP: Oh, no need to be so modest. After all, I may have a job for someone with your particular...talents.
FR: Oh, ne soyez pas si modeste. J'ai justement du travail pour quelqu'un qui possède... vos talents particuliers.
OUPS: Oh, no need to be so modest. After all, I may have a job for someone with your particular...talents.

JAP: I'm listening.
FR: Je vous écoute.
OUPS: I'm listening.

JAP: I need you to retrieve some cargo from a ship that wrecked at sea.<PAGE>To recover it all would be a monumental task, so you should concentrate on three crates of particular importance.
FR: Un navire qui transportait mes marchandises s'est échoué et j'aimerais les récupérer. Pas toutes, bien sûr#! Ce serait une tâche monumentale#!<PAGE>Toutefois, trois caisses étaient plus importantes que les autres.
OUPS: I need you to retrieve some cargo from a ship that wrecked at sea.<PAGE>To recover it all would be a monumental task, so you should concentrate on three crates of particular importance.

JAP: This cargo has likely washed ashore on all the far-flung corners of the world, so it will be a task of some difficulty. Can I count on your assistance?
FR: La cargaison a probablement été éparpillée le long de la côte, alors il ne sera pas facile de les retrouver. Pourriez-vous me prêter assistance#?
OUPS: This cargo has likely washed ashore on all the far-flung corners of the world, so it will be a task of some difficulty. Can I count on your assistance?

JAP: Sure.
FR: Bien sûr.
OUPS: Sure.

JAP: Ah, excellent, excellent. Oh, and one more thing...<PAGE>Whatever you do, you must not unseal the cargo.
FR: Ah, excellent#! Oh, j'oubliais presque...<PAGE>Quoi qu'il arrive, n'ouvrez pas mes caisses.
OUPS: Ah, excellent, excellent. Oh, and one more thing...<PAGE>Whatever you do, you must not unseal the cargo.

JAP: Well, now I'm curious. Why can't I open it?
FR: Hum, vous avez éveillé ma curiosité. Pourquoi pas#?
OUPS: Well, now I'm curious. Why can't I open it?

JAP: Well, there were some rather...unique products that I was shipping. If you were to see them, it might place me in something of a dilemma.
FR: Euh, elles contiennent des marchandises... exclusives. Si vous les ouvriez, cela pourrait me causer des ennuis.
OUPS: Well, there were some rather...unique products that I was shipping. If you were to see them, it might place me in something of a dilemma.

JAP: Hey, you're the gal with the money. You don't want me to look? Fine. I won't look.
FR: D'accord. Puisque vous me le demandez, je réprimerai ma curiosité. C'est vous qui payez mon salaire, après tout.
OUPS: Hey, you're the gal with the money. You don't want me to look? Fine. I won't look.

JAP: Ah, and a man of reason on top of everything else! Oh, I do so appreciate your help in this matter.
FR: Ah, un homme raisonnable en plus#! Je vous suis vraiment reconnaissante pour votre aide.
OUPS: Ah, and a man of reason on top of everything else! Oh, I do so appreciate your help in this matter.

JAP: I think this is one of the pieces of cargo that washed ashore.
FR: Je crois que c'est une des caisses du navire qui s'est échoué.
OUPS: I think this is one of the pieces of cargo that washed ashore.

JAP: <LIST=1472>Pick it up without looking inside.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1472>Ramasser la caisse sans l'ouvrir.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1472>Pick it up without looking inside.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1473>Pick it up and look inside.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1473>Ouvrir la caisse.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1473>Pick it up and look inside.</LIST>

JAP: She asked me not to look. This'll go down easier if I do what she wants.
FR: Elle m'a demandé de ne pas regarder à l'intérieur. Mieux vaut lui obéir.
OUPS: She asked me not to look. This'll go down easier if I do what she wants.

JAP: No offense to that lady, but I'm not carrying around some box unless I know what's inside.
FR: Je ne peux pas transporter quelque chose sans en connaître le contenu. J'espère que la vieille femme ne m'en voudra pas trop.
OUPS: No offense to that lady, but I'm not carrying around some box unless I know what's inside.

JAP: Have you assuaged your guilt with that feeble excuse? Then I suggest we...<PAGE>Hello. What have we here?
FR: Est-ce la meilleure excuse que tu as pu trouver#? Dans ce cas, je propose de...<PAGE>Tiens, tiens. Qu'avons-nous là#?
OUPS: Have you assuaged your guilt with that feeble excuse? Then I suggest we...<PAGE>Hello. What have we here?

JAP: What in the hell? I've never seen flowers like these.<PAGE>...Ugh! They smell terrible!
FR: Mais qu'est-ce que...? Je n'ai jamais vu de fleurs pareilles.<PAGE>Beurk...! Elles sentent vraiment mauvais#!
OUPS: What in the hell? I've never seen flowers like these.<PAGE>...Ugh! They smell terrible!

JAP: I believe they can be refined into a powerful, yet poisonous, drug. I doubt very much that they are legal.
FR: Je crois qu'on peut les transformer en une drogue puissante et mortelle. Je doute vraiment qu'il soit légal d'en faire le commerce.
OUPS: I believe they can be refined into a powerful, yet poisonous, drug. I doubt very much that they are legal.

FR: Je crois que c'est une des caisses du navire qui s'est échoué.
OUPS: I think this is one of the pieces of cargo that washed ashore.

OUPS: Have you assuaged your guilt with that feeble excuse? Then I suggest we...<PAGE>Hello. What have we here?

JAP: Whatever it is, it's been waterproofed somehow. ...And it smells like explosives.
FR: Quoi que ce soit, cet emballage est imperméable.<PAGE>... Et il sent la poudre noire.
OUPS: Whatever it is, it's been waterproofed somehow. ...And it smells like explosives.

JAP: This is some rather dangerous cargo we've been asked to find.
FR: On nous a demandé de trouver des marchandises plutôt dangereuses.
OUPS: This is some rather dangerous cargo we've been asked to find.

JAP: I think this is one of the pieces of cargo that washed ashore.
FR: Je crois que c'est une des caisses du navire qui s'est échoué.

FR: Est-ce la meilleure excuse que tu as pu trouver#? Dans ce cas, je propose de...<PAGE>Tiens, tiens. Qu'avons-nous là#?
OUPS: Have you assuaged your guilt with that feeble excuse? Then I suggest we...<PAGE>Hello. What have we here?

JAP: Unlabeled medicine bottles? ...And there's some kind of white powder inside.
FR: Des fioles...? On dirait qu'elles sont remplies de granules blanches.
OUPS: Unlabeled medicine bottles? ...And there's some kind of white powder inside.

JAP: Ho! Given how carefully they were packed, I doubt we are dealing with sugar!
FR: Hum#! Compte tenu de l'épaisseur de l'emballage, je ne crois pas qu'il s'agisse de sucre.
OUPS: Ho! Given how carefully they were packed, I doubt we are dealing with sugar!

JAP: Okay, that's all the cargo. Let's take it back to the client.
FR: Bon, nous avons récupéré toutes les caisses. Rapportons-les à la vieille femme.
OUPS: Okay, that's all the cargo. Let's take it back to the client.

JAP: Well, that seems to be all of it.
FR: Eh bien, je crois que tout y est.
OUPS: Well, that seems to be all of it.

JAP: A tremendous cache of illegal goods and dangerous materials! I'd wager my title page that our client is a smuggler.
FR: Toutes ces marchandises sont illégales ou très dangereuses#! Je parie ma page de titre que cette vieille femme est une contrebandière.
OUPS: A tremendous cache of illegal goods and dangerous materials! I'd wager my title page that our client is a smuggler.

JAP: So what should we do?
FR: Que devrions-nous faire#?
OUPS: So what should we do?

JAP: <LIST=1480>Deliver the cargo to the client.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1480>Remettre les caisses à la vieille femme.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1480>Deliver the cargo to the client.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1481>Report it to the Seafront authorities.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1481>Dénoncer la vieille femme aux autorités de Littoral.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1481>Report it to the Seafront authorities.</LIST>

JAP: Smuggled or not, I'll do what I committed to do. Let's take this back to the client.
FR: Contrebande ou pas, je dois mener ma tâche à bien. Rapportons ces caisses à la vieille femme.
OUPS: Smuggled or not, I'll do what I committed to do. Let's take this back to the client.

JAP: I don't want to be a party to smuggling...or worse. Let's talk to the guard at the entrance.
FR: Je ne veux pas être mêlé à de la contrebande ou quelque chose de pire... Adressons-nous au garde à l'entrée de la ville.
OUPS: I don't want to be a party to smuggling...or worse. Let's talk to the guard at the entrance.

JAP: We've got your cargo.
FR: Nous avons récupéré vos marchandises.
OUPS: We've got your cargo.

JAP: Ah, excellent! And everything seems to be in good condition...
FR: Ah, excellent#! Et tout semble avoir survécu...
OUPS: Ah, excellent! And everything seems to be in good condition...

JAP: Here is your payment. Please take it.
FR: Tenez, voici votre récompense.
OUPS: Here is your payment. Please take it.

JAP: Also, I know the owner of the item shop in this town. I think you should find your future transactions there a bit more welcoming.
FR: Au fait, je connais l'apothicaire de la ville. Je crois que vous y trouverez désormais un service des plus prévenants.
OUPS: Also, I know the owner of the item shop in this town. I think you should find your future transactions there a bit more welcoming.

JAP: That's good news.
FR: J'en suis ravi.
OUPS: That's good news.

JAP: Oh, you know how it is. In my line of work, people tend to owe you favors.<PAGE>Anyway, I'd best be off!
FR: Oh, ce n'est rien. Mon métier possède certains avantages, voilà tout.<PAGE>Au revoir#!
OUPS: Oh, you know how it is. In my line of work, people tend to owe you favors.<PAGE>Anyway, I'd best be off!

JAP: Hey, the, uh, import-export dame, she told me about ya. Says you're a good guy.<PAGE>So listen, I got some stuff that's, uh, special, ya know? All under the table or in the back room or whatever. Anyways, I'll sell it to ya for a good price!
FR: Ah, bonjour. La négociante m'a parlé de vous. Elle dit qu'on peut vous faire confiance.<PAGE>J'ai, euh... des marchandises spéciales. C'est sous le manteau, hein#? Je vous ferai un bon prix#!
OUPS: Hey, the, uh, import-export dame, she told me about ya. Says you're a good guy.<PAGE>So listen, I got some stuff that's, uh, special, ya know? All under the table or in the back room or whatever. Anyways, I'll sell it to ya for a good price!

JAP: You tell that dame I said hey, yeah?
FR: Dites bonjour à la négociante de ma part, d'accord#?
OUPS: You tell that dame I said hey, yeah?

JAP: Excuse me, but these things washed up on the shore, and—
FR: Pardon, j'ai trouvé ces caisses rejetées sur la rive...
OUPS: Excuse me, but these things washed up on the shore, and—

JAP: Good gravy! This is illegal! ...ALL OF THIS is illegal! Where did you get this!?
FR: Sapristi#! De la contrebande#! Toutes ces marchandises sont illégales#! Où les avez-vous trouvées#?
OUPS: Good gravy! This is illegal! ...ALL OF THIS is illegal! Where did you get this!?

JAP: Well, that's a long story...
FR: C'est une longue histoire...
OUPS: Well, that's a long story...

JAP: ...Ah-ha! So the old broad finally slipped up!
FR: Ha, ha#! Cette vieille chipie a finalement fait une erreur#!
OUPS: ...Ah-ha! So the old broad finally slipped up!

JAP: So you are familiar with her little import-export business?

JAP: Oh, we've been watching her for years. There's a huge bounty on her head in the next continent.

OUPS: We always suspected it was her, but never had proof she was really the same person.

JAP: But now we've got more than enough evidence to put her away! You have done a fine thing this day, citizen!
FR: Cependant, cette fois, nous la tenons#! Littoral vous remercie#!
OUPS: But now we've got more than enough evidence to put her away! You have done a fine thing this day, citizen!

JAP: Hello again! Thanks to your information, the old woman is behind bars. And she's gonna rot there!
FR: Oh, bonjour#! Grâce à vous, la contrebandière est en prison et elle y croupira jusqu'à la fin de ses jours#!

JAP: Oh. Well, I guess that's good news?

JAP: It's waiting for you at the post office.

OUPS: It's waiting for you at the post office.

JAP: You can accept your reward at the post office.
FR: Allez réclamer votre récompense au bureau de poste.
OUPS: You can accept your reward at the post office.

JAP: Hey there, bounty hunter! Come to collect, have you?
FR: Tiens, le chasseur de primes#! Vous venez réclamer votre récompense#?
OUPS: Hey there, bounty hunter! Come to collect, have you?

JAP: Yep.
FR: C'est exact.
OUPS: Yep.

JAP: Let's see, where'd I put it... Oh, here it is.
FR: Voyons voir, où ai-je bien pu la mettre... Ah#! La voilà#!
OUPS: Let's see, where'd I put it... Oh, here it is.

JAP: Crap. That's a lot of money.
FR: Mince#! Quel montant énorme...!
OUPS: Crap. That's a lot of money.

JAP: Oh, that's nothing. You should have seen the cut those guards took before you got here!
FR: Oh, il ne reste pas grand-chose maintenant que les gardes ont pris leur part#!
OUPS: Oh, that's nothing. You should have seen the cut those guards took before you got here!

JAP: That woman must have been among the world's most wanted criminals.
FR: Elle devait être la femme la plus recherchée au monde.
OUPS: That woman must have been among the world's most wanted criminals.

JAP: Excuse me... Uh, sir?
FR: Excusez-moi... Pardon, monsieur#?
OUPS: Excuse me... Uh, sir?

JAP: What, me?
FR: Oh, c'est à moi que vous vous adressez#?
OUPS: What, me?

FR: Oui. Les gens disent que vous êtes un agent habile et discret.
OUPS: Yes, yes. People have been talking. They say you're a very adept freelance agent.

FR: Je suis joaillière et je suis à la recherche d'une pierre précieuse, la larme de sirène.
OUPS: I'm a jeweler by trade, you see, and I am currently in search of a precious gem known as the Mermaid Tear.

JAP: Have you ever heard of it, sir?
FR: En avez-vous déjà entendu parler#?
OUPS: Have you ever heard of it, sir?

JAP: I don't know much about jewelry.
FR: Je ne m'y connais pas vraiment en bijoux.
OUPS: I don't know much about jewelry.

JAP: Yes, yes, of course. Why would you?<PAGE>Well, then let me tell you I believe the Tear to be located somewhere in this very town. I am close now. So very close...
FR: Non, bien sûr que non. Vous n'avez aucune raison de la connaître.<PAGE>Eh bien, je crois que la larme de sirène se trouve quelque part dans cette ville. J'y suis presque...!
OUPS: Yes, yes, of course. Why would you?<PAGE>Well, then let me tell you I believe the Tear to be located somewhere in this very town. I am close now. So very close...

FR: On dirait qu'elle est bien plus qu'une simple pierre à vos yeux.
OUPS: This seems like more than a business transaction for you.

JAP: You see to the core of me, sir. The Mermaid Tear is one of my family's most precious heirlooms.
FR: Ah, je ne peux rien vous cacher#! La larme de sirène est un des biens les plus importants de ma famille.
OUPS: You see to the core of me, sir. The Mermaid Tear is one of my family's most precious heirlooms.

OUPS: My grandfather was the original possessor, but upon his death some fifty years ago, the jewel vanished without a trace.

FR: J'ai passé ma vie entière à sa recherche et ma quête m'a guidée jusqu'ici. Elle doit être dans cette ville#!

JAP: Well, I'd be happy to help with the search.

JAP: A thousand thank-yous, good sir! Having the assistance of a local will surely make the search that much more fruitful.

OUPS: A thousand thank-yous, good sir! Having the assistance of a local will surely make the search that much more fruitful.

JAP: Not a problem.
FR: Ce n'est rien.
OUPS: Not a problem.

JAP: Ah, the noble quester returns! How goes the search?
FR: Ah, le noble aventurier est de retour#! Avez-vous découvert quelque chose#?
OUPS: Ah, the noble quester returns! How goes the search?

JAP: The Mermaid Tear? Hmm... I know I've heard that name before. Maybe someone in town mentioned it?
FR: La larme de sirène#? Hum... J'ai déjà entendu ce nom quelque part... Un autre habitant m'en a peut-être parlé.
OUPS: The Mermaid Tear? Hmm... I know I've heard that name before. Maybe someone in town mentioned it?

JAP: The Mermaid Tear? Never heard of it.
FR: La larme de sirène#? Non, je n'en ai jamais entendu parler.
OUPS: The Mermaid Tear? Never heard of it.

JAP: The lighthouse lady would've been the one to ask; she knew everything about precious stones.
FR: Oh, c'est une pierre précieuse#? La vieille femme du phare était experte en la matière, vous savez.
OUPS: The lighthouse lady would've been the one to ask; she knew everything about precious stones.

JAP: There's two letters here for the lighthouse lady.<PAGE>...Whoa. According to the postmark, they're fifty years old.
FR: Hum, deux lettres adressées à la vieille femme du phare...<PAGE>Selon le cachet de la poste, elles datent d'il y a 50 ans...!
OUPS: There's two letters here for the lighthouse lady.<PAGE>...Whoa. According to the postmark, they're fifty years old.

JAP: Didn't that jeweler say the Mermaid Tear was lost fifty years ago?
FR: La joaillière n'a-t-elle pas dit que la larme de sirène a disparu il y a 50 ans#?
OUPS: Didn't that jeweler say the Mermaid Tear was lost fifty years ago?

JAP: Perhaps this is more than coincidence, hmm? It may behoove us to sneak a look inside these letters.
FR: Ce n'est peut-être pas qu'une coïncidence. Nous devrions sans doute les lire.

JAP: Here's the first letter.
FR: Voyons voir la première lettre...
OUPS: Here's the first letter.

JAP: ...I am enclosing the Mermaid Tear with my next letter. It is the only thing I have found in this world that can hope to compare to your beauty.
FR: «#Je t'enverrai la larme de sirène avec ma prochaine lettre. Nul autre objet en ce monde ne pourrait être digne de ta beauté.#»
OUPS: ...I am enclosing the Mermaid Tear with my next letter. It is the only thing I have found in this world that can hope to compare to your beauty.

OUPS: And here's the second one.

JAP: My dearest, I fear I cannot send the Mermaid Tear at this time. I hope you can forgive me for this terrible slight.
FR: «#Ma bien-aimée, Il m'est pour le moment impossible de te faire parvenir la larme de sirène.#»<PAGE>«#J'espère que tu me pardonneras cette grave offense.#»
OUPS: My dearest, I fear I cannot send the Mermaid Tear at this time. I hope you can forgive me for this terrible slight.

JAP: So the Mermaid Tear was supposed to go to the lighthouse lady, but never made it.
FR: Alors, la vieille femme du phare n'a jamais reçu la larme de sirène qui lui avait été promise.
OUPS: So the Mermaid Tear was supposed to go to the lighthouse lady, but never made it.

JAP: And yet the Tear is no longer with its original owner. What can we conclude from this?
FR: Toutefois, elle n'est plus en la possession de la famille de la joaillière. Que pouvons-nous en déduire#?
OUPS: And yet the Tear is no longer with its original owner. What can we conclude from this?

JAP: Hmmm... The second letter was sent from Seafront. Which means the postman's father had started writing letters by that time.
FR: Hum... La deuxième lettre a été envoyée de Littoral, ce qui veut dire que c'est le père du postier qui l'a écrite.
OUPS: Hmmm... The second letter was sent from Seafront. Which means the postman's father had started writing letters by that time.

JAP: And therefore, the jewel must have made its way to this town...<PAGE>I smell a rat. To the post office!
FR: Et donc, la pierre doit avoir atteint Littoral...<PAGE>Il y a anguille sous roche. Allons au bureau de poste#!
OUPS: And therefore, the jewel must have made its way to this town...<PAGE>I smell a rat. To the post office!

FR: Oh, bonjour#! Comment puis-je vous être utile#?
OUPS: Oh, hello. What can I do you for?

JAP: I'm looking for a package addressed to the lighthouse lady. It would be about fifty years old.
FR: Auriez-vous un colis pour la vieille femme du phare quelque part#? Il devrait dater d'il y a 50 ans.
OUPS: I'm looking for a package addressed to the lighthouse lady. It would be about fifty years old.

JAP: ...You want a package from half a century ago?
FR: ... Vous pensez que j'aurais gardé un colis pendant 50 ans#?
OUPS: ...You want a package from half a century ago?

JAP: Your father was the previous postman, right? Did he even mention something like that to you?
FR: Votre père était postier avant vous, n'est-ce pas#? Ne vous a-t-il jamais parlé d'un tel colis#?
OUPS: Your father was the previous postman, right? Did he even mention something like that to you?

JAP: No. He just told me to keep writing the letters.
FR: Non, il ne m'a demandé que de continuer d'écrire les lettres.
OUPS: No. He just told me to keep writing the letters.

JAP: But we keep all of our unclaimed packages in the storage room. So if she didn't pick it up, it's probably still there.
FR: Mais tous les colis non réclamés sont dans l'entrepôt. Si la vieille femme n'est jamais venue le chercher, votre colis y est peut-être toujours.

OUPS: Great. I'm just going to take a look around.

FR: Avez-vous trouvé le colis que vous cherchiez#?
OUPS: Did you find the package?

FR: Un colis d'il y a 50 ans... J'espère que les rats ne l'ont pas dévoré.

JAP: ...Is this it?
FR: Voyons voir...
OUPS: ...Is this it?

FR: Il est adressé à la vieille femme du phare et le cachet de poste date de 50 ans...<PAGE>Regarde#! Voilà la pierre#! Dépêche-toi de lire la lettre#!
OUPS: It bears her name, and the postmark is fifty years old...<PAGE>Look! The jewel lies inside! Quickly, what does the letter say?

FR: «#Comme promis, je t'envoie la larme de sirène. Malheureusement, une triste nouvelle accompagne mon cadeau.#»
OUPS: As promised, I am enclosing the Mermaid Tear. Unfortunately, with this gift comes a piece of sad news.

JAP: My love, I fear the illness which ravages my body will soon claim it. My dreams of traveling to you are all but lost.
FR: «#Mon amour, je crains de ne plus bientôt avoir la force de combattre la maladie qui ravage mon corps. Jamais je ne réaliserai mon rêve le plus cher#: celui de te revoir.#»
OUPS: My love, I fear the illness which ravages my body will soon claim it. My dreams of traveling to you are all but lost.

JAP: I desired so to give you this stone with my own hand; that I cannot is my greatest regret.
FR: «#Je regretterai toujours de ne pas avoir pu t'offrir moi-même cette pierre précieuse.#»
OUPS: I desired so to give you this stone with my own hand; that I cannot is my greatest regret.

JAP: He gave her his family's heirloom as a final gift.
FR: La larme de sirène fut son cadeau ultime.

JAP: Hold a moment. I see another letter.
FR: Un instant. Il y a une autre lettre.
OUPS: Hold a moment. I see another letter.

JAP: ...It's a death notice.
FR: ... C'est un avis de décès.
OUPS: ...It's a death notice.

JAP: Ah. So the man had already passed on when the package arrived at Seafront.
FR: Alors, l'homme était déjà mort quand le colis est arrivé à Littoral.
OUPS: Ah. So the man had already passed on when the package arrived at Seafront.

JAP: Which means the postman had already begun to lie to her.
FR: Ce qui veut dire que le postier avait déjà commencé à mentir à la vieille femme du phare.
OUPS: Which means the postman had already begun to lie to her.

JAP: So what now? Do we give the jewel back to the client, or...? Maybe the postman would have a better idea.
FR: Que faire#? Devrais-je donner la pierre à la joaillière...? Le postier aura peut-être une meilleure idée.
OUPS: So what now? Do we give the jewel back to the client, or...? Maybe the postman would have a better idea.

FR: Alors#? Avez-vous trouvé la larme de sirène#?

FR: ... Oui, la voici.

JAP: Oh, I have waited for so long! Your sterling reputation, sir, has clearly been earned!

OUPS: Oh, I have waited for so long! Your sterling reputation, sir, has clearly been earned!

JAP: It's a precious memento of my grandfather.<PAGE>Here's your reward. Thank you!
FR: Cette pierre est un cher souvenir de mon grand-père.<PAGE>Voici votre récompense. Merci beaucoup.
OUPS: It's a precious memento of my grandfather.<PAGE>Here's your reward. Thank you!

JAP: All right. I'll bury it next to the old woman's grave.

JAP: Thank you.
FR: Merci.

JAP: Well...the next step is to visit the client, I suppose.
FR: Eh bien, je suppose que nous devrions retourner voir la joaillière.
OUPS: Well...the next step is to visit the client, I suppose.

JAP: Pah! You would take a precious gift of love and sell it as a common trinket? Rather cheeky of you, if I may say.
FR: Pfft#! Tu vendrais le gage éternel de leur amour comme s'il n'était qu'une babiole#? Quel culot#!
OUPS: Pah! You would take a precious gift of love and sell it as a common trinket? Rather cheeky of you, if I may say.

JAP: It's what she would have wanted...
FR: C'est ce qu'elle aurait voulu...

JAP: Well...the next step is to visit the client, I suppose.
FR: Eh bien, je suppose que nous devrions retourner voir la joaillière.

JAP: Yes, yes? Did you find my jewel?
FR: Alors#? Avez-vous trouvé la larme de sirène#?

JAP: Sorry, no. Everything was a dead end.
FR: Non, je suis désolé. Tous les indices ne menaient nulle part.

JAP: How's that?
FR: Pourquoi donc#?

FR: Il était de ce village, vous savez, et j'espérais que...<PAGE>Oh, peu importe. J'aurai au moins eu la chance de visiter l'endroit où il est né.

FR: Dis, tu n'aurais pas aperçu de voleur, par hasard#?<PAGE>Je n'arrête pas de me faire cambrioler#!
OUPS: Hey, you haven't seen any thieves around, have you?<PAGE>Buncha sticky-fingered bastards keep taking my merchandise!

JAP: That bad, huh?

FR: Il ne vole jamais beaucoup de choses à la fois, mais c'est toujours de la nourriture. Et d'une certaine façon, c'est ce que j'ai de plus précieux#!

OUPS: Do you have a plan, or are we going to walk up to every person we see and shake them until stolen vegetables fall from their pockets?

FR: J'espère que tu arriveras à trouver le voleur#!

FR: Une bouteille de vin... Elle est encore pleine. Est-ce un des objets qui ont été subtilisés...?
OUPS: A wine bottle... It's still full. Is this one of the stolen items?

JAP: We've been dealing with a wave of robberies lately. Better keep a close eye on your purse!
FR: Plusieurs maisons ont été cambriolées récemment. Tu devrais faire attention à ta bourse#!
OUPS: We've been dealing with a wave of robberies lately. Better keep a close eye on your purse!

JAP: I hear that it's two thieves working as a team!
FR: J'ai entendu dire que les coupables sont deux voleurs qui travaillent ensemble#!
OUPS: I hear that it's two thieves working as a team!

JAP: A robbery...? Come to think of it...
FR: Un cambriolage...? Laisse-moi réfléchir un peu...
OUPS: A robbery...? Come to think of it...

JAP: I saw the thief! Just a glimpse, but it was enough for me to be sure. He looked really young...
FR: Oui, je crois que j'ai aperçu le voleur#! Je ne l'ai entrevu qu'un bref instant, mais je sais que c'était lui.<PAGE>Il avait l'air si jeune...
OUPS: I saw the thief! Just a glimpse, but it was enough for me to be sure. He looked really young...

JAP: Judging by what we've found, we're dealing with two thieves...probably children.
FR: Hum, d'après ce que nous avons découvert, je crois qu'il y a deux voleurs... et que ce sont probablement des enfants.
OUPS: Judging by what we've found, we're dealing with two thieves...probably children.

JAP: Remember the pair of brothers that loiter near the waterwheel? I fear they may hiding something from us.
FR: Ces deux enfants qui traînent près de la roue du moulin... J'ai eu l'impression qu'ils nous cachaient quelque chose.
OUPS: Remember the pair of brothers that loiter near the waterwheel? I fear they may hiding something from us.

JAP: Hey! You're the little jerks behind all these robberies! ...Er, right?
FR: Hé#! Vous êtes les petits vauriens qui ont commis tous ces vols... non#?
OUPS: Hey! You're the little jerks behind all these robberies! ...Er, right?

JAP: If you're so confident, why are you even asking me?
FR: Pourquoi tu me le demandes, si t'es si certain#?
OUPS: If you're so confident, why are you even asking me?
