FR: Ta voix te trahit#! Avoue tes crimes#! Confesse-toi avant que mon compagnon à la force colossale ne se mette en colère#!
OUPS: Your tone betrays your guilt! Confess! Confess now, lest my muscle-bound friend here becomes angry!

JAP: Okay, okay! We did it. My brother and I.
FR: D'accord, d'accord#! Mon frère et moi, on est les voleurs#!
OUPS: Okay, okay! We did it. My brother and I.

JAP: Why?
FR: Mais pourquoi#?
OUPS: Why?

JAP: ...'Cause Dad told us to.
FR: ... Parce que papa nous a dit de le faire.
OUPS: ...'Cause Dad told us to.

JAP: Your father demanded that you steal!?
FR: Votre père vous a ordonné de voler#?!
OUPS: Your father demanded that you steal!?

JAP: What kind of bastard forces his own children to a life of crime!?<PAGE>I think it's time he and I had a little chat...
FR: Quelle sorte de fripouille forcerait ses propres enfants à commettre des crimes#?!<PAGE>J'aimerais bien lui dire deux mots...
OUPS: What kind of bastard forces his own children to a life of crime!?<PAGE>I think it's time he and I had a little chat...

JAP: He's probably in the tavern. That's where he spends all his time.
FR: Il est probablement à la taverne. C'est là qu'il passe la plupart de son temps.
OUPS: He's probably in the tavern. That's where he spends all his time.

JAP: Got it.
FR: Je vois.
OUPS: Got it.

JAP: I think Dad's in the tavern again.
FR: Je crois que papa est à la taverne, comme d'habitude.
OUPS: I think Dad's in the tavern again.

JAP: I'm sorry, sir. I didn't want to do it...
FR: Je suis désolé, monsieur. Je voulais pas le faire...
OUPS: I'm sorry, sir. I didn't want to do it...

JAP: Hey. You have a pair of sons?
FR: Avez-vous deux fils#?
OUPS: Hey. You have a pair of sons?

JAP: Huh? Whassit...whassit to you, huh? Why ya gotta ashk me all thesh...QUESHTONS!?
FR: Hein#? Qu'est-ce que ça peut... bien te faire#? Pourquoi tu me poses... cette question#? Hic#!
OUPS: Huh? Whassit...whassit to you, huh? Why ya gotta ashk me all thesh...QUESHTONS!?

JAP: You're forcing your kids to commit crimes, aren't you.
FR: Vous forcez vos enfants à commettre des crimes, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: You're forcing your kids to commit crimes, aren't you.

JAP: CRIMES!? No, no! Ish not like that. I jusht...I jusht told 'em to go find shome food for the family!
FR: Des CRIMES#?! Non... Non#! C'est pas ce que... tu crois. Hic#! Je leur ai juste demandé de m'apporter... à manger.
OUPS: CRIMES!? No, no! Ish not like that. I jusht...I jusht told 'em to go find shome food for the family!

JAP: Now shut yer mouth before I...before I shut it for ya! Buncha no-good MEDDLERSH!
FR: Alors, la ferme#! Hic#! Mêle-toi... de ce qui te regarde#!
OUPS: Now shut yer mouth before I...before I shut it for ya! Buncha no-good MEDDLERSH!

JAP: Can't you see I'm busy drinkin' here?
FR: Tu vois pas que je suis occupé#?!
OUPS: Can't you see I'm busy drinkin' here?

JAP: Did you find the culprit?
FR: As-tu trouvé le voleur#?
OUPS: Did you find the culprit?

JAP: Yeah. But it's...complicated.
FR: Oui, mais c'est un peu compliqué.
OUPS: Yeah. But it's...complicated.

JAP: ...I see. A pair of children driven to steal by an abusive father. Well, I certainly didn't expect this.
FR: ... Je vois. Un père qui maltraite ses enfants et les force à voler. Je ne m'y attendais pas.
OUPS: ...I see. A pair of children driven to steal by an abusive father. Well, I certainly didn't expect this.

JAP: I don't think the kids are entirely without blame, but they certainly never had much of a chance. Maybe we can go easy on 'em this time?
FR: La conduite des enfants n'est pas irréprochable, mais ils n'avaient pas vraiment le choix. Nous devrions sans doute ne pas être trop sévères envers eux cette fois.
OUPS: I don't think the kids are entirely without blame, but they certainly never had much of a chance. Maybe we can go easy on 'em this time?

JAP: Agreed. I'll talk to the other shopkeepers and make sure they understand.
FR: Tu as raison. J'avertirai les autres marchands.
OUPS: Agreed. I'll talk to the other shopkeepers and make sure they understand.

JAP: You know anyone who might be able to take them in? There's no way I'm sending them back to their father.
FR: Connaissez-vous quelqu'un qui accepterait de s'occuper d'eux#? Ils ne peuvent pas rester avec leur père.
OUPS: You know anyone who might be able to take them in? There's no way I'm sending them back to their father.

JAP: People are barely getting by as it is!<PAGE>Oh, all right. I'll spread the word and see what I can find out.
FR: Mais la plupart des villageois arrivent à peine à s'en sortir#!<PAGE>Oh, d'accord. Je me renseignerai...
OUPS: People are barely getting by as it is!<PAGE>Oh, all right. I'll spread the word and see what I can find out.

JAP: Ah, yes, your fee.<PAGE>Well, us shop owners passed the hat and came up with this. I hope it's enough.
FR: Ah oui, ta récompense.<PAGE>Tous les marchands se sont cotisés. J'espère que c'est assez.
OUPS: Ah, yes, your fee.<PAGE>Well, us shop owners passed the hat and came up with this. I hope it's enough.

JAP: I worked it out. The two boys are going to stay with Popola.
FR: Nous avons trouvé une solution. Les deux garçons habiteront avec Popola.
OUPS: I worked it out. The two boys are going to stay with Popola.

JAP: I'm sorry for all the trouble, sir.
FR: Je suis désolé d'avoir causé tant d'ennuis.
OUPS: I'm sorry for all the trouble, sir.

JAP: Hey! How come I can't see Dad?
FR: Pourquoi je peux pas aller voir papa#?
OUPS: Hey! How come I can't see Dad?

JAP: ...Oh. You, huh? Just leave me alone, will ya?
FR: ... Oh, c'est vous. Laissez-moi tranquille.
OUPS: ...Oh. You, huh? Just leave me alone, will ya?

JAP: Funny how lonely it gets when those brats aren't around...
FR: C'est étrange comme je me sens seul sans ces gamins...
OUPS: Funny how lonely it gets when those brats aren't around...

JAP: I'll see if I can't find anyone to take care of those two kids.
FR: Je vais essayer de trouver quelqu'un qui pourra s'occuper des gamins.
OUPS: I'll see if I can't find anyone to take care of those two kids.

JAP: Hey, nice to see ya again. You look like you're feeling better.
FR: Ah, bonjour#! Heureux de vous revoir#! On dirait que vous vous sentez mieux.
OUPS: Hey, nice to see ya again. You look like you're feeling better.

JAP: I can't give up on my dream that easily! Seasickness is terrible, but I've got a few tricks up my sleeve.
FR: Je ne peux pas abandonner mon rêve si facilement#! Avoir le mal de mer n'est pas agréable, mais j'ai plus d'un tour dans mon sac#!
OUPS: I can't give up on my dream that easily! Seasickness is terrible, but I've got a few tricks up my sleeve.

JAP: Oh yeah? Like what?
FR: Ah bon#?
OUPS: Oh yeah? Like what?

JAP: Well, for one, I'm working on my own herbal cure!
FR: J'ai décidé d'élaborer mon propre remède#!
OUPS: Well, for one, I'm working on my own herbal cure!

JAP: It's a bit of a work in progress, though. I'm not totally sure about the ingredients.
FR: Cependant, je n'ai pas encore tout à fait réussi. J'expérimente toujours avec divers ingrédients.
OUPS: It's a bit of a work in progress, though. I'm not totally sure about the ingredients.

JAP: ...I see.
FR: ... Je vois.
OUPS: ...I see.

JAP: Hey, I don't suppose you'd mind getting an ingredient for me, would you?
FR: Que diriez-vous de vous procurer un des ingrédients pour moi#?
OUPS: Hey, I don't suppose you'd mind getting an ingredient for me, would you?

JAP: You can get it from the strange-thing store in Facade. I wouldn't ask, but you're the only guy I know who can get in there.
FR: On dit qu'on en vend au magasin de curiosités de Façade. Je ne vous embêterais pas avec ça, mais vous êtes la seule personne que je connais qui puisse entrer dans la ville.
OUPS: You can get it from the strange-thing store in Facade. I wouldn't ask, but you're the only guy I know who can get in there.

JAP: I can do that.
FR: Volontiers.
OUPS: I can do that.

JAP: Great! The item I need is a mandrake leaf.
FR: Formidable#! J'ai besoin d'une feuille de mandragore.
OUPS: Great! The item I need is a mandrake leaf.

JAP: The item I need is a mandrake leaf. And thanks in advance!
FR: L'ingrédient dont j'ai besoin est une feuille de mandragore. Merci d'avance#!
OUPS: The item I need is a mandrake leaf. And thanks in advance!

JAP: Hey. You got a mandrake leaf lying around?
FR: Bonjour. J'aimerais acheter une feuille de mandragore.
OUPS: Hey. You got a mandrake leaf lying around?

JAP: (A mandrake leaf? Oh ho! I never would have expected such a request from you!)
FR: (Une feuille de mandragore#? Oh, ho#! Jamais je n'aurais cru que vous en auriez besoin#!)
OUPS: (A mandrake leaf? Oh ho! I never would have expected such a request from you!)

JAP: Uh...what?
FR: Euh... Quoi#?
OUPS: Uh...what?

JAP: (No worries, no worries! We're all men here after all, yes?)
FR: (Ne vous inquiétez pas, ne vous inquiétez pas#! Entre hommes, on se comprend#!)
OUPS: (No worries, no worries! We're all men here after all, yes?)

JAP: The hell are you talking about?<PAGE>...Ah, whatever. Lemme just get the thing and get out of here.
FR: Mais qu'est-ce que vous racontez#?<PAGE>Ah, peu importe. Donnez-la-moi que je puisse sortir d'ici.
OUPS: The hell are you talking about?<PAGE>...Ah, whatever. Lemme just get the thing and get out of here.

JAP: I got your mandrake leaf.
FR: J'ai la feuille de mandragore dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I got your mandrake leaf.

JAP: Fantastic! Here's the money for the leaf, and a little extra for all the travel.
FR: Excellent#! Laissez-moi vous rembourser et vous donner un petit surplus pour être allé jusqu'à Façade.
OUPS: Fantastic! Here's the money for the leaf, and a little extra for all the travel.

JAP: This is the key to my seasickness medicine. I just know it!
FR: Cet ingrédient me permettra enfin de créer mon remède contre le mal de mer, j'en suis convaincu#!
OUPS: This is the key to my seasickness medicine. I just know it!

JAP: How's the medicine going?
FR: Alors, avez-vous réussi à élaborer un remède contre le mal de mer#?
OUPS: How's the medicine going?

JAP: Oh, it's uh... Well, it's interesting.
FR: Oh, euh... Eh bien, voyez-vous...
OUPS: Oh, it's uh... Well, it's interesting.

JAP: I thought it would help my seasickness, but instead I made a...<PAGE>Well, let's just call it an energizer, eh?<PAGE>...And my wife is just thrilled! Grawwwl!
FR: Je croyais que ce remède guérirait mon mal de mer, mais...<PAGE>Euh, avec de tels effets, je l'ai surnommé «#énergisant#», si vous voyez ce que je veux dire...<PAGE>Ma femme en est ravie#! Ho, ho, ho, ho#!
OUPS: I thought it would help my seasickness, but instead I made a...<PAGE>Well, let's just call it an energizer, eh?<PAGE>...And my wife is just thrilled! Grawwwl!

JAP: I didn't need to know any of that.
FR: Je n'avais pas besoin de le savoir.
OUPS: I didn't need to know any of that.

JAP: Look, I need to try again. You mind making another shopping trip for me?
FR: Écoutez, je dois réessayer. Pourriez-vous vous procurer un autre ingrédient pour moi#?
OUPS: Look, I need to try again. You mind making another shopping trip for me?

JAP: All right.
FR: D'accord.
OUPS: All right.

JAP: Great. This time, I need some toad oil from Two Brothers Weaponry at the Junk Heap.
FR: Merci. Cette fois, j'aurais besoin d'huile de crapaud. Vous pourrez vous en procurer à l'armurerie des frères de la montagne des robots.
OUPS: Great. This time, I need some toad oil from Two Brothers Weaponry at the Junk Heap.

JAP: I need some toad oil from the Junk Heap.
FR: J'ai besoin d'huile de crapaud de l'armurerie des frères de la montagne des robots.
OUPS: I need some toad oil from the Junk Heap.

JAP: Welcome. How can I help you?
FR: Bienvenue. Comment puis-je vous être utile#?
OUPS: Welcome. How can I help you?

JAP: I need a vial of toad oil for some medicine.
FR: Je voudrais acheter une jarre d'huile de crapaud. C'est pour un remède.
OUPS: I need a vial of toad oil for some medicine.

JAP: Toad oil? Pulling an all-nighter, eh?<PAGE>Good luck with that, sir.
FR: De l'huile de crapaud#? Oh, vous prévoyez passer des nuits blanches, c'est ça#?<PAGE>Bon courage#!
OUPS: Toad oil? Pulling an all-nighter, eh?<PAGE>Good luck with that, sir.

JAP: ...Huh?
FR: ... Hein#?
OUPS: ...Huh?

JAP: All that Shade-slaying must be tough! I bet you use this stuff all the time.
FR: Ça ne doit pas être facile de chasser des Ombres#! Je suppose que vous en utilisez souvent#!
OUPS: All that Shade-slaying must be tough! I bet you use this stuff all the time.

JAP: I don't like where this is going...<PAGE>Oh, well. Better bring this back to the client.
FR: J'ai un mauvais pressentiment...<PAGE>Oh, peu importe. Je devrais rapporter l'huile à l'habitant de Littoral.
OUPS: I don't like where this is going...<PAGE>Oh, well. Better bring this back to the client.

JAP: Here's your toad oil.
FR: J'ai l'huile de crapaud dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: Here's your toad oil.

JAP: Great! And here's your fee.
FR: Parfait#! Et voici votre récompense.
OUPS: Great! And here's your fee.

JAP: This is the key to my seasickness medicine. I just know it!
FR: Cet ingrédient me permettra enfin de créer mon remède contre le mal de mer, j'en suis convaincu#!
OUPS: This is the key to my seasickness medicine. I just know it!

JAP: How's the medicine going?
FR: Alors, avez-vous réussi à élaborer un remède contre le mal de mer#?
OUPS: How's the medicine going?

JAP: Well, as you know, I was trying to make a seasickness remedy...
FR: Pas encore. Je croyais que ce remède guérirait mon mal de mer, mais il provoque plutôt de l'insomnie.
OUPS: Well, as you know, I was trying to make a seasickness remedy...

JAP: But it seems I've somehow concocted a potent sleep prevention drug instead. If you took it, it would probably keep you awake for a week! I call it Sleep-B-Gone.
FR: Je parie qu'on pourrait passer une semaine sans dormir grâce à lui#!<PAGE>Je l'ai appelé psychotonique 7. Je suppose que je pourrais essayer d'en vendre, mais je ne vois pas qui voudrait en acheter...
OUPS: But it seems I've somehow concocted a potent sleep prevention drug instead. If you took it, it would probably keep you awake for a week! I call it Sleep-B-Gone.

JAP: Maybe you should just become an apothecary instead.
FR: Vous devriez peut-être devenir apothicaire.
OUPS: Maybe you should just become an apothecary instead.

JAP: Say, that's not a bad idea.<PAGE>...Actually, that's a GREAT idea! All right! From now on, I'm out of the trading business and opening a pharmacy!
FR: Ce n'est pas une si mauvaise idée.<PAGE>... À vrai dire, c'est une excellente idée#! Bien#! Désormais, je ne suis plus marchand, je suis apothicaire#!
OUPS: Say, that's not a bad idea.<PAGE>...Actually, that's a GREAT idea! All right! From now on, I'm out of the trading business and opening a pharmacy!

JAP: Well, good luck with that.
FR: Bonne chance#!
OUPS: Well, good luck with that.

JAP: I've got two medicines! That's a start, right?
FR: Après tout, j'ai déjà inventé deux potions#! C'est un bon début, non#?
OUPS: I've got two medicines! That's a start, right?

JAP: My energizer and Sleep-B-Gone have been selling like crazy. Especially the energizer!<PAGE>Why didn't I think of this before?
FR: Mon énergisant et mon psychotonique 7 se vendent comme des petits pains#! Surtout l'énergisant...<PAGE>Pourquoi n'avais-je pas pensé plus tôt à devenir apothicaire#?
OUPS: My energizer and Sleep-B-Gone have been selling like crazy. Especially the energizer!<PAGE>Why didn't I think of this before?

JAP: Help! HELP! Oh, gods, please help me!
FR: À l'aide#! À l'aide#!! Je t'en supplie, aide-moi#!
OUPS: Help! HELP! Oh, gods, please help me!

JAP: What is it!? What's wrong!?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?!
OUPS: What is it!? What's wrong!?

JAP: There's this huge Shade near the bridge in the northern plains!
FR: Il y a une Ombre énorme près du pont de la plaine septentrionale#!
OUPS: There's this huge Shade near the bridge in the northern plains!

JAP: It killed three members of my family, including my wife... Just cut her down right in front of me! Then it attacked my daughter, too... Gods, it was horrible...
FR: Elle a tué trois membres de ma famille devant moi, y compris ma femme#! Ensuite, elle a attaqué ma fille#! Oh, c'était terrible#!
OUPS: It killed three members of my family, including my wife... Just cut her down right in front of me! Then it attacked my daughter, too... Gods, it was horrible...

JAP: I'm on it.
FR: Je m'en occupe#!
OUPS: I'm on it.

JAP: It appears and disappears like the wind. You could go days in the northern plains without seeing it, and then all of a sudden...
FR: Elle apparaît et disparaît comme un mirage... Parfois, on ne la voit pas pendant des jours#!
OUPS: It appears and disappears like the wind. You could go days in the northern plains without seeing it, and then all of a sudden...

JAP: I want that bastard to suffer like I'm suffering.<PAGE>Kill it, please! I'll pay you whatever you want, just cut it down!
FR: Je veux que cette Ombre souffre autant qu'elle m'a fait souffert#!<PAGE>Tue-la, je t'en supplie#! Je te paierai le montant que tu voudras#!
OUPS: I want that bastard to suffer like I'm suffering.<PAGE>Kill it, please! I'll pay you whatever you want, just cut it down!

JAP: We killed it.
FR: Nous avons vaincu l'Ombre.
OUPS: We killed it.

JAP: My daughter is dead. She...she passed while you were gone.
FR: Ma fille est morte. Elle... elle est décédée en ton absence.
OUPS: My daughter is dead. She...she passed while you were gone.

JAP: Here. Take this money. I won't be needing it anymore.
FR: Tiens, prends ma bourse. Je n'en aurai plus besoin.
OUPS: Here. Take this money. I won't be needing it anymore.

JAP: Why have the gods cursed us?
FR: Pourquoi les dieux nous ont-ils abandonnés#?
OUPS: Why have the gods cursed us?

JAP: Hey! Did you hear the news?
FR: Dites, avez-vous entendu les dernières rumeurs#?
OUPS: Hey! Did you hear the news?

JAP: Maybe. What is it?
FR: Ça dépend, lesquelles#?
OUPS: Maybe. What is it?

JAP: There's a giant Shade in the southern plains...and they say it likes to eat POSTMEN!
FR: Une Ombre géante rôde sur la plaine méridionale... et elle dévore les postiers#!
OUPS: There's a giant Shade in the southern plains...and they say it likes to eat POSTMEN!

JAP: That's crazy. Shades don't eat people.
FR: C'est ridicule. Les Ombres ne mangent pas les humains.
OUPS: That's crazy. Shades don't eat people.

JAP: Yeah, well, people say the bodies look like they've been torn apart and chewed on.
FR: Les gens disent pourtant qu'on a retrouvé des cadavres mutilés et déchiquetés, comme si quelque chose en avait pris une bouchée#!
OUPS: Yeah, well, people say the bodies look like they've been torn apart and chewed on.

JAP: Say what you will, but I'm not about to go see for myself!
FR: Pas question que j'aille vérifier moi-même#!
OUPS: Say what you will, but I'm not about to go see for myself!

JAP: The Shades are becoming more of a threat than ever before.
FR: Les Ombres semblent devenir de plus en plus dangereuses.
OUPS: The Shades are becoming more of a threat than ever before.

JAP: All right. I'll see what I can find.
FR: C'est bon, je m'en occupe.
OUPS: All right. I'll see what I can find.

JAP: Please help us. All the postmen are afraid to leave their homes.
FR: Aidez-nous#! Aucun postier n'ose sortir de chez lui...
OUPS: Please help us. All the postmen are afraid to leave their homes.

JAP: I killed the Shade in the southern plains.
FR: J'ai vaincu l'Ombre de la plaine méridionale.
OUPS: I killed the Shade in the southern plains.

JAP: Oh, thank you! Thank you!
FR: Oh, merci#! Merci beaucoup#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you! Thank you!

JAP: I don't know what to do about all the postmen who quit, but I guess I'll figure something out. ...Anyway, here's your reward.
FR: Tant de postiers ont démissionné... Je ne sais pas quoi faire, mais je devrai trouver une solution.<PAGE>Voici votre récompense.
OUPS: I don't know what to do about all the postmen who quit, but I guess I'll figure something out. ...Anyway, here's your reward.

JAP: This time I need three sandfish. It's a tricky devil that lives in the oceans of sand. You can catch it over near the wharf.
FR: Cette fois, j'ai envie de squilles. Ce sont des créatures rusées qui vivent dans les sables mouvants. On peut en attraper près du quai du désert. Ramène-m'en trois.
OUPS: This time I need three sandfish. It's a tricky devil that lives in the oceans of sand. You can catch it over near the wharf.

JAP: Here's your fish.
FR: J'ai attrapé ce que vous vouliez.
OUPS: Here's your fish.

JAP: Well, keelhaul my granny and call me Gladys! I reckon there ain't much left for me to teach ya, whippersnapper.
FR: Eh bien qui l'eût cru#! Je crois qu'il me reste pas grand-chose à t'apprendre, mon garçon#!
OUPS: Well, keelhaul my granny and call me Gladys! I reckon there ain't much left for me to teach ya, whippersnapper.

JAP: Works for me. I can't take much more of your slave driving.
FR: Voilà qui me convient à merveille. Je ne pourrais pas supporter beaucoup plus longtemps de me faire traiter comme un esclave.
OUPS: Works for me. I can't take much more of your slave driving.

JAP: Ya call that slave drivin'? Bah! You younger generations with yer big swords and baggy pants and fancy talk. You ain't seen war! You got no idea what slave drivin' means!
FR: Un esclave#?! Pfft#! Tu peux bien parler avec ton épée énorme, tes vêtements voyants et ton livre volant#!<PAGE>T'as pas vécu en temps de guerre#! Tu sais pas ce que c'est que d'être un esclave#!
OUPS: Ya call that slave drivin'? Bah! You younger generations with yer big swords and baggy pants and fancy talk. You ain't seen war! You got no idea what slave drivin' means!

JAP: ...Did you see that move he just did?
FR: ... As-tu vu ce qu'il vient de faire#?
OUPS: ...Did you see that move he just did?

JAP: That was no fishing move. That was the maneuver of a master assassin.<PAGE>I am beginning to fear this old man more than any Shade.
FR: Ce n'était pas une technique de pêche. C'était une technique d'assassin professionnel.<PAGE>Je crois que je crains ce vieillard plus que n'importe quelle Ombre...
OUPS: That was no fishing move. That was the maneuver of a master assassin.<PAGE>I am beginning to fear this old man more than any Shade.

JAP: Best of luck with the three sandfish!
FR: Bonne chance#! T'en auras besoin pour pêcher trois squilles#!
OUPS: Best of luck with the three sandfish!

JAP: This time I need three royal fish! And time's a-wastin', so get to it!
FR: Cette fois, je veux trois esturgeons#! Alors, qu'attends-tu donc#? Ouste#!
OUPS: This time I need three royal fish! And time's a-wastin', so get to it!

JAP: Here.
FR: Tenez.
OUPS: Here.

JAP: Well, dip my oar and call me Cecil! Looks like the fisherboy has become a fisherman!
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru#! Le moussaillon est devenu maître pêcheur#!
OUPS: Well, dip my oar and call me Cecil! Looks like the fisherboy has become a fisherman!

JAP: But do you think you can push me off of my spot? Come on! Let's go!
FR: Mais crois-tu pouvoir me détrôner#? Allez#! Montre-moi ce dont t'es capable#!
OUPS: But do you think you can push me off of my spot? Come on! Let's go!

JAP: Gar har har har! And I'm just using my left hand!
FR: Ga, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha#! Et j'utilisais que ma main gauche#!
OUPS: Gar har har har! And I'm just using my left hand!

JAP: I think we've moved beyond fishing at this point...
FR: Je crois qu'il n'est plus question de pêche, désormais...
OUPS: I think we've moved beyond fishing at this point...

JAP: Best of luck with the three royal fish!
FR: Je veux trois esturgeons#! Bonne chance#!
OUPS: Best of luck with the three royal fish!

JAP: I got somethin' special for ya this time! Go out there and catch me two blue marlin.
FR: Cette fois, j'ai une demande spéciale#! Attrape-moi deux makaires bleus#!
OUPS: I got somethin' special for ya this time! Go out there and catch me two blue marlin.

JAP: How is that special?
FR: Qu'a-t-elle de si spécial, cette demande#?
OUPS: How is that special?

JAP: Only ever caught one once, m'self.<PAGE>Bring me those fish, and I'll call ya a master fisherman for true!
FR: J'en ai attrapé qu'un seul dans ma carrière.<PAGE>Rapportes-en deux et tu mériteras vraiment le titre de maître pêcheur#!
OUPS: Only ever caught one once, m'self.<PAGE>Bring me those fish, and I'll call ya a master fisherman for true!

JAP: These the fish you wanted?
FR: Est-ce que ce sont bien les poissons que vous vouliez#?
OUPS: These the fish you wanted?

JAP: Well, I'll be. Never thought I'd see the day...
FR: Eh bien, qui l'eût cru...? Je pensais jamais voir une chose pareille...
OUPS: Well, I'll be. Never thought I'd see the day...

JAP: Well done, master fisherman. Seems I've but one technique left to teach ya.
FR: Félicitations, maître pêcheur. On dirait qu'il me reste plus qu'une seule technique à t'apprendre.
OUPS: Well done, master fisherman. Seems I've but one technique left to teach ya.

JAP: I've taught ya everything I know, but that don't mean ya can stop learnin'! It's a big world out there, with fish the likes of which no man has ever seen.
FR: Je t'ai appris tout ce que je sais, mais ça veut pas dire que tu dois arrêter d'apprendre#!<PAGE>Notre monde est immense, qui sait quels poissons se cachent dans les profondeurs de ses océans#!
OUPS: I've taught ya everything I know, but that don't mean ya can stop learnin'! It's a big world out there, with fish the likes of which no man has ever seen.

JAP: Best of luck with the two blue marlin!
FR: Je veux deux makaires bleus#! Bonne chance#!
OUPS: Best of luck with the two blue marlin!

JAP: You know, I reckon ya just might have what it takes to catch...The Fish.<PAGE>The hyneria!
FR: Tu sais, je crois qu'un jour tu pourras attraper... le Poisson.<PAGE>L'hynéria...!
OUPS: You know, I reckon ya just might have what it takes to catch...The Fish.<PAGE>The hyneria!

JAP: The hyneria?
FR: L'hynéria#?
OUPS: The hyneria?

JAP: No man has ever hooked a hyneria and lived to tell the tale! If ya can do it, then yer a fisherman beyond even my own skill.
FR: Personne a jamais attrapé d'hynéria et réussi à s'en vanter#! Si tu arrives à le faire, c'est que tu es meilleur pêcheur que moi.
OUPS: No man has ever hooked a hyneria and lived to tell the tale! If ya can do it, then yer a fisherman beyond even my own skill.

JAP: Hmm... Where did the old timer go?
FR: Hum... Où est passé le vieil homme#?
OUPS: Hmm... Where did the old timer go?

JAP: Oh, the old fisherman? Didn't you hear? He passed away just this morning.
FR: Oh, le vieux pêcheur#? On ne vous l'a pas dit#? Il est décédé ce matin.
OUPS: Oh, the old fisherman? Didn't you hear? He passed away just this morning.

JAP: I guess that old war injury finally got the best of him.<PAGE>From what I understand, the guy used to be quite the mercenary.
FR: Je suppose qu'il a finalement succombé à ses blessures de guerre.<PAGE>On raconte que c'était un mercenaire célèbre en son temps.
OUPS: I guess that old war injury finally got the best of him.<PAGE>From what I understand, the guy used to be quite the mercenary.

JAP: That explains a lot.
FR: Ceci explique certaines choses.
OUPS: That explains a lot.

JAP: He supposedly did all kinds of terrible things back in his day. So truth be told, no one in town much cared for him.
FR: Il paraît qu'il avait commis des actes répréhensibles pendant la guerre. À vrai dire, personne ne tenait vraiment à lui dans le village.
OUPS: He supposedly did all kinds of terrible things back in his day. So truth be told, no one in town much cared for him.

JAP: But he sure seemed to enjoy your company. I think you made his last days some happy ones.
FR: Toutefois, il semblait apprécier votre compagnie. Je crois que ses derniers jours ont été ses plus heureux.
OUPS: But he sure seemed to enjoy your company. I think you made his last days some happy ones.

JAP: The hyneria would be a legendary catch! I'm sure it would be worth your while to track it down.
FR: L'hynéria serait une prise légendaire#! Essaie de la trouver, ça en vaudrait la peine#!
OUPS: The hyneria would be a legendary catch! I'm sure it would be worth your while to track it down.

JAP: Hey, I know you! You're that desperate guy who'll take any job that comes along, no matter how stupid or demeaning!
FR: Hé, je vous connais#! Vous êtes celui qui est prêt à accepter n'importe quel boulot, même s'il est ingrat ou humiliant#!
OUPS: Hey, I know you! You're that desperate guy who'll take any job that comes along, no matter how stupid or demeaning!

JAP: ...That's not really how I'd phrase it. But if you've got the money, I've got the time.
FR: ... Je ne présenterais probablement pas les choses de cette façon, mais... si le salaire en vaut la peine, je suis prêt à vous écouter.
OUPS: ...That's not really how I'd phrase it. But if you've got the money, I've got the time.

JAP: Dance! Dance for me! Ah ha ha!<PAGE>No, I'm just kidding. Listen, I've got a boat that needs some repairs. Think you can round up some materials for me?
FR: Dansez#! Dansez#! Ha, ha, ha, ha#!<PAGE>Non, je plaisante. Je dois réparer mon bateau. Pourriez-vous récupérer des matériaux pour moi#?
OUPS: Dance! Dance for me! Ah ha ha!<PAGE>No, I'm just kidding. Listen, I've got a boat that needs some repairs. Think you can round up some materials for me?

JAP: I need five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts.<PAGE>I'd ask if you're up for it, but I know you are! Ah ha ha!
FR: J'ai besoin de cinq rondins, vingt feuilles de métal bosselées et dix vieux boulons.<PAGE>...#Et je n'ai pas à vous demander si vous acceptez, hein#? Vous ne refusez jamais#! Ha, ha, ha#!
OUPS: I need five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts.<PAGE>I'd ask if you're up for it, but I know you are! Ah ha ha!

JAP: ...You're really startin' to piss me off.
FR: ... Vous commencez vraiment à m'énerver.
OUPS: ...You're really startin' to piss me off.

JAP: Here.
FR: Voilà.
OUPS: Here.

JAP: Much appreciated! Now I can get back to business!
FR: Merci bien#! Maintenant je peux retourner au travail#!
OUPS: Much appreciated! Now I can get back to business!

JAP: Here's some cash. I'll letcha know as soon as I need my floor swept or a toilet cleaned. Ah ha ha ha ha!
FR: Voici votre récompense. Si j'ai besoin de quelqu'un pour laver les planchers ou récurer les cabinets, je vous ferai signe#! Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha#!
OUPS: Here's some cash. I'll letcha know as soon as I need my floor swept or a toilet cleaned. Ah ha ha ha ha!

JAP: That's five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts. Thanks much!
FR: N'oubliez pas#: j'ai besoin de cinq rondins, vingt feuilles de métal bosselées et dix vieux boulons.
OUPS: That's five logs, twenty dented metal boards, and ten stripped bolts. Thanks much!

JAP: Oh, man. I'm in a world of trouble now...
FR: Me voilà dans le pétrin...
OUPS: Oh, man. I'm in a world of trouble now...

JAP: What's the problem?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: What's the problem?

JAP: See, I was cooking and I... Well, I managed to start a fire that ruined my kitchen and equipment.
FR: Eh bien, je faisais la cuisine et je... Euh, un incendie a ruiné tout mon équipement#!
OUPS: See, I was cooking and I... Well, I managed to start a fire that ruined my kitchen and equipment.

JAP: I can't repair the kitchen without metal, but the only place you can find that much scrap is the Junk Heap...
FR: Je ne peux pas réparer ma cuisine sans métal, mais on ne peut trouver autant de ferraille que dans la montagne des robots.
OUPS: I can't repair the kitchen without metal, but the only place you can find that much scrap is the Junk Heap...

JAP: I see. You want me to go for you?
FR: Je vois. Vous voulez que j'y aille à votre place#?
OUPS: I see. You want me to go for you?

JAP: I need lots of material, so you'll have to brain a whole bunch of robots. That's okay, right?
FR: J'ai besoin de beaucoup de matériaux, alors tu devras détruire plusieurs robots. Ça ne te dérange pas, hein#?
OUPS: I need lots of material, so you'll have to brain a whole bunch of robots. That's okay, right?

JAP: I trust that you plan to offer us adequate compensation?
FR: Comptez-vous nous offrir une récompense appropriée au moins#?
OUPS: I trust that you plan to offer us adequate compensation?

JAP: Don't be greedy, Weiss.
FR: Ne sois pas si avide, Weiss.
OUPS: Don't be greedy, Weiss.

JAP: Well, I'm not sure what you mean by "adequate," but I'll do my best.
FR: Je ne sais pas trop ce que tu considères comme étant approprié, mais je ferai de mon mieux.
OUPS: Well, I'm not sure what you mean by "adequate," but I'll do my best.

JAP: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Got all that?
FR: J'ai besoin d'un morceau d'alliage à mémoire de forme, dix morceaux d'alliage de titane et dix moteurs défectueux. Tu as bien noté#?
OUPS: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Got all that?

JAP: Okay. I'll be back when I find everything.
FR: Entendu, je reviendrai vous voir lorsque j'aurai tout trouvé.
OUPS: Okay. I'll be back when I find everything.

JAP: I brought all the stuff you asked for. Is this enough?
FR: J'ai apporté tout ce qui était sur votre liste. Ça vous va#?
OUPS: I brought all the stuff you asked for. Is this enough?

JAP: Lemme see... Yep! Yep, that's all of it.<PAGE>Here. I hope this qualifies as adequate compensation.
FR: Voyons voir... Oui#! Tout y est.<PAGE>Tiens, j'espère que ceci constitue une récompense appropriée.
OUPS: Lemme see... Yep! Yep, that's all of it.<PAGE>Here. I hope this qualifies as adequate compensation.

JAP: This is more than I was expecting.
FR: Je ne m'attendais pas à recevoir une récompense si généreuse.
OUPS: This is more than I was expecting.

JAP: Yeah, well, I really appreciate all the effort you went to.
FR: Eh bien, je te suis vraiment reconnaissant.
OUPS: Yeah, well, I really appreciate all the effort you went to.

JAP: Take it, fool! It is an appropriate reward for our efforts.
FR: Accepte, bougre d'idiot#! Cette récompense est parfaitement appropriée.
OUPS: Take it, fool! It is an appropriate reward for our efforts.

JAP: And you could stand to learn more "appropriate" ways of speaking.
FR: Et tu devrais vraiment apprendre la manière «#appropriée#» de t'adresser à autrui.
OUPS: And you could stand to learn more "appropriate" ways of speaking.

JAP: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Sound good?
FR: J'ai besoin d'un morceau d'alliage à mémoire de forme, dix morceaux d'alliage de titane et dix moteurs défectueux. Ça te va#?
OUPS: I need one memory alloy, ten titanium alloys, and ten broken motors. Sound good?

JAP: Getting new cooking equipment makes me want to dive right back into my favorite recipes!
FR: Avoir une nouvelle cuisine me donne envie de redécouvrir mes recettes préférées#!
OUPS: Getting new cooking equipment makes me want to dive right back into my favorite recipes!

JAP: Ah, just the man I wanted to see. Do you have a moment?
FR: Ah, justement l'homme qu'il me faut#! Tu as une minute#?
OUPS: Ah, just the man I wanted to see. Do you have a moment?

JAP: Maybe.
FR: Peut-être, qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Maybe.

JAP: Our waterwheel is on its last legs. I'd like to shore it up, but the insides are so complicated...
FR: La roue du moulin à eau ne tiendra pas longtemps. J'aimerais bien la réparer, mais le mécanisme est compliqué...
OUPS: Our waterwheel is on its last legs. I'd like to shore it up, but the insides are so complicated...

JAP: This is a wise thought on your part. That wheel is a machine of not-insignificant age. Better to repair it now than wait until it fails completely.
FR: Hum, oui, elle est plutôt ancienne. La consolider maintenant, avant qu'il ne soit trop tard, est en effet une sage décision.
OUPS: This is a wise thought on your part. That wheel is a machine of not-insignificant age. Better to repair it now than wait until it fails completely.

JAP: You got any ideas? I'm not much for this mechanical stuff.
FR: Saurais-tu comment le faire, Weiss#? Je ne m'y connais pas trop en mécanique.
OUPS: You got any ideas? I'm not much for this mechanical stuff.

JAP: Replacing the axle and the paddle boards should suffice for now. I believe the strange-thing store in Facade should have everything we need.
FR: Remplacer l'axe et les aubes devrait suffire pour le moment. Si je ne m'abuse, le magasin de curiosités de Façade devrait avoir le nécessaire.
OUPS: Replacing the axle and the paddle boards should suffice for now. I believe the strange-thing store in Facade should have everything we need.

JAP: Okay. Well, if you can handle the repairs, I can pick up the materials.
FR: Eh bien, si quelqu'un peut se charger des réparations, j'irai chercher les pièces.
OUPS: Okay. Well, if you can handle the repairs, I can pick up the materials.

JAP: Oh, thank you. I'm sure I can find someone to take care of the actual repair work.
FR: Oh, je te remercie#! Je trouverai quelqu'un, ne t'en fais pas#!
OUPS: Oh, thank you. I'm sure I can find someone to take care of the actual repair work.

JAP: Thanks for volunteering to help with the waterwheel. It's nice that someone still has a sense of community pride.
FR: Merci encore d'avoir accepté de m'aider à réparer la roue. Ça fait plaisir de rencontrer quelqu'un prêt à donner de son temps pour le bien de notre communauté.
OUPS: Thanks for volunteering to help with the waterwheel. It's nice that someone still has a sense of community pride.

JAP: I need an axle and some paddle boards. You got anything like that?
FR: J'ai besoin d'un axe et d'aubes pour une roue de moulin à eau. Vous en avez#?
OUPS: I need an axle and some paddle boards. You got anything like that?

JAP: (No, but if you bring me iron ore and logs, I could probably construct what you need.)
FR: (Non, mais je pourrais en fabriquer pour vous si j'avais du minerai de fer et des rondins.)
OUPS: (No, but if you bring me iron ore and logs, I could probably construct what you need.)

JAP: That works. How much do you need?
FR: Je vois. De combien en avez-vous besoin#?
OUPS: That works. How much do you need?

JAP: (I think ten of each should suffice.)
FR: (Je crois que dix morceaux de minerai de fer et dix rondins devraient être suffisants.)
OUPS: (I think ten of each should suffice.)

JAP: Okay. I'll be back in a bit.
FR: Entendu. Je vais m'en procurer.
OUPS: Okay. I'll be back in a bit.

JAP: Here. Is this enough?
FR: Tenez, est-ce assez pour fabriquer l'axe et les aubes#?
OUPS: Here. Is this enough?

JAP: (Ah, yes, the iron ore and logs. I will begin construction at once, but it may take some time. Is this all right?)
FR: (Ah, du minerai de fer et des rondins#! Oui, je peux m'y mettre tout de suite, mais il me faudra quelque temps pour fabriquer les pièces voulues.)
OUPS: (Ah, yes, the iron ore and logs. I will begin construction at once, but it may take some time. Is this all right?)

JAP: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)
FR: (J'irai les livrer moi-même quand j'aurai terminé. Demandez aux habitants de votre village de bien vouloir patienter, d'accord#?)
OUPS: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)

JAP: I'll let her know.
FR: Je m'en charge.
OUPS: I'll let her know.

JAP: (I will need ten pieces of iron ore and ten logs.)
FR: (J'aurai besoin de dix morceaux de minerai de fer et dix rondins.)
OUPS: (I will need ten pieces of iron ore and ten logs.)

JAP: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)
FR: (J'irai livrer les pièces moi-même quand j'aurai terminé. Demandez aux habitants de votre village de bien vouloir patienter, d'accord#?)
OUPS: (I will deliver the finished goods directly to the job site. Please tell the client to be patient.)

JAP: The parts are on the way, but it's going to take a little while.
FR: J'ai commandé les pièces nécessaires pour réparer la roue du moulin, mais elles ne sont pas encore prêtes.
OUPS: The parts are on the way, but it's going to take a little while.

JAP: The guy said he'd bring them to you when they're ready.
FR: Le marchand a dit qu'il les apporterait lui-même quand elles seront terminées.
OUPS: The guy said he'd bring them to you when they're ready.

JAP: That's great! I found someone to do the repair work, so we should be in business.
FR: Formidable#! J'ai trouvé quelqu'un qui pourra effectuer les réparations, alors tout devrait être réglé sous peu#!
OUPS: That's great! I found someone to do the repair work, so we should be in business.

JAP: I've got a little reward for all your hard work. Please accept it!
FR: Tiens, c'est pour te remercier de ton aide#! Je t'en prie, accepte#!
OUPS: I've got a little reward for all your hard work. Please accept it!

JAP: The village fountain is starting to break down. Sometimes it won't put out any water at all.
FR: La fontaine du village ne fonctionne plus très bien. Parfois, l'eau ne jaillit plus du tout.
OUPS: The village fountain is starting to break down. Sometimes it won't put out any water at all.

JAP: I would speculate that the source of the problem lies in the fountain's pump.
FR: Je présume que c'est au niveau de la pompe que réside le problème.
OUPS: I would speculate that the source of the problem lies in the fountain's pump.

JAP: That's my guess, too. I heard that you had parts made for the waterwheel, so I'm hoping you could do the same for the fountain.
FR: C'est bien ce que je pense, moi aussi. J'ai entendu dire que c'est toi qui as trouvé les pièces pour réparer la roue du moulin à eau.<PAGE>Je me suis dit que tu pourrais peut-être me donner un coup de main avec la fontaine.
OUPS: That's my guess, too. I heard that you had parts made for the waterwheel, so I'm hoping you could do the same for the fountain.

JAP: I'll look into it the next time I'm in Facade.
FR: Je verrai si je peux trouver une pompe la prochaine fois que je serai à Façade.
OUPS: I'll look into it the next time I'm in Facade.

JAP: Thanks for doing this!
FR: Je te remercie#!
OUPS: Thanks for doing this!

JAP: I need a replacement pump for a water fountain. You got anything like that?
FR: J'ai besoin d'une pompe de rechange pour une fontaine. Vous en avez#?
OUPS: I need a replacement pump for a water fountain. You got anything like that?

JAP: (A pump? No, that's not something I have.)
FR: (Une pompe#? Non, je n'en ai pas en stock.)
OUPS: (A pump? No, that's not something I have.)

JAP: (I could probably build one, but I'd need metal and electrical parts. It may be difficult to find them all.)
FR: (Je pourrais sans doute en fabriquer une, mais il me faudrait du métal et du matériel électrique. Il vous serait peut-être difficile de vous en procurer.)
OUPS: (I could probably build one, but I'd need metal and electrical parts. It may be difficult to find them all.)

JAP: What do you need?
FR: Dites-moi ce qu'il vous faut.
OUPS: What do you need?

JAP: (I need ten broken motors and ten severed cables. You should be able to salvage both from robots.)
FR: (J'aurais besoin de dix batteries à plat et dix câbles coupés. Vous devriez pouvoir en trouver en détruisant des robots.)
OUPS: (I need ten broken motors and ten severed cables. You should be able to salvage both from robots.)

JAP: All right. I'm on it.
FR: D'accord, je m'en charge.
OUPS: All right. I'm on it.

JAP: I got what you need.
FR: J'ai trouvé les matériaux dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I got what you need.

JAP: (Broken motors and severed cables... Yes, very good.)<PAGE>(Again, this will take a bit, but I will deliver it to the client when I am done.)
FR: (Ah, des batteries à plat et des câbles coupés#! Oui, très bien.)<PAGE>(Comme vous vous en doutez, il me faudra quelque temps pour fabriquer la pompe, mais j'irai la livrer directement au village dès qu'elle sera terminée.)
OUPS: (Broken motors and severed cables... Yes, very good.)<PAGE>(Again, this will take a bit, but I will deliver it to the client when I am done.)

JAP: I'll let him know.
FR: J'en avertirai les villageois.
OUPS: I'll let him know.

JAP: (I will need ten broken motors and ten severed cables.)
FR: (Il me faut dix batteries à plat et dix câbles coupés.)
OUPS: (I will need ten broken motors and ten severed cables.)

JAP: (You're becoming my best customer. I wish business was always this good.)
FR: (Si ça continue, vous serez bientôt mon meilleur client. Si seulement j'étais toujours aussi occupé...!)
OUPS: (You're becoming my best customer. I wish business was always this good.)

JAP: The pump is on its way. They'll deliver it once it's ready.
FR: J'ai commandé une pompe pour la fontaine. Le marchand viendra la livrer quand elle sera prête.
OUPS: The pump is on its way. They'll deliver it once it's ready.

JAP: Thanks much! Here's a little something just because I care.
FR: Merci beaucoup#! J'aimerais t'offrir ceci en guise de remerciement.
OUPS: Thanks much! Here's a little something just because I care.

JAP: Hey, remember that book you found for me? Well, there's another recipe that piqued my interest.
FR: Dites, vous vous souvenez du livre de cuisine que vous m'avez donné#? Eh bien, j'y ai trouvé une autre recette intéressante.
OUPS: Hey, remember that book you found for me? Well, there's another recipe that piqued my interest.

JAP: Would you mind helping me out again?
FR: Ça vous dirait de me donner encore un coup de main#?
OUPS: Would you mind helping me out again?

JAP: I hope it doesn't involve shark fins.
FR: J'espère qu'il n'est pas question d'ailerons de requin, cette fois.
OUPS: I hope it doesn't involve shark fins.

JAP: Nope! It's broiled catfish served over rice.
FR: Pas du tout#! C'est du poisson-chat grillé servi sur un lit de riz à la vapeur.
OUPS: Nope! It's broiled catfish served over rice.

JAP: I just need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice. Think you can help me out?
FR: Je n'ai besoin que de dix poissons-chats et dix sacs de riz. Pensez-vous pouvoir en trouver pour moi#?
OUPS: I just need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice. Think you can help me out?

JAP: I've got the ingredients.
FR: J'ai les ingrédients dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I've got the ingredients.

JAP: That's, uh... That's quite the fish, isn't it?
FR: Hum... Ce... ce ne sont pas des poissons comme les autres, hein#!
OUPS: That's, uh... That's quite the fish, isn't it?

JAP: I wasn't expecting it to be so slimy and smelly and gross.<PAGE>I don't suppose you'd help me out with the prep work?
FR: Je ne m'attendais pas à ce qu'ils soient aussi dégoûtants et visqueux.<PAGE>Euh, que diriez-vous de m'aider à les vider pendant que vous y êtes#?
OUPS: I wasn't expecting it to be so slimy and smelly and gross.<PAGE>I don't suppose you'd help me out with the prep work?

JAP: Sorry. The only knife work I know is cutting up Shades.
FR: Je ne sais étriper que les Ombres.
OUPS: Sorry. The only knife work I know is cutting up Shades.

JAP: Oh. Well, I guess this won't be going on the menu. Sorry about making you go all that way.
FR: Oh. Eh bien, j'imagine que je ne mettrai pas ce plat sur le menu après tout. Je suis désolé que vous vous soyez donné tant de mal pour rien.
OUPS: Oh. Well, I guess this won't be going on the menu. Sorry about making you go all that way.

JAP: Well, as long as I get paid, I don't really care. But it seems like a waste of a good fish.
FR: Du moment qu'on me paie, peu m'importe. Cela me semble pourtant dommage de gaspiller autant de poisson frais.
OUPS: Well, as long as I get paid, I don't really care. But it seems like a waste of a good fish.

JAP: That's all right. When my recipes don't turn out, I just feed them to the seals.
FR: Ah, ne vous inquiétez pas. Si je n'obtiens pas le résultat voulu en essayant de nouvelles recettes, j'en nourris les phoques.
OUPS: That's all right. When my recipes don't turn out, I just feed them to the seals.

JAP: So that's why they're all so fat.
FR: C'est donc pour cette raison qu'ils sont si dodus...
OUPS: So that's why they're all so fat.

JAP: I need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice.
FR: J'ai besoin de dix poissons-chats et dix sacs de riz.
OUPS: I need ten giant catfish and ten bags of rice.

JAP: (Do you like flowers?)
FR: (Aimez-vous les fleurs#?)
OUPS: (Do you like flowers?)

JAP: Why? You want me to join a cult?
FR: Pourquoi#? Voulez-vous me convertir à votre religion#?
OUPS: Why? You want me to join a cult?

JAP: (Oh, no! I just enjoy flowers. But there are so few out here in the desert.)
FR: (Rien de tel#! J'aime les fleurs, voilà tout. Cependant, il y en a si peu dans le désert.)
OUPS: (Oh, no! I just enjoy flowers. But there are so few out here in the desert.)

JAP: (My dream is to find some flower seeds and turn this desert into a beautiful garden.)
FR: (Mon rêve est de trouver des graines de fleurs et de transformer le désert en jardin magnifique.)
OUPS: (My dream is to find some flower seeds and turn this desert into a beautiful garden.)

JAP: (I'm trying to collect pink moonflower seeds. It would be great if I could get ten of them.)
FR: (Je cherche des graines roses. J'aimerais en trouver dix.)
OUPS: (I'm trying to collect pink moonflower seeds. It would be great if I could get ten of them.)

JAP: If I can track them down, they're all yours.
FR: Si j'arrive à m'en procurer, je vous les apporterai.
OUPS: If I can track them down, they're all yours.

JAP: (Really!? Oh, thank you!)

OUPS: Yes! YEEEES! Gold! That map was right all along!<PAGE>...I'm not sure it's enough to roll around in, but maybe I can make it work.

JAP: Oh, how wonderful. Now will you PLEASE promise to stop with all this treasure hunting?
FR: Oh, comme c'est merveilleux#! Mais maintenant, promets-moi que tu n'iras plus jamais à la recherche de trésors#!
OUPS: Oh, how wonderful. Now will you PLEASE promise to stop with all this treasure hunting?

JAP: I promise, honey. From now on, it's nothing but good, honest work for me.
FR: À partir d'aujourd'hui, plus d'aventures pour moi, ma chérie#! Promis#!
OUPS: I promise, honey. From now on, it's nothing but good, honest work for me.

JAP: Oh, but wait. There's one more thing...
FR: Oh, mais attends, j'oubliais presque...
OUPS: Oh, but wait. There's one more thing...

JAP: Here. This is the first map I ever found. ...Go ahead. Take it. I won't be needing it anymore.
FR: Tiens. C'est la première carte que j'aie jamais trouvée. Prends-la, je n'en ai plus besoin.
OUPS: Here. This is the first map I ever found. ...Go ahead. Take it. I won't be needing it anymore.

JAP: Thanks for your help earlier.
FR: Je te remercie de m'avoir aidée.
OUPS: Thanks for your help earlier.

JAP: Did you find it? Was there gold? Or silver? Or jewel-encrusted scepters with magnificent diamonds on every—
FR: Tu as trouvé une carte#! Où t'a-t-elle mené#? As-tu découvert un coffre rempli de pièces d'or#? De pièces d'argent#? Ou encore un sceptre incrusté de diamants#?
OUPS: Did you find it? Was there gold? Or silver? Or jewel-encrusted scepters with magnificent diamonds on every—

JAP: It was trash. A large, worthless pile of trash.
FR: Il n'y avait que des objets sans valeur... Une montagne d'objets sans valeur.
OUPS: It was trash. A large, worthless pile of trash.

JAP: ...Oh. Trash, huh? Damn.<PAGE>Well, I'm not gonna give up! I'll find another map, and I'll—
FR: ... Oh. Que de la camelote, hein#? Dommage.<PAGE>Eh bien, je n'abandonnerai pas#! Je trouverai une autre carte et...
OUPS: ...Oh. Trash, huh? Damn.<PAGE>Well, I'm not gonna give up! I'll find another map, and I'll—

JAP: Perhaps you should stop being such a self-absorbed jackass and instead spare a single thought for the woman you married!
FR: Bougre d'âne#! Modérez vos ambitions égoïstes et songez plutôt à votre femme#!
OUPS: Perhaps you should stop being such a self-absorbed jackass and instead spare a single thought for the woman you married!

JAP: Eeek!
FR: Aah#!
OUPS: Eeek!

JAP: Though I cannot imagine why, that woman cares very much for your safety.<PAGE>And each time you trudge forth from this house with dreams of avarice spinning 'round your shockingly insignificant mind, a small piece of her dies!
FR: Bien qu'il me soit difficile de croire que vous puissiez inspirer une telle dévotion, elle se fait beaucoup de souci à votre sujet#!<PAGE>Chaque fois que vous la quittez pour assouvir la sordide avarice qui vous aveugle, son âme se déchire#!
OUPS: Though I cannot imagine why, that woman cares very much for your safety.<PAGE>And each time you trudge forth from this house with dreams of avarice spinning 'round your shockingly insignificant mind, a small piece of her dies!

JAP: Would you truly put her through such agony!? Would you allow your greatest love to suffer so you can scratch at the earth for treasure like some headless barnyard hen!?
FR: Voulez-vous vraiment lui faire endurer tant d'angoisse#?! Sacrifieriez-vous votre bien-aimée afin de poursuivre votre quête de richesses illusoires#?!
OUPS: Would you truly put her through such agony!? Would you allow your greatest love to suffer so you can scratch at the earth for treasure like some headless barnyard hen!?

JAP: ...I think that's enough, Weiss.
FR: Je crois que ça suffit, Weiss...
OUPS: ...I think that's enough, Weiss.

JAP: Look. Your wife is worried. She wants you to stay home. She even offered to sell her hair ornament so you'd think I found something.
FR: Écoutez, votre femme s'inquiète pour vous. Elle veut que vous restiez à la maison.<PAGE>Elle a même offert de vendre sa barrette de jade pour essayer de vous convaincre que nous avions trouvé un trésor.
OUPS: Look. Your wife is worried. She wants you to stay home. She even offered to sell her hair ornament so you'd think I found something.

JAP: So maybe forget the treasure and start thinking about her. All right?
FR: Vous possédez déjà un trésor inestimable. Vous devriez peut-être l'apprécier à sa juste valeur.
OUPS: So maybe forget the treasure and start thinking about her. All right?

JAP: I didn't...I didn't know! I honestly didn't know!<PAGE>Oh, honey, I'm so sorry! I've been such a fool!
FR: Je... je ne savais pas qu'elle s'inquiétait autant#! Je vous le jure#!<PAGE>Oh, ma chérie, je suis tellement désolé#! Je ne suis qu'un imbécile#!
OUPS: I didn't...I didn't know! I honestly didn't know!<PAGE>Oh, honey, I'm so sorry! I've been such a fool!

JAP: It's all right, dear. I'm just...glad you understand.
FR: Ce n'est pas grave. Merci d'avoir compris...
OUPS: It's all right, dear. I'm just...glad you understand.

JAP: I've turned over a new leaf, friend. From now on, my life is devoted to my wife's happiness!
FR: Je me suis amendé, mon ami. Dorénavant, je dévouerai mon existence à rendre ma femme heureuse#!
OUPS: I've turned over a new leaf, friend. From now on, my life is devoted to my wife's happiness!

JAP: Oh, but wait. There's one more thing...
FR: Oh, mais attends, j'oubliais presque...
OUPS: Oh, but wait. There's one more thing...

JAP: Here. This is the first map I ever found. ...Go ahead. Take it. I won't be needing it anymore.
FR: Tiens. C'est la première carte que j'aie jamais trouvée. Prends-la, je n'en ai plus besoin.
OUPS: Here. This is the first map I ever found. ...Go ahead. Take it. I won't be needing it anymore.

JAP: Hmm... This map's a lot more cryptic than the last one.
FR: Hum... Cette carte est encore plus énigmatique que l'autre.
OUPS: Hmm... This map's a lot more cryptic than the last one.

JAP: Yet I feel confident the junk it will lead us to is the same!<PAGE>Come. We have little time to waste with these trifles.
FR: Et pourtant, je suis certain qu'elle ne nous mènera, elle aussi, qu'à de la pacotille#!<PAGE>Allons. Nous n'avons pas de temps à perdre avec de telles balivernes#!
OUPS: Yet I feel confident the junk it will lead us to is the same!<PAGE>Come. We have little time to waste with these trifles.

JAP: Yeah, but don't you want to check it out anyway? Aren't you the least bit curious?
FR: Tu as sans doute raison, mais ne veux-tu pas y jeter un coup d'œil#? N'es-tu pas curieux#?
OUPS: Yeah, but don't you want to check it out anyway? Aren't you the least bit curious?

JAP: Curiosity about such things is beyond my comprehension.
FR: Le fait que cette carte attise ta curiosité dépasse mon entendement.
OUPS: Curiosity about such things is beyond my comprehension.

JAP: It's called 'the thrill of the hunt,' Weiss.<PAGE>Now let's go talk to Popola and see if she can help with the map.
FR: C'est ce qu'on appelle l'excitation de la poursuite, Weiss#!<PAGE>Allons demander à Popola de nous donner un coup de main.
OUPS: It's called 'the thrill of the hunt,' Weiss.<PAGE>Now let's go talk to Popola and see if she can help with the map.

JAP: Hey. I've got another map for you.
FR: Salut, j'ai une autre carte à déchiffrer.
OUPS: Hey. I've got another map for you.

JAP: Sure! Let me take a look.
FR: Montre-la-moi.
OUPS: Sure! Let me take a look.

JAP: Here it is...
FR: Tiens.
OUPS: Here it is...

JAP: Hmm... The code on this is pretty tricky, but I think it's a map of the northern plains.
FR: Hum... J'ai du mal à la lire, mais je crois qu'il s'agit d'une carte de la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: Hmm... The code on this is pretty tricky, but I think it's a map of the northern plains.

JAP: It mentions something about the place where the iron bridge starts, but that's all I can read.
FR: On y mentionne l'extrémité d'un pont en métal... C'est tout ce que je peux te dire.
OUPS: It mentions something about the place where the iron bridge starts, but that's all I can read.

JAP: Sorry I can't be more help.
FR: Je suis désolée de ne pas avoir pu t'aider davantage.
OUPS: Sorry I can't be more help.

JAP: No, this is great, Popola. Thanks.
FR: Ce n'est pas grave, Popola. Merci.
OUPS: No, this is great, Popola. Thanks.

JAP: ...Wow.
FR: ... Incroyable.
OUPS: ...Wow.

JAP: It would appear this latest treasure map was the real thing.
FR: Il semblerait que cette carte soit une vraie.
OUPS: It would appear this latest treasure map was the real thing.

JAP: Yeah, I'd say this is an ample reward.
FR: Cette récompense est plus que suffisante.
OUPS: Yeah, I'd say this is an ample reward.

JAP: From now on, I'll be sure to think about my wife more. I promise.
FR: À l'avenir, je penserai d'abord au bien-être de ma femme, promis#!
OUPS: From now on, I'll be sure to think about my wife more. I promise.

JAP: Welcome back, Master Emil.
FR: Heureux de vous revoir, Monsieur Émile.
OUPS: Welcome back, Master Emil.

JAP: Hello, Sebastian! I'm glad you're doing well.
FR: Bonjour Sébastien#! Comment ça va#?
OUPS: Hello, Sebastian! I'm glad you're doing well.

JAP: Is something the matter, butler?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: Is something the matter, butler?

JAP: Yes, well... I am searching, sir, for a way to restore Master Emil's body to its previous state.
FR: Je cherche toujours un moyen de redonner à Monsieur Émile son apparence d'antan.
OUPS: Yes, well... I am searching, sir, for a way to restore Master Emil's body to its previous state.

JAP: Oh, Sebastian...
FR: Oh, Sébastien...
OUPS: Oh, Sebastian...

JAP: Regrettably, the above-ground archives are somewhat limited.
FR: Malheureusement, les archives du manoir ne sont pas très utiles.
OUPS: Regrettably, the above-ground archives are somewhat limited.

JAP: According to my information, the records related to Master Emil are stored in the second basement floor.
FR: Je crois que des documents faisant référence à Monsieur Émile sont entreposés quelque part au deuxième sous-sol.
OUPS: According to my information, the records related to Master Emil are stored in the second basement floor.

JAP: Things would be easier if I could delve into the manor's underground research facilities. But what with all the creatures there...
FR: Mes recherches pourraient progresser plus rapidement si j'avais accès aux archives du laboratoire de recherche souterrain. Toutefois, cet endroit fourmille d'Ombres...
OUPS: Things would be easier if I could delve into the manor's underground research facilities. But what with all the creatures there...

JAP: You want us to go down there and take out some Shades?
FR: Vous voulez que nous nous en débarrassions pour vous#?
OUPS: You want us to go down there and take out some Shades?

JAP: Oh no! I can't let you do that for me!
FR: Oh non#! Vous n'avez pas à le faire juste pour moi#!
OUPS: Oh no! I can't let you do that for me!

JAP: Knock it off, Emil. We're friends. This is what friends do.
FR: Ça suffit, Émile. Nous sommes tes amis et c'est la moindre des choses.
OUPS: Knock it off, Emil. We're friends. This is what friends do.

JAP: Please do keep yourself safe, Master Emil.
FR: Soyez prudent, Monsieur Émile.
OUPS: Please do keep yourself safe, Master Emil.

JAP: What's this...?
FR: Tiens...?
OUPS: What's this...?

JAP: It appears to be a list of names and addresses. Perhaps they were employed at the laboratory.
FR: On dirait une liste de noms et d'adresses... Il s'agit peut-être d'une liste des employés du laboratoire.
OUPS: It appears to be a list of names and addresses. Perhaps they were employed at the laboratory.

JAP: The text has half faded by this point, but I see one of them used to live in a "coastal town."
FR: Hum, l'encre a pâli avec l'âge... J'arrive à peine à la lire... Je crois que l'une d'entre eux habitait une «#ville côtière#».
OUPS: The text has half faded by this point, but I see one of them used to live in a "coastal town."

JAP: A coastal town? They must mean Seafront.
FR: Une «#ville côtière#»#? Probablement Littoral...
OUPS: A coastal town? They must mean Seafront.

JAP: The woman is most likely dead by now, but perhaps a search of her home will turn up something.
FR: Elle est décédée il y a des siècles, bien entendu, mais nous devrions peut-être aller jeter un coup d'œil à son ancienne demeure.
OUPS: The woman is most likely dead by now, but perhaps a search of her home will turn up something.

JAP: Oh, yeah, I've heard about them! They're that family that comes up with all the crazy inventions!<PAGE>...Not quite sure where they are, though.
FR: Ah oui, j'ai entendu parler de cette famille#! Ce sont des inventeurs depuis des générations, c'est ça#?<PAGE>... Je ne sais pas trop où ils habitent, par contre.
OUPS: Oh, yeah, I've heard about them! They're that family that comes up with all the crazy inventions!<PAGE>...Not quite sure where they are, though.

JAP: I keep hearing all kinds of weird noises comin' outta that house above the town entrance!<PAGE>I was gonna ask 'em what the deal was, but truth be told, I'm a little scared.
FR: On peut entendre toutes sortes de bruits bizarres venant de la maison au-dessus de l'entrée de la ville#!<PAGE>Je serais curieux de savoir ce qui se passe là-dedans, mais à vrai dire, j'ai un peu peur...
OUPS: I keep hearing all kinds of weird noises comin' outta that house above the town entrance!<PAGE>I was gonna ask 'em what the deal was, but truth be told, I'm a little scared.

JAP: The house above the town entrance? Let's go check it out.
FR: La maison au-dessus de l'entrée de la ville#? Allons y jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: The house above the town entrance? Let's go check it out.

JAP: Mind if I ask you something?
FR: Puis-je vous poser quelques questions#?
OUPS: Mind if I ask you something?

JAP: Not at all.
FR: Mais bien sûr.
OUPS: Not at all.

JAP: Did anyone in your family ever do weapon research? Anything like that?
FR: Est-ce que quelqu'un dans votre famille a déjà travaillé pour un laboratoire de recherche ou quelque chose du genre#?
OUPS: Did anyone in your family ever do weapon research? Anything like that?

JAP: Um...yeah. Yeah, actually, I think one of my older relatives used to do something like that.
FR: Euh... oui. Oui, une de mes ancêtres, je crois.
OUPS: Um...yeah. Yeah, actually, I think one of my older relatives used to do something like that.

JAP: Why are you asking me this?
FR: Pourquoi#?
OUPS: Why are you asking me this?

JAP: I'm looking into some of her research. You have any old records or anything?
FR: Sa recherche m'intéresse. Avez-vous toujours des documents qui lui appartenaient#?
OUPS: I'm looking into some of her research. You have any old records or anything?

JAP: Oh, man... Maybe? I dunno. If you hold on, I'll go take a look around.
FR: Oh, euh... Peut-être. Je ne sais pas vraiment. Si ça ne vous dérange pas d'attendre, je peux vérifier.
OUPS: Oh, man... Maybe? I dunno. If you hold on, I'll go take a look around.

JAP: Sorry about that. This is all I could find.
FR: Voilà. C'est tout ce que j'ai pu trouver, désolé.
OUPS: Sorry about that. This is all I could find.

JAP: It's a letter. ...How strange. It is written in a language that I do not recognize.
FR: On dirait une lettre. Étrange... Je ne connais pas cette langue.
OUPS: It's a letter. ...How strange. It is written in a language that I do not recognize.

JAP: Yeah, I don't recognize it either. We never could figure out what this was about.
FR: Je n'y comprends rien non plus. Personne n'a jamais pu découvrir ce qu'il y est écrit.
OUPS: Yeah, I don't recognize it either. We never could figure out what this was about.

JAP: But it was important, whatever it was. She kept this thing under lock and key at all times.
FR: Mais je sais qu'elle était importante. On raconte que mon ancêtre la gardait toujours dans son coffre-fort.
OUPS: But it was important, whatever it was. She kept this thing under lock and key at all times.

JAP: You know, it might be some kind of code that we can decipher back at the lab. You mind if we take this?
FR: Pourrions-nous l'emprunter#? Elle est peut-être écrite en code et il serait plus facile de la déchiffrer au manoir.
OUPS: You know, it might be some kind of code that we can decipher back at the lab. You mind if we take this?

JAP: Eh, go ahead. We've just been keeping it around because we don't know what else to do with it.
FR: Ne vous gênez pas. Je ne saurais pas quoi en faire de toute façon.
OUPS: Eh, go ahead. We've just been keeping it around because we don't know what else to do with it.

JAP: Let's go back to the manor and show this to the butler.
FR: Retournons au manoir et montrons ce document au majordome.
OUPS: Let's go back to the manor and show this to the butler.

JAP: Hmm... Looks like it's encrypted.
FR: Ah, je crois que ce document est écrit en code...
OUPS: Hmm... Looks like it's encrypted.

JAP: Yeah.
FR: Oui.
OUPS: Yeah.

JAP: Let's see...it starts with, 'Dearest Emil.' It appears to be a message for you, Master Emil.
FR: Il est écrit... «#Cher Émile#»... On dirait qu'il s'agit d'une lettre et qu'elle vous est adressée, Monsieur Émile.
OUPS: Let's see...it starts with, 'Dearest Emil.' It appears to be a message for you, Master Emil.

JAP: A letter, is it?
FR: Une lettre, hum#?
OUPS: A letter, is it?

JAP: T-to me!?
FR: Q-qui, moi#?!
OUPS: T-to me!?

JAP: Dearest Emil.
FR: «#Cher Émile,#»
OUPS: Dearest Emil.

JAP: You do not know me, but I know you. My research has twisted your life in unfathomable ways.
FR: «#Tu ne sais pas qui je suis, mais je te connais si bien. Après tout, ce sont mes expérimentations qui ont gâché ta vie pour toujours.#»
OUPS: You do not know me, but I know you. My research has twisted your life in unfathomable ways.

JAP: I tried to make up for this by serving as your mother, but I know now that my efforts fell far short.
FR: «#Pour me racheter, j'ai tenté d'être une mère pour toi, mais je sais bien que mes piètres efforts n'ont pas su te réconforter.#»
OUPS: I tried to make up for this by serving as your mother, but I know now that my efforts fell far short.

JAP: I would have done anything to save you from this fate, and you will never know how guilty I feel that I could not.
FR: «#J'aurais tout donné pour t'épargner ce sort. Tu ne sauras jamais à quel point je regrette de ne pas avoir pu le faire.#»
OUPS: I would have done anything to save you from this fate, and you will never know how guilty I feel that I could not.

JAP: ...I remember her now. Hundreds of years ago, there was a woman who watched over myself and my sister.
FR: Je me souviens d'elle, maintenant... Il y a des centaines et des centaines d'années, une femme s'occupait d'Halua et moi.
OUPS: ...I remember her now. Hundreds of years ago, there was a woman who watched over myself and my sister.

JAP: The other scientists treated us like lab rats, but that woman... She was really nice to us.
FR: Aux yeux des autres scientifiques, nous n'étions que des cobayes, mais elle... Elle était gentille.
OUPS: The other scientists treated us like lab rats, but that woman... She was really nice to us.

JAP: I think she kinda made me what I am today.
FR: Je pense que c'est grâce à elle que je suis comme je suis.
OUPS: I think she kinda made me what I am today.

JAP: Your mother, huh?
FR: Donc, elle était un peu comme ta mère adoptive...?
OUPS: Your mother, huh?

JAP: You know, I didn't find a way to fix my body, but I don't care anymore.
FR: Nous n'avons peut-être pas trouvé un moyen de restaurer mon corps, mais peu m'importe.
OUPS: You know, I didn't find a way to fix my body, but I don't care anymore.

JAP: This letter helped me recover my mother, and that means more to me than anything!
FR: Grâce à cette lettre, j'ai retrouvé ma mère et cela compte plus que tout#!
OUPS: This letter helped me recover my mother, and that means more to me than anything!

JAP: Master Emil? Terribly sorry to disturb you, but I fear we have a...situation.
FR: Monsieur Émile#? Je suis terriblement désolé de vous déranger, mais je crains que nous ayons un problème...
OUPS: Master Emil? Terribly sorry to disturb you, but I fear we have a...situation.

JAP: What is it, Sebastian?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il, Sébastien#?
OUPS: What is it, Sebastian?

JAP: I was attempting to tidy up the study earlier, only to find that it has been occupied by a Shade.
FR: Lorsque j'ai voulu nettoyer la bibliothèque un peu plus tôt, j'y ai découvert une Ombre.
OUPS: I was attempting to tidy up the study earlier, only to find that it has been occupied by a Shade.

JAP: That seems to be happening a lot lately.
FR: On dirait que ça arrive souvent ces temps-ci.
OUPS: That seems to be happening a lot lately.

JAP: You want me to go kill it?
FR: Voulez-vous que je m'en occupe#?
OUPS: You want me to go kill it?

JAP: That may not be necessary, sir. It's not causing any trouble; it is simply sitting in the study.
FR: Ce n'est peut-être pas nécessaire. Elle ne fait de mal à personne. Elle a simplement décidé de s'installer dans la bibliothèque.
OUPS: That may not be necessary, sir. It's not causing any trouble; it is simply sitting in the study.

JAP: It didn't attack you?
FR: Elle ne vous a pas attaqué#?
OUPS: It didn't attack you?

JAP: It did not, sir.
FR: Non.
OUPS: It did not, sir.

JAP: I don't care if it's wearing a tuxedo and drinking a cocktail! It's a Shade, and I'm going to kill it!
FR: Peu importe si elle est agressive ou non#! C'est une Ombre et je vais l'éliminer#!
OUPS: I don't care if it's wearing a tuxedo and drinking a cocktail! It's a Shade, and I'm going to kill it!

JAP: Whatever you think best, sir.
FR: Comme monsieur voudra.
OUPS: Whatever you think best, sir.

JAP: This must be the friendly Shade, eh?<PAGE>...Ah, screw it. Let's go kill the thing.
FR: Ce doit être cette Ombre «#apprivoisée#», hein#?<PAGE>Ah, peu importe. Allons nous en débarrasser.
OUPS: This must be the friendly Shade, eh?<PAGE>...Ah, screw it. Let's go kill the thing.

JAP: I killed the Shade in the study. ...Tough little bastard.
FR: Nous avons vaincu l'Ombre de la bibliothèque. Elle était coriace...
OUPS: I killed the Shade in the study. ...Tough little bastard.

JAP: Excellently done, sir. And now I must insist that you take this payment.
FR: Bravo#! Veuillez accepter cette récompense.
OUPS: Excellently done, sir. And now I must insist that you take this payment.

JAP: What was a Shade doing in there in the first place?
FR: Qu'est-ce qu'une Ombre pouvait bien faire dans la bibliothèque#?
OUPS: What was a Shade doing in there in the first place?

JAP: I wondered that myself. Surely that creature lacks the intelligence to read the books, yet I cannot imagine what else it hoped to accomplish there.
FR: Je me posais la même question. Il est impossible qu'elle possède l'intelligence nécessaire pour lire un livre, mais je ne vois pas ce qu'elle pourrait y faire d'autre.
OUPS: I wondered that myself. Surely that creature lacks the intelligence to read the books, yet I cannot imagine what else it hoped to accomplish there.

JAP: Hey! Buddy! You know a place called the Lost Shrine!?
FR: Oh, bonjour mon ami#! Avez-vous entendu parler du temple oublié#?
OUPS: Hey! Buddy! You know a place called the Lost Shrine!?

JAP: Yeah, I know about it.
FR: Oui, j'y suis même déjà allé.
OUPS: Yeah, I know about it.

JAP: Listen, I'm what's called a "botanist." That means I study plants.<PAGE>...This is all probably waaaay over your head, but just bear with me, all right, buddy?
FR: Parfait#! Je suis un botaniste, c'est-à-dire que je fais l'étude des végétaux.<PAGE>Tout ça est probablement beaucoup trop compliqué pour vous, mais essayez tout de même de me suivre, d'accord mon ami#?
OUPS: Listen, I'm what's called a "botanist." That means I study plants.<PAGE>...This is all probably waaaay over your head, but just bear with me, all right, buddy?

JAP: Anyway, there's this place called the Lost Shrine that supposedly contains a very rare tree. I'm looking for someone to go there and "borrow" a piece of the tree's root.
FR: Bien#! On dit qu'un arbre très rare pousse dans le temple oublié... Vous savez, l'endroit dont je viens tout juste de vous parler#?<PAGE>J'aimerais que vous trouviez cet arbre et que vous me rapportiez un morceau d'une de ses racines.
OUPS: Anyway, there's this place called the Lost Shrine that supposedly contains a very rare tree. I'm looking for someone to go there and "borrow" a piece of the tree's root.

JAP: Come on, buddy! It's just one little piece of root!
FR: Allez mon ami, juste un petit bout#! Ça ne devrait pas être trop difficile#!
OUPS: Come on, buddy! It's just one little piece of root!

JAP: I'll do it. But you have to stop calling me 'buddy.'
FR: C'est bon, j'accepte, mais je ne suis pas votre ami.
OUPS: I'll do it. But you have to stop calling me 'buddy.'

JAP: Aw, thanks buddy! You have no idea what this means for science!
FR: La science vous remercie d'avance, mon ami#!
OUPS: Aw, thanks buddy! You have no idea what this means for science!

JAP: Huh? Are there Shades here?
FR: Hum...? Des Ombres#?
OUPS: Huh? Are there Shades here?

JAP: This should be enough root. Let's get it back to that guy and hope he shuts up.
FR: Ceci devrait suffire. Rapportons cet échantillon au botaniste et espérons qu'il nous laissera tranquilles.
OUPS: This should be enough root. Let's get it back to that guy and hope he shuts up.

JAP: Here's your root. ...Buddy.
FR: J'ai le bout de racine dont vous aviez besoin... mon ami.
OUPS: Here's your root. ...Buddy.

JAP: Oh, how wonderful! This should help with my research! See, research is what a scientist does when—
FR: Formidable#! Il m'aidera à poursuivre mes recherches, c'est-à-dire l'ensemble des activités scientifiques qui me permettent...
OUPS: Oh, how wonderful! This should help with my research! See, research is what a scientist does when—

JAP: I know what research is. Get to the point.
FR: J'ai compris. Que voulez-vous découvrir#?
OUPS: I know what research is. Get to the point.

JAP: Oh! Well, um... See, fossil records show that, at one point in the distant past, all plant life just up and disappeared from the surface of our planet.
FR: Oh#! Euh... Eh bien, l'étude de fossiles a révélé qu'il y a très longtemps, toute trace de végétation a soudainement disparu de notre monde.

JAP: But of course, there are plants here now, which means they managed to come back. And I'm trying to figure out how that happened.

OUPS: But of course, there are plants here now, which means they managed to come back. And I'm trying to figure out how that happened.

JAP: ...Interesting. If you could figure that out, it might make growing crops a lot easier.
FR: Intéressant... Si vous arriviez, il pourrait être possible d'améliorer le rendement des récoltes.
OUPS: ...Interesting. If you could figure that out, it might make growing crops a lot easier.

JAP: ...Wow! You're way smarter than I thought, buddy! I didn't expect some big muscle-bound barbarian to know anything about...<PAGE>You know what? I'm going to shut up now. Here's your payment!
FR: Dites donc#! Vous êtes beaucoup plus intelligent que je ne le pensais, mon ami#! Jamais je n'aurais cru qu'un gros plein de muscles comme vous s'y connaîtrait en...<PAGE>... D'accord, je vais me taire. Voici votre récompense#!
OUPS: ...Wow! You're way smarter than I thought, buddy! I didn't expect some big muscle-bound barbarian to know anything about...<PAGE>You know what? I'm going to shut up now. Here's your payment!

JAP: Back to work, then!

OUPS: Back to work, then!

JAP: ...You know, you kinda smell like my boyfriend.
FR: ... Tu sais, tu as presque la même odeur que celle de mon petit ami.
OUPS: ...You know, you kinda smell like my boyfriend.

JAP: Your boyfriend smelled rugged and handsome, huh?
FR: Une odeur virile et enivrante, c'est ça#?
OUPS: Your boyfriend smelled rugged and handsome, huh?

JAP: Tee hee! Yeah, he did.<PAGE>Of course, that was a long time ago...
FR: Hi, hi, hi#! C'est exact#!<PAGE>Mais bien sûr, c'était il y a longtemps...
OUPS: Tee hee! Yeah, he did.<PAGE>Of course, that was a long time ago...

JAP: Five years ago, poof! He just up and vanished. I keep waiting for him, but I have no idea where he went or if he's...
FR: Il a disparu sans laisser de traces il y a cinq ans. Je l'attends toujours, mais je ne sais pas où il peut bien être ou s'il est...

FR: Hé, une seconde#! Tu es celui qui fait tout ce qu'on lui demande, n'est-ce pas#? Eh bien, va retrouver mon petit ami#!
OUPS: Hey! Wait a second! You're that guy who does whatever people ask him to do, right!? ...Well then, go find my boyfriend!

JAP: Did you find him?

JAP: That guy with the necklace, eh...?<PAGE>I dunno where he is, but you don't hear many good things about him.

OUPS: That guy with the necklace, eh...?<PAGE>I dunno where he is, but you don't hear many good things about him.

FR: Cet homme vendait toutes sortes de marchandises intéressantes à des prix plus que raisonnables#! C'était vraiment quelqu'un de bien...

OUPS: Great. Now the Junk Heap? Maybe he ran into the two brothers.

FR: Bienvenue, bienvenue, bienvenue#!

JAP: ...Oh my god. He's the guy we found in the Junk Heap.
FR: Mince...! C'est l'homme que nous avons trouvé dans la montagne des robots.
OUPS: ...Oh my god. He's the guy we found in the Junk Heap.

JAP: Sorry, what?

OUPS: Sorry, what?

JAP: Uh...nothing. Never mind.

OUPS: Uh...nothing. Never mind.

JAP: I tracked down your boyfriend.
FR: J'ai trouvé votre petit ami.

JAP: You did? Where is he!?
FR: Vraiment#? Où est-il#?!
OUPS: You did? Where is he!?

JAP: Well, I'm sorry to tell you this, but he's dead. We found his body five years ago in the Junk Heap.
FR: Il est décédé. Je suis désolé. Nous avons trouvé son corps dans la montagne des robots il y a cinq ans.

JAP: How's that?

OUPS: How's that?

FR: Pourquoi ne pas simplement en acheter un dans la ville#? Ce n'est qu'un ustensile de cuisine, après tout.
OUPS: Why not just buy one here in town? Why go to such lengths for a mere household utensil?

JAP: Unacceptable! The knife must come from the Junk Heap. I will pay you whatever it takes!
FR: Jamais#! Je veux un couteau de l'armurerie des frères. Je paierais n'importe quoi pour en obtenir un#!
OUPS: Unacceptable! The knife must come from the Junk Heap. I will pay you whatever it takes!

JAP: Well, if you say so...

OUPS: Well, if you say so...
