OUPS: Thank you. When you bring me the knife, I will give you the money.

JAP: Please get the kitchen knife for me, all right?

OUPS: Please get the kitchen knife for me, all right?

JAP: Hey. I'm looking for a kitchen knife.

FR: J'ai les dix morceaux d'alliage de titane dont tu avais besoin.
OUPS: I got your ten titanium alloys.

JAP: Great! I'll get to work on the knife right away. Eee hee hee...
FR: Formidable#! Je vais forger votre couteau tout de suite. Hi, hi, hi, hi#!
OUPS: Great! I'll get to work on the knife right away. Eee hee hee...

JAP: There you go. One elite kitchen knife.<PAGE>...Truth be told, that's one of the finest things I've ever made.
FR: Et voilà#! Un couteau de chef, comme vous me l'aviez demandé.<PAGE>... Sans me vanter, c'est l'une de mes meilleures créations.
OUPS: There you go. One elite kitchen knife.<PAGE>...Truth be told, that's one of the finest things I've ever made.

JAP: That good, huh?

OUPS: That good, huh?

JAP: Vegetable or bone, nothing cuts better. It's based off a design from my father.
FR: Vous ne pourriez pas trouver quelque chose de mieux pour couper ou trancher#! Je me suis inspiré des dessins de mon père.

JAP: Your father cooked?

OUPS: Your father cooked?

FR: Voici le couteau que vous vouliez.

JAP: Is something going on here?
FR: Vous semblez bien intéressé. Pourquoi#?
OUPS: Is something going on here?

JAP: No! No, no. ...Anyway, here's your reward.
FR: Euh, pour rien...! Ce n'était qu'une question comme ça. Voici votre récompense#!

JAP: He's all right, huh...

JAP: Hey, did you hear!? There's some crazy stuff going on over at the Junk Heap!

OUPS: Hey, did you hear!? There's some crazy stuff going on over at the Junk Heap!

JAP: What do you mean?

JAP: Huh?

FR: Non, ce n'est pas vrai#! Menteur#! MENTEUR#! C'est un robot qui a tué mon frère, pas une Ombre#! Un sale robot#! Il l'a écrasé sous une passerelle#!
OUPS: No they didn't! Liar! LIAR! Robots killed my brother, not Shades! Big nasty robots! Squashed him with a bridge!

JAP: Gonna kill the robots! Gonna kill 'em all! Rip 'em up! Rip 'em all up! Eeeee hee!
FR: Je tuerai les robots#! Je les tuerai tous#! Je les mettrai en pièces#! Oui, en pièces#! Ho, ho, ho, ho#!
OUPS: Gonna kill the robots! Gonna kill 'em all! Rip 'em up! Rip 'em all up! Eeeee hee!

JAP: Eeeeee hee hee hee! Isn't that right, Jakob? Right!? Eeee hee hee!
FR: Ho, ho, ho, ho#! Pas vrai, Jakob#? Ho, ho, ho, ho#!
OUPS: Eeeeee hee hee hee! Isn't that right, Jakob? Right!? Eeee hee hee!

JAP: I fear the lad's mind is gone. He seems capable of nothing but hate for those mindless mechanical automatons...
FR: Je crains qu'il n'ait sombré dans la folie. Il voue une haine impérissable à ces automates mécaniques...
OUPS: I fear the lad's mind is gone. He seems capable of nothing but hate for those mindless mechanical automatons...

JAP: (O great benefactor! Please hear our supplication!)
FR: (Ô généreux bienfaiteur#! Je vous en conjure, écoutez nos supplications#!)
OUPS: (O great benefactor! Please hear our supplication!)

JAP: ...What is it?
FR: ... Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: ...What is it?

JAP: (The wolves have dealt our city a devastating blow, and we are just starting to rebuild.)
FR: (Les loups ont ravagé notre ville et nous commençons à peine les réparations.)
OUPS: (The wolves have dealt our city a devastating blow, and we are just starting to rebuild.)

JAP: (However, the scale of the destruction was massive, and we find ourselves running low on metal and wood.)
FR: (Cependant, l'ampleur des dégâts est telle que nous sommes à court de métal et de bois.)
OUPS: (However, the scale of the destruction was massive, and we find ourselves running low on metal and wood.)

JAP: (We need to acquire twenty pieces of iron ore, twenty pieces of clay, and twenty logs. Please, O mighty one! Please aid us!)
FR: (Nous avons besoin de vingt morceaux de minerai de fer, vingt mottes d'argile et vingt rondins. Je vous en implore, ô noble sauveur#! Aidez-nous#!)
OUPS: (We need to acquire twenty pieces of iron ore, twenty pieces of clay, and twenty logs. Please, O mighty one! Please aid us!)

JAP: Yeah, all right. I'll do it. Just stop calling me mighty one.
FR: Oui, c'est bon, j'accepte, mais ne m'appelez pas «#noble sauveur#».
OUPS: Yeah, all right. I'll do it. Just stop calling me mighty one.

JAP: (Thank you for lending an ear to our plight!)
FR: (Je vous remercie humblement d'avoir entendu nos prières#!)
OUPS: (Thank you for lending an ear to our plight!)

JAP: I've got your stuff.
FR: J'ai les matériaux dont vous aviez besoin.
OUPS: I've got your stuff.

JAP: (Ah, perfect! This brings us one step closer to normalcy.)
FR: (Ah, parfait#! La restauration de la ville pourra maintenant continuer.)
OUPS: (Ah, perfect! This brings us one step closer to normalcy.)

JAP: (Here's a small token of our thanks. I hope you are willing to accept it.)
FR: (J'aimerais vous offrir ceci en témoignage de notre gratitude.)
OUPS: (Here's a small token of our thanks. I hope you are willing to accept it.)

JAP: (We need to acquire twenty pieces of iron ore, twenty pieces of clay, and twenty logs.)<PAGE>(Thank you, O mighty collector of wisdom and random parts!)
FR: (Nous avons besoin de vingt morceaux de minerai de fer, vingt mottes d'argile et vingt rondins.)<PAGE>(Je vous remercie, ô noble et sage pourvoyeur d'objets divers#!)
OUPS: (We need to acquire twenty pieces of iron ore, twenty pieces of clay, and twenty logs.)<PAGE>(Thank you, O mighty collector of wisdom and random parts!)

JAP: (We have a problem: A great number of people have gone missing in sandstorms lately.)
FR: (Nous avons un problème ces derniers temps... Plusieurs personnes se sont égarées dans les tempêtes de sable.)
OUPS: (We have a problem: A great number of people have gone missing in sandstorms lately.)

JAP: That's not good. You have any idea why?
FR: Voilà qui est inquiétant. Savez-vous pourquoi#?
OUPS: That's not good. You have any idea why?

JAP: (No. The soldiers even investigated, but they didn't find anything.)
FR: (Non. Nous avons tenté en vain de découvrir la raison de leur disparition.)
OUPS: (No. The soldiers even investigated, but they didn't find anything.)

JAP: Hmm... Troubling.
FR: Hum... Ce n'est pas rassurant.
OUPS: Hmm... Troubling.

JAP: There was a large Shade hiding inside the desert sandstorms. That's what happened to your people.
FR: Une Ombre puissante se dissimulait dans les tempêtes de sable. C'est à cause d'elle que les gens disparaissaient.
OUPS: There was a large Shade hiding inside the desert sandstorms. That's what happened to your people.

JAP: (It was inside the storm? ...No wonder we couldn't find it.)
FR: (Dans les tempêtes...? Il n'est pas étonnant que nous n'ayons pas pu la trouver#!)
OUPS: (It was inside the storm? ...No wonder we couldn't find it.)

JAP: (Thank you very much. Here is your payment.)
FR: (Je vous remercie. Voici votre récompense.)
OUPS: (Thank you very much. Here is your payment.)

JAP: Stay alert. Where there's one Shade, there's usually more.
FR: Soyez vigilants, d'autres Ombres aussi redoutables pourraient se cacher dans le désert.
OUPS: Stay alert. Where there's one Shade, there's usually more.

JAP: (Oh, what are we going to do...?)
FR: (Oh, qu'allons-nous faire...?)
OUPS: (Oh, what are we going to do...?)

JAP: Don't worry. We'll take care of it.
FR: Ne vous inquiétez pas. Nous nous en chargerons.
OUPS: Don't worry. We'll take care of it.

JAP: You can rest easy. We're used to this sort of thing by now.
FR: Nous sommes désormais experts en la matière. Soyez-en rassuré#!
OUPS: You can rest easy. We're used to this sort of thing by now.

JAP: (I wish we could help you for a change.)
FR: (Si seulement je pouvais vous aider...)
OUPS: (I wish we could help you for a change.)

JAP: (Legend has it that the Shades are desecrated forms of the kings that ruled in ancient times.)
FR: (La légende dit que les Ombres sont les âmes corrompues des rois d'antan.)
OUPS: (Legend has it that the Shades are desecrated forms of the kings that ruled in ancient times.)

JAP: (Why would the old kings yearn so much for life that they transformed themselves into those abominations?)
FR: (Pourquoi auraient-ils accepté de devenir des créatures aussi abominables...? Tenaient-ils tant à la vie#?)
OUPS: (Why would the old kings yearn so much for life that they transformed themselves into those abominations?)

JAP: (Thank you for dispatching the Shades. Here is a small reward for your work.)
FR: (Je vous remercie d'avoir éliminé les Ombres. J'aimerais vous offrir ceci en guise de récompense.)
OUPS: (Thank you for dispatching the Shades. Here is a small reward for your work.)

JAP: What are you doing in the middle of the desert?
FR: Que faites-vous au milieu du désert#?
OUPS: What are you doing in the middle of the desert?

JAP: (Oh, just tracking wolves. They've been on the move lately, so I was curious.)
FR: (Oh, je suis la trace d'une meute de loups. Ceux-ci se déplacent souvent ces derniers temps et je suis curieuse de savoir où ils se dirigent.)
OUPS: (Oh, just tracking wolves. They've been on the move lately, so I was curious.)

JAP: Oh. Well, uh...be careful, all right?
FR: ... Ah. Eh bien, soyez prudente, d'accord...?
OUPS: Oh. Well, uh...be careful, all right?

JAP: Hey, I remember you. Are you still tracking wolves?
FR: Tiens, vous revoilà. Toujours sur la trace de votre meute de loups#?
OUPS: Hey, I remember you. Are you still tracking wolves?

JAP: (No, I've moved on to Shades. They've been pretty active lately.)
FR: (Non, maintenant je suis des Ombres. Il y en a beaucoup depuis quelque temps.)
OUPS: (No, I've moved on to Shades. They've been pretty active lately.)

JAP: ...Huh. Well, be careful, all right?
FR: ... Ah. Eh bien, soyez prudente, d'accord...?
OUPS: ...Huh. Well, be careful, all right?

JAP: Hey. What's going on now?
FR: Bonjour. Que faites-vous maintenant#?
OUPS: Hey. What's going on now?

JAP: (They've been on the move lately, so I was curious.)
FR: (Ils se déplacent beaucoup, ces temps-ci, alors j'ai décidé de les suivre.)
OUPS: (They've been on the move lately, so I was curious.)

JAP: ...Who has been on the move?
FR: ... Qui donc#?
OUPS: ...Who has been on the move?

JAP: (The townspeople! Are you an idiot or something?)
FR: (Les habitants de la ville, bien entendu#! Quelle question bête#!)
OUPS: (The townspeople! Are you an idiot or something?)

JAP: Watch out! This thing is a Shade!
FR: Attention#! C'est une Ombre#!
OUPS: Watch out! This thing is a Shade!

JAP: There's more of 'em nearby!!<WAIT=2>
FR: Et elle n'est pas seule#!<WAIT=2>
OUPS: There's more of 'em nearby!!<WAIT=2>

JAP: (What's going on here!?)
FR: (Mais que se passe-t-il donc ici#?!)
OUPS: (What's going on here!?)

JAP: Can't you tell!?
FR: Ne pouvez-vous pas deviner#?!
OUPS: Can't you tell!?

JAP: (We can't let them get into the city! We must stop them here!)
FR: (Il faut à tout prix les empêcher de pénétrer dans la ville#! Nous devons les arrêter#!)
OUPS: (We can't let them get into the city! We must stop them here!)

JAP: I think that's it.
FR: Je crois que nous avons éliminé toutes les Ombres.
OUPS: I think that's it.

JAP: (It seems our people owe you another debt, outsider. At this rate, I may have to make you king and be done with it.)
FR: (Il semblerait que nous vous sommes redevables une fois de plus, mon ami. Si vous continuez ainsi, nous devrons bientôt vous couronner roi#!)
OUPS: (It seems our people owe you another debt, outsider. At this rate, I may have to make you king and be done with it.)

JAP: ...It's no big deal.
FR: ... Je n'ai pas fait grand-chose.
OUPS: ...It's no big deal.

JAP: But listen, we've got problems. When we first saw this Shade, it was disguised as one of the Masked People.
FR: Mais écoutez, la situation est grave. Lorsque nous avons aperçu cette Ombre, elle était déguisée en habitante de Façade.
OUPS: But listen, we've got problems. When we first saw this Shade, it was disguised as one of the Masked People.

JAP: (What!?)
FR: (Comment#?!)
OUPS: (What!?)

JAP: (Are you saying that there may be Shades among my own people?)
FR: (Vous voulez dire qu'il pourrait y avoir des Ombres parmi mon peuple#?)
OUPS: (Are you saying that there may be Shades among my own people?)

JAP: It's possible. You probably want to keep an eye out.
FR: C'est possible. Soyez vigilant.
OUPS: It's possible. You probably want to keep an eye out.

JAP: (Cursed Shades! I won't let you lay a single claw on my people!)
FR: (Maudites soient ces Ombres#! Je ne les laisserai pas toucher aux citoyens de ma ville#!)
OUPS: (Cursed Shades! I won't let you lay a single claw on my people!)

JAP: (Here's a small reward for you. Please, take it.)
FR: (J'aimerais vous offrir une récompense. Je vous en prie, acceptez-la.)
OUPS: (Here's a small reward for you. Please, take it.)

JAP: Ah, it's you. Good, good. Are you available to discuss a certain sensitive matter?
FR: Ah, <NIER>#! Aurais-tu quelques minutes à m'accorder#? J'aimerais discuter d'un sujet délicat avec toi.
OUPS: Ah, it's you. Good, good. Are you available to discuss a certain sensitive matter?

JAP: What is it?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: What is it?

JAP: People are saying that a Shade has managed to enter our village.
FR: Certains disent qu'une Ombre a réussi à s'infiltrer dans le village.
OUPS: People are saying that a Shade has managed to enter our village.

JAP: I was hoping you could track it down.
FR: Penses-tu pouvoir la trouver#?
OUPS: I was hoping you could track it down.

JAP: This isn't a very big place. Wouldn't we have seen it by now?
FR: Le village n'est pas bien grand. S'il y en avait une, je l'aurais déjà vue.
OUPS: This isn't a very big place. Wouldn't we have seen it by now?

JAP: I had my own doubts at first, but there have been too many witnesses for me to ignore this matter any longer.
FR: Au début, je n'étais pas certain qu'elle existait vraiment moi non plus. Cependant, je ne peux plus en douter, car trop de témoins l'ont aperçue.
OUPS: I had my own doubts at first, but there have been too many witnesses for me to ignore this matter any longer.

JAP: I saw a really scary monster!
FR: J'ai vu un monstre méchant#!
OUPS: I saw a really scary monster!

JAP: She saw it, too?
FR: Elle a vu l'Ombre, elle aussi#?
OUPS: She saw it, too?

JAP: Apparently. I can't say for sure who's seen it.
FR: Apparemment. Je ne sais pas qui l'a vraiment vue ou pas.
OUPS: Apparently. I can't say for sure who's seen it.

JAP: I saw the monster right around here!
FR: J'ai vu le monstre par ici#!
OUPS: I saw the monster right around here!

JAP: You did, huh? Can you tell me what the monster looked like?
FR: Ah bon#? Peux-tu me dire à quoi ressemblait le monstre#?
OUPS: You did, huh? Can you tell me what the monster looked like?

JAP: It was over at the river, and it was huge and scary! ...I didn't like it.
FR: Il était près de la rivière et il était énorme et méchant#!...#J'ai eu peur.
OUPS: It was over at the river, and it was huge and scary! ...I didn't like it.

JAP: Over by the river, eh? Let's go take a look.
FR: Près de la rivière, c'est ça#? Allons jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: Over by the river, eh? Let's go take a look.

JAP: I saw it near the river! It was HUGE!
FR: J'ai vu le monstre près de la rivière#! Il était ÉNORME#!
OUPS: I saw it near the river! It was HUGE!

JAP: ...I don't know. It doesn't look like a Shade was ever here.
FR: Hum... Il n'y a aucune trace d'une Ombre.
OUPS: ...I don't know. It doesn't look like a Shade was ever here.

JAP: Perhaps the young lass misremembered the location.
FR: La fillette s'est peut-être trompée.
OUPS: Perhaps the young lass misremembered the location.

JAP: Yeah, maybe. Kids aren't so great at stuff like that. Let's go ask her again.
FR: C'est possible. Les enfants ont parfois de la difficulté à se souvenir de tels détails. Retournons le lui demander.
OUPS: Yeah, maybe. Kids aren't so great at stuff like that. Let's go ask her again.

JAP: We went over to where you saw the monster, but we couldn't find anything. Are you sure you saw it by the river?
FR: Nous avons examiné l'endroit où tu as dit que tu avais vu le monstre, mais nous n'avons rien trouvé. Es-tu certaine de l'avoir aperçu près de la rivière#?
OUPS: We went over to where you saw the monster, but we couldn't find anything. Are you sure you saw it by the river?

JAP: Um...no. Oh! Oh, oh! I remember now!
FR: Euh... non. Oh#! Oh#! Maintenant, je me souviens#!
OUPS: Um...no. Oh! Oh, oh! I remember now!

JAP: I saw it in the square in front of the library!
FR: Le monstre était dans la cour devant la bibliothèque#!
OUPS: I saw it in the square in front of the library!

JAP: Okay. Let's go check it out.
FR: Compris. Nous irons vérifier.
OUPS: Okay. Let's go check it out.

JAP: I saw it behind the library gate!
FR: J'ai vu le monstre devant la bibliothèque#!
OUPS: I saw it behind the library gate!

JAP: ...There's nothing here. Guess the kid was wrong again.
FR: ... Il n'y a rien ici non plus. La fillette doit s'être encore trompée.
OUPS: ...There's nothing here. Guess the kid was wrong again.

JAP: This is a fool's errand. Even a young girl would hardly confuse a library gate with a river. Perhaps we should ask some of the other villagers.
FR: Tout cela ne mène à rien. Même une fillette devrait savoir faire la différence entre le devant d'une bibliothèque et le bord d'une rivière#!<PAGE>Nous devrions peut-être interroger d'autres villageois.
OUPS: This is a fool's errand. Even a young girl would hardly confuse a library gate with a river. Perhaps we should ask some of the other villagers.

JAP: Yeah, maybe...
FR: Tu as sans doute raison...
OUPS: Yeah, maybe...

JAP: I saw a big scary monster at the square in front of the southern gate!
FR: J'ai vu un gros monstre méchant devant la porte du sud#!
OUPS: I saw a big scary monster at the square in front of the southern gate!

JAP: I think I saw the Shade a few days ago, but I can't be sure.<PAGE>But whatever I saw, it wasn't much bigger than a kid.
FR: Je crois que j'ai aperçu l'Ombre il y a quelques jours, mais je n'en suis pas certaine.<PAGE>Elle avait environ la taille d'un enfant.
OUPS: I think I saw the Shade a few days ago, but I can't be sure.<PAGE>But whatever I saw, it wasn't much bigger than a kid.

JAP: I saw something near the shopping district that kinda sorta looked like a Shade. You know...if you squinted.
FR: J'ai vu quelque chose qui aurait pu être une Ombre près du marché... En plissant les yeux, disons.
OUPS: I saw something near the shopping district that kinda sorta looked like a Shade. You know...if you squinted.

JAP: A Shade? Oh, yes, I saw it. Gave me quite a start, let me tell you!<PAGE>Strange thing was, it seemed to be accompanied by a child.
FR: L'Ombre#? Oh oui, je l'ai vue#! J'ai eu une frousse terrible#!<PAGE>Ce qui est bizarre, c'est qu'elle semblait être accompagnée d'un enfant.
OUPS: A Shade? Oh, yes, I saw it. Gave me quite a start, let me tell you!<PAGE>Strange thing was, it seemed to be accompanied by a child.

JAP: The girl's story is not agreeing very well with the rest of the villagers' testimony. I think we should question her a bit further.
FR: On dirait que les affirmations de la fillette ne concordent pas avec celles des autres villageois. Je crois que nous devrions l'interroger de nouveau.
OUPS: The girl's story is not agreeing very well with the rest of the villagers' testimony. I think we should question her a bit further.

JAP: Listen, I'm not angry. But I need you to tell me the truth. Why did you lie about the Shade?
FR: Écoute, je ne suis pas en colère, mais je veux que tu me dises la vérité. Pourquoi as-tu menti au sujet de l'Ombre#?
OUPS: Listen, I'm not angry. But I need you to tell me the truth. Why did you lie about the Shade?

JAP: I'm NOT lying! I saw it! It was big and scary and...and...and big!
FR: J'ai pas menti#! Je l'ai vue#! Elle était énorme et méchante et... et... et... énorme#!
OUPS: I'm NOT lying! I saw it! It was big and scary and...and...and big!

JAP: Tell us this, then: In which location did you NOT see the Shade?
FR: Alors, dis-moi, où n'as-tu pas aperçu l'Ombre#?
OUPS: Tell us this, then: In which location did you NOT see the Shade?

JAP: ...You're weird.<PAGE>But, um...I guess I didn't see it near the northern gate or on the hill to the west!
FR: ... Tu es étrange.<PAGE>Euh... je crois que je l'ai jamais vue près de la porte du nord ou la colline à l'ouest#!
OUPS: ...You're weird.<PAGE>But, um...I guess I didn't see it near the northern gate or on the hill to the west!

JAP: The monster isn't at the northern gate or the western hill. Okay?
FR: Le monstre est pas près de la porte du nord ou sur la colline à l'ouest.
OUPS: The monster isn't at the northern gate or the western hill. Okay?

JAP: Very well.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: Very well.

JAP: There it is.
FR: La voilà.
OUPS: There it is.

JAP: The little girl must have been trying to protect it.
FR: La petite voulait probablement la protéger.
OUPS: The little girl must have been trying to protect it.

JAP: A touching story, but humans and Shades cannot coexist. We'd best defeat this monster while we can.
FR: Tout cela est bien touchant, mais les humains et les Ombres ne peuvent coexister. Nous devrions l'éliminer sans plus tarder.
OUPS: A touching story, but humans and Shades cannot coexist. We'd best defeat this monster while we can.

JAP: I suppose...
FR: Tu as sans doute raison...
OUPS: I suppose...

JAP: Thank you very much. I was having trouble sleeping knowing there were Shades in our very town!
FR: Je te remercie. Je n'ai pas dormi depuis que j'ai appris que cette Ombre rôdait dans notre village#!
OUPS: Thank you very much. I was having trouble sleeping knowing there were Shades in our very town!

JAP: Thank you very much. I was having trouble sleeping knowing there were Shades in our very town!
FR: Je te remercie. Je n'ai pas dormi depuis que j'ai appris que cette Ombre rôdait dans notre village#!
OUPS: Thank you very much. I was having trouble sleeping knowing there were Shades in our very town!

JAP: ...Hmm, he's not here. I wonder where he went?
FR: Hum... Je me demande où le monstre est allé...
OUPS: ...Hmm, he's not here. I wonder where he went?

JAP: Hey there. Long time no see. How you doing?
FR: Bonjour#! Il y a longtemps que nous nous sommes vus. Comment allez-vous#?
OUPS: Hey there. Long time no see. How you doing?

JAP: Great, thanks! My freesias are selling like hotcakes!
FR: Très bien, merci#! Mes freesias se vendent comme des petits pains#!
OUPS: Great, thanks! My freesias are selling like hotcakes!

JAP: Good to hear. ...Hey, who's that?
FR: Formidable. Et qui sont-ils#?
OUPS: Good to hear. ...Hey, who's that?

JAP: That's my wife and son.
FR: Ma femme et mon fils.
OUPS: That's my wife and son.

JAP: Ah. Good to see you found someone in the end.
FR: Ah, je suis heureux de voir que vous avez trouvé l'âme sœur après tout.
OUPS: Ah. Good to see you found someone in the end.

JAP: Yes. It took some time, but I was finally able to move on.<PAGE>Oh, that reminds me. Are you looking for work?
FR: Oui, ça m'a pris beaucoup de temps, mais je me suis finalement remis.<PAGE>Oh, au fait, cherchez-vous du travail#?
OUPS: Yes. It took some time, but I was finally able to move on.<PAGE>Oh, that reminds me. Are you looking for work?

JAP: Always. What do you need?
FR: Toujours. Avez-vous besoin de mes services#?
OUPS: Always. What do you need?

JAP: I have a customer in Facade who needs a freesia, and I was hoping you'd make the delivery.
FR: Une de mes clientes de Façade voudrait un bouquet de freesias. Pourriez-vous le lui apporter#?
OUPS: I have a customer in Facade who needs a freesia, and I was hoping you'd make the delivery.

JAP: My customer runs the material shop over there. I know it's a bit out of the way, but...
FR: Ma cliente est la marchande de matériaux de la ville. Je sais que c'est plutôt loin, mais...
OUPS: My customer runs the material shop over there. I know it's a bit out of the way, but...

JAP: It's no big deal. I'll take the job.
FR: Ce n'est pas grave. Je m'en occupe.
OUPS: It's no big deal. I'll take the job.

JAP: Thanks!
FR: Merci#!
OUPS: Thanks!

JAP: Deliver a freesia to Facade for me, all right?
FR: Donnez ce bouquet de freesias à la marchande de matériaux de Façade, d'accord#?
OUPS: Deliver a freesia to Facade for me, all right?

JAP: You expecting a freesia?
FR: Vous avez commandé un bouquet de freesias#?
OUPS: You expecting a freesia?

JAP: Oh my... This certainly brings back memories.
FR: Oh... Ces fleurs réveillent tant de souvenirs.
OUPS: Oh my... This certainly brings back memories.

JAP: Memories of what?
FR: Quelle sorte de souvenirs#?
OUPS: Memories of what?

JAP: Of many things, both pleasant and sad. I used to live in The Aerie, you see.
FR: Heureux, tristes, qui sait... J'habitais l'Aire, autrefois, vous savez.
OUPS: Of many things, both pleasant and sad. I used to live in The Aerie, you see.

JAP: Oh. Then I suppose I should tell you—
FR: Oh. Je devrais probablement vous dire que...
OUPS: Oh. Then I suppose I should tell you—

JAP: That it's been destroyed? Yes, I...I know
FR: Qu'elle a été détruite#? Oui, je le sais...
OUPS: That it's been destroyed? Yes, I...I know

JAP: The little girl who lived next door to me used to love her freesias. We used to put them in our hair, and...
FR: La jeune fille qui habitait près de chez moi adorait les freesias. Nous en portions dans nos cheveux...
OUPS: The little girl who lived next door to me used to love her freesias. We used to put them in our hair, and...

JAP: Anyway, one day she was attacked by a Shade.
FR: Un jour, une Ombre l'a attaquée...
OUPS: Anyway, one day she was attacked by a Shade.

JAP: Before I could do anything, she turned into a monster.
FR: ... et elle l'a transformée en monstre avant que je ne puisse faire un geste.
OUPS: Before I could do anything, she turned into a monster.

JAP: I don't think the adults believed me, but I know it happened. I know it.
FR: Personne n'a voulu me croire, mais c'est la vérité.
OUPS: I don't think the adults believed me, but I know it happened. I know it.

JAP: ...Anyway, that's enough of that. Thank you for the flower.
FR: Bon, je préférerais ne plus en parler. Merci encore de m'avoir apporté ce bouquet.
OUPS: ...Anyway, that's enough of that. Thank you for the flower.

JAP: That tale sounds sadly familiar, yes?
FR: Son histoire ressemble à celles de tant d'autres victimes...
OUPS: That tale sounds sadly familiar, yes?

JAP: Yeah. It does.
FR: Malheureusement.
OUPS: Yeah. It does.

JAP: This flower holds some terrible memories, but some good ones as well.
FR: Ces fleurs évoquent en moi autant de doux souvenirs que de souvenirs amers.
OUPS: This flower holds some terrible memories, but some good ones as well.

JAP: I delivered the freesia.
FR: J'ai apporté le bouquet de freesias à votre cliente.
OUPS: I delivered the freesia.

JAP: Oh hey, thanks. Here's your fee.
FR: Oh, je vous remercie. Voici votre récompense.
OUPS: Oh hey, thanks. Here's your fee.

JAP: <LIST=1738>Mention his lover.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1738>Lui dire ce qui est arrivé à sa petite amie.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1738>Mention his lover.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1739>Leave it be.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1739>Ne rien dire.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1739>Leave it be.</LIST>

JAP: Listen, this isn't going to be easy, but I think you have a right to know.<PAGE>Do you remember the letter you sent your lover five years ago? Well...
FR: Écoutez, j'ai quelque chose d'important à vous dire. Vous aurez sans doute du mal à l'accepter, mais...<PAGE>Vous souvenez-vous de la lettre que vous nous aviez demandé d'apporter à votre petite amie il y a cinq ans#? Eh bien...
OUPS: Listen, this isn't going to be easy, but I think you have a right to know.<PAGE>Do you remember the letter you sent your lover five years ago? Well...

JAP: What...? No. Oh, no...
FR: Quoi...? Non... Oh non...
OUPS: What...? No. Oh, no...

JAP: I'm sorry.
FR: Je suis désolé.
OUPS: I'm sorry.

JAP: If I would have just called her over here sooner...
FR: Si seulement je lui avais demandé de venir me rejoindre plus tôt...
OUPS: If I would have just called her over here sooner...

JAP: Probably best to leave him alone for now.
FR: Nous devrions sans doute le laisser seul.
OUPS: Probably best to leave him alone for now.

JAP: Yeah.
FR: D'accord.
OUPS: Yeah.

JAP: Say, where's your husband?
FR: Dites, où est votre mari#?
OUPS: Say, where's your husband?

JAP: Last night he grabbed a sword and stormed out of the house! I tell you, I've never seen him look so angry!
FR: Hier soir, il a pris son épée et il est sorti#! Je ne l'avais jamais vu aussi furieux#!
OUPS: Last night he grabbed a sword and stormed out of the house! I tell you, I've never seen him look so angry!

JAP: ...That doesn't sound good.
FR: ... Ça ne me dit rien qui vaille.
OUPS: ...That doesn't sound good.

JAP: He'll be back. I know it. And my child and I will wait for him as long as it takes.
FR: Il reviendra. J'en suis certaine. Je l'attendrai ici avec mon fils aussi longtemps qu'il le faudra.
OUPS: He'll be back. I know it. And my child and I will wait for him as long as it takes.

JAP: He'll be back. I know it. And my child and I will wait for him as long as it takes.
FR: Il reviendra. J'en suis certaine. Je l'attendrai ici avec mon fils aussi longtemps qu'il le faudra.
OUPS: He'll be back. I know it. And my child and I will wait for him as long as it takes.

JAP: Where did Daddy go?
FR: Où est papa#?
OUPS: Where did Daddy go?

JAP: You have a good wife and a fine son. Take care of them, all right?
FR: Prenez soin de votre femme et votre fils, d'accord#?
OUPS: You have a good wife and a fine son. Take care of them, all right?

JAP: I will! My family is everything to me, and I'll do whatever it takes to keep them happy.
FR: Bien sûr#! Ma famille est ce qu'il y a de plus important pour moi et je ferais tout pour elle.
OUPS: I will! My family is everything to me, and I'll do whatever it takes to keep them happy.

JAP: I'll do whatever it takes to keep my family happy.
FR: Je ferais tout pour ma famille.
OUPS: I'll do whatever it takes to keep my family happy.

JAP: You know anything about some kind of magical fortunetelling stone?
FR: As-tu déjà entendu parler de pierres de divination magiques#?
OUPS: You know anything about some kind of magical fortunetelling stone?

JAP: Oh, you mean the Eye of Power?
FR: Oh, tu veux dire comme un œil de puissance#?
OUPS: Oh, you mean the Eye of Power?

JAP: And yes, I know it's a funny name, but that's what they're called.
FR: ... Oui, je sais que c'est un nom ridicule, mais ce n'est pas moi qui l'ai inventé.
OUPS: And yes, I know it's a funny name, but that's what they're called.

JAP: Why do you ask?
FR: Pourquoi aurais-tu besoin d'un objet pareil#?
OUPS: Why do you ask?

JAP: Doing a favor for someone. You have any idea where I can get one?
FR: C'est pour rendre service à quelqu'un. Alors, sais-tu où je pourrais en trouver#?
OUPS: Doing a favor for someone. You have any idea where I can get one?

JAP: Hmmm... Well, there used to be some on the roof of the Lost Shrine. I suppose they're still there.
FR: Hum... Il y en avait autrefois sur le toit du temple oublié. Il en reste peut-être toujours.
OUPS: Hmmm... Well, there used to be some on the roof of the Lost Shrine. I suppose they're still there.

JAP: All right. I'll give the Lost Shrine a shot.
FR: D'accord, j'irai y jeter un coup d'œil.
OUPS: All right. I'll give the Lost Shrine a shot.

JAP: This must be an Eye of Power.
FR: Ce doit être ce que nous cherchions...
OUPS: This must be an Eye of Power.

JAP: Oh my gosh! I can feel magic just pouring out of it!
FR: Ouah...! Je peux sentir la magie qui s'en émane d'ici#!
OUPS: Oh my gosh! I can feel magic just pouring out of it!

JAP: I must say, I'm impressed. Telling one's fortune with such a powerful stone could produce rather accurate results.
FR: Je dois avouer que je suis impressionné. Avec une pierre qui regorge d'énergie magique comme celle-ci, il serait possible de prédire l'avenir avec une certaine certitude.
OUPS: I must say, I'm impressed. Telling one's fortune with such a powerful stone could produce rather accurate results.

JAP: Ngh...
FR: Oh...
OUPS: Ngh...

JAP: ...The hell? Where are we?
FR: Bordel...! On est où, au juste#?
OUPS: ...The hell? Where are we?

JAP: I've never seen anything like this before.
FR: Je n'ai jamais vu d'endroit pareil#!
OUPS: I've never seen anything like this before.

JAP: This is no time for idle sightseeing! The Shades approach!
FR: Ce n'est pas le moment de poser des questions#! Des Ombres nous attaquent#!
OUPS: This is no time for idle sightseeing! The Shades approach!

JAP: Oh, thank the gods you're here! We've got trouble!
FR: Oh, les dieux soient loués#! Te voilà#! Nous avons des ennuis#!
OUPS: Oh, thank the gods you're here! We've got trouble!

JAP: What kind of trouble?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: What kind of trouble?

JAP: There's a wild boar in the northern plains who's started attacking villagers.
FR: Un sanglier a attaqué des villageois sur la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: There's a wild boar in the northern plains who's started attacking villagers.

JAP: The victims all made it back, but who knows if we'll be so lucky next time...
FR: Ils ne sont que blessés, mais sa prochaine victime n'aura peut-être pas autant de chance...
OUPS: The victims all made it back, but who knows if we'll be so lucky next time...

JAP: ...So you want me to go kill it?
FR: ... Alors, vous voulez que je l'abatte#?
OUPS: ...So you want me to go kill it?

JAP: Yes. And we'll be sure to pay you well.
FR: Oui, et nous te récompenserons largement.
OUPS: Yes. And we'll be sure to pay you well.

JAP: All right.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: All right.

JAP: Oh, and a word of advice: Once you kill it, make sure you take a boar tusk.
FR: Oh, et n'oublie pas de récupérer une défense de sanglier après l'avoir vaincu.
OUPS: Oh, and a word of advice: Once you kill it, make sure you take a boar tusk.

JAP: Let's just say it'll come in handy.
FR: Je suis certain qu'elle pourrait t'être utile.
OUPS: Let's just say it'll come in handy.

JAP: Hurry! Go kill that boar!
FR: Dépêche-toi d'aller tuer le sanglier#!
OUPS: Hurry! Go kill that boar!

JAP: You hunted down the boar? Oh, thank you!
FR: Tu as tué le sanglier#? Oh, je te remercie#!
OUPS: You hunted down the boar? Oh, thank you!

JAP: And it looks like you found a boar tusk, too!
FR: Et je vois que tu as aussi trouvé une défense de sanglier#!
OUPS: And it looks like you found a boar tusk, too!

JAP: They say that boars become tame around anyone who carries one.
FR: On dit que ceux qui en détiennent une peuvent apprivoiser les sangliers.
OUPS: They say that boars become tame around anyone who carries one.

JAP: Apparently, they'll even let you ride around on their backs!
FR: Tu pourrais même monter sur leur dos, à ce qu'il paraît#!
OUPS: Apparently, they'll even let you ride around on their backs!

JAP: That sounds like hokum to me, but if you're brave enough, you might as well give it a shot.
FR: À mon avis, ce ne sont que des balivernes, mais si tu en as le courage, tu devrais sans doute essayer.
OUPS: That sounds like hokum to me, but if you're brave enough, you might as well give it a shot.

JAP: Now we can walk the plains in peace again.
FR: Désormais, nous pourrons traverser la plaine en paix.
OUPS: Now we can walk the plains in peace again.

JAP: No one buys new clothes anymore! They all just want me to repair their old ones.
FR: Plus personne n'achète de nouveaux vêtements#! Mes clients me demandent plutôt de raccommoder leurs vêtements usés.
OUPS: No one buys new clothes anymore! They all just want me to repair their old ones.

JAP: After the kids she used to take care of by the fountain died, my grandmother's mind began to slip.
FR: Depuis que les enfants dont elle s'occupait près de la fontaine sont décédés, ma grand-mère sombre peu à peu dans la folie.
OUPS: After the kids she used to take care of by the fountain died, my grandmother's mind began to slip.

JAP: I'm worried about you. You've been a different person since Yonah was taken away.
FR: Je me fais aussi du souci pour toi, <NIER>. Tu n'es plus le même depuis que Yonah a été enlevée.
OUPS: I'm worried about you. You've been a different person since Yonah was taken away.

JAP: I'll be fine once I get her back.
FR: Tout ira mieux lorsqu'elle sera de retour.
OUPS: I'll be fine once I get her back.

JAP: *Sigh* I've been waiting for sales to rebound for years now...
FR: *soupir* J'attends que les ventes grimpent depuis des années…
OUPS: *Sigh* I've been waiting for sales to rebound for years now...

JAP: You're leaving the village? Really? But...but what about all the Shades that keep cropping up?
FR: Tu ne vas pas rester au village#? Vraiment#? Mais... et les Ombres qui rôdent tout autour#?
OUPS: You're leaving the village? Really? But...but what about all the Shades that keep cropping up?

JAP: C'mon, shop here more often! I'm damn near broke!
FR: Allez, achète plus de mes marchandises ou je ferai faillite#!
OUPS: C'mon, shop here more often! I'm damn near broke!

JAP: Thanks for coming. I'm doing everything I can to keep my inventory up, but it's tricky.
FR: Bienvenue#! Je fais ce que je peux pour m'approvisionner, mais ce n'est pas facile.
OUPS: Thanks for coming. I'm doing everything I can to keep my inventory up, but it's tricky.

JAP: Things sure are rough lately.
FR: Les temps sont durs en ce moment.
OUPS: Things sure are rough lately.

JAP: I know it's a hard world, but what better time to make your flowers blossom?
FR: Même si nous vivons dans un monde ravagé, cultiver mon jardin me donne de l'espoir.
OUPS: I know it's a hard world, but what better time to make your flowers blossom?

JAP: My husband keeps nagging me about how this is no time to grow flowers.
FR: Mon mari n'arrête pas de me dire que ce n'est pas le moment de planter des fleurs.
OUPS: My husband keeps nagging me about how this is no time to grow flowers.

JAP: It's been five years since those Shades attacked. To think they pretty much control the northern plains now...
FR: Les Ombres nous ont attaqués il y a cinq ans déjà... Et désormais, elles dominent la plaine septentrionale.
OUPS: It's been five years since those Shades attacked. To think they pretty much control the northern plains now...

JAP: I had the Shadowlord in my sights, and I couldn't finish him...
FR: J'ai eu l'occasion de vaincre le Maître des Ombres, mais je n'y suis pas parvenu.
OUPS: I had the Shadowlord in my sights, and I couldn't finish him...

JAP: Hey, come on now! Turn that frown upside down! If you're getting depressed, then there's REALLY no hope for the rest of us!
FR: Oh, allez#! Ne fais pas une tête pareille#! Si quelqu'un comme toi se laisse abattre, nous n'avons aucune chance#!
OUPS: Hey, come on now! Turn that frown upside down! If you're getting depressed, then there's REALLY no hope for the rest of us!

JAP: First the Shades started wearing light-resistant body armor, and now the postmen are falling behind! I tell ya, this is a tough old world.
FR: D'abord, les Ombres ont acquis une armure qui les protège contre la lumière et maintenant les postiers prennent du retard#?! C'est la fin du monde, je te dis#!
OUPS: First the Shades started wearing light-resistant body armor, and now the postmen are falling behind! I tell ya, this is a tough old world.

JAP: I wish we could maintain contact with Seafront. They were our main trading partner, and now it seems like we're always running out of food.
FR: Si seulement nous pouvions rester en contact avec Littoral. C'est notre partenaire de commerce principal et nous sommes toujours à court de nourriture.
OUPS: I wish we could maintain contact with Seafront. They were our main trading partner, and now it seems like we're always running out of food.

JAP: We'll keep the village safe. You just concentrate on getting Yonah back.
FR: Nous protégerons le village. Occupe-toi de sauver Yonah.
OUPS: We'll keep the village safe. You just concentrate on getting Yonah back.

JAP: Thanks. I appreciate it.
FR: Merci, je vous en suis reconnaissant.
OUPS: Thanks. I appreciate it.

JAP: Shades are a common sight in The Aerie nowadays. I guess those folks are having a really bad time of it.
FR: Les Ombres ont envahi l'Aire. J'imagine que ses habitants n'en sont pas ravis.
OUPS: Shades are a common sight in The Aerie nowadays. I guess those folks are having a really bad time of it.

JAP: Leaving us again?
FR: Tu pars encore une fois#?
OUPS: Leaving us again?

JAP: Yeah. Today's the day we'll find a lead on Yonah. I just know it.
FR: C'est aujourd'hui que nous trouverons l'indice qui nous mènera à Yonah. J'en suis certain.
OUPS: Yeah. Today's the day we'll find a lead on Yonah. I just know it.

JAP: More and more Shades are resistant to light these days. I don't think there's anywhere in the world that's safe anymore.
FR: Les Ombres sont de plus en plus résistantes à la lumière. Il n'existe plus d'endroits sûrs, désormais...
OUPS: More and more Shades are resistant to light these days. I don't think there's anywhere in the world that's safe anymore.

JAP: Whew. Now that I do all my shopping in one trip, these bags are heavy!
FR: Ouf#! Dorénavant, je dois faire toutes mes courses en même temps#!
OUPS: Whew. Now that I do all my shopping in one trip, these bags are heavy!

JAP: The elderly have it rough these days! Prices are up, but my belt can't get any tighter.
FR: Mes sacs sont lourds#! Les personnes âgées en voient de dures, ces temps-ci#! Les prix augmentent toujours, mais je ne pourrais me serrer davantage la ceinture#!
OUPS: The elderly have it rough these days! Prices are up, but my belt can't get any tighter.

JAP: Welcome! We've got some new weapons in stock!
FR: Bienvenue#! J'ai de nouvelles armes en stock#!
OUPS: Welcome! We've got some new weapons in stock!

JAP: Blacksmiths always do well in times like these. Supply and demand, I suppose.
FR: Les armuriers peuvent toujours faire des profits, même par les temps qui courent. C'est une question d'offre et de demande, je suppose.
OUPS: Blacksmiths always do well in times like these. Supply and demand, I suppose.

JAP: Our village's water might be clean, but I know there's lots of terrible things going into our bodies these days. ...And our children have the worst of it.
FR: Notre eau a beau être pure, je suis certaine que des substances toxiques s'accumulent dans nos corps. Ce sera nos enfants qui en subiront d'abord les effets...
OUPS: Our village's water might be clean, but I know there's lots of terrible things going into our bodies these days. ...And our children have the worst of it.

JAP: Why did he have to die? What is this Black Scrawl, anyway? Why does this only happen to us? Why!?
FR: Pourquoi est-il mort#? Et qu'est-ce que c'est, la nécrose runique#? Pourquoi sommes-nous les seuls à l'attraper#? Réponds#!!
OUPS: Why did he have to die? What is this Black Scrawl, anyway? Why does this only happen to us? Why!?

JAP: Perhaps we should be going.
FR: Nous devrions sans doute la laisser tranquille.
OUPS: Perhaps we should be going.

JAP: With the Shades increasing and the animals dying off, even mutton is getting expensive.
FR: Puisque les Ombres se multiplient sans cesse et les animaux disparaissent, même le mouton est un luxe#!
OUPS: With the Shades increasing and the animals dying off, even mutton is getting expensive.

JAP: I'm so hungry! It's all I can think about anymore! I'd give anything to taste meat again...
FR: Mon estomac crie famine#! Je n'arrive pas à penser à autre chose...
OUPS: I'm so hungry! It's all I can think about anymore! I'd give anything to taste meat again...

JAP: Shades could strike at any moment, so I have to keep my guard up at all times!<PAGE>I remember when patrolling the shopping district used to be so easy...
FR: Je donnerais n'importe quoi pour un morceau de viande… Les Ombres peuvent attaquer n'importe quand, alors je dois rester vigilant en tout temps#!<PAGE>Ah, faire la patrouille du marché était si facile, autrefois…
OUPS: Shades could strike at any moment, so I have to keep my guard up at all times!<PAGE>I remember when patrolling the shopping district used to be so easy...

JAP: I don't suppose you could hunt sheep or boar for us? We'd really appreciate it!
FR: Je voudrais tellement manger de la viande de chèvre ou de sanglier#!
OUPS: I don't suppose you could hunt sheep or boar for us? We'd really appreciate it!

JAP: The Shades make it impossible to hunt the way we used to. Our sources of food are drying up fast.
FR: Les Ombres nous empêchent de chasser comme autrefois. Il est vraiment difficile de trouver de la nourriture.
OUPS: The Shades make it impossible to hunt the way we used to. Our sources of food are drying up fast.

JAP: I know things aren't cheap right now, but we don't have a choice.
FR: Je sais que les prix ont augmenté, mais nous n'avons pas le choix.
OUPS: I know things aren't cheap right now, but we don't have a choice.

JAP: Come back soon.
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: Come back soon.

JAP: More and more of our sons and daughters go out hunting and never return. What are we supposed to do?
FR: Chaque jour, certains de nos enfants ne reviennent pas de la chasse. Que devrions-nous faire#?
OUPS: More and more of our sons and daughters go out hunting and never return. What are we supposed to do?

JAP: You kids certainly have a lot of energy! You're going to trip and fall if you keep running around like that...
FR: Vous avez tant d'énergie, mes enfants#! Faites attention de ne pas trébucher en courant partout#! Vous pourriez vous blesser...!
OUPS: You kids certainly have a lot of energy! You're going to trip and fall if you keep running around like that...

JAP: We'd best leave her be. Wherever her mind has gone, it's a happier world than this.
FR: Laissons-la tranquille. Elle est sans doute plus heureuse dans son monde qu'elle ne pourrait l'être dans le nôtre.
OUPS: We'd best leave her be. Wherever her mind has gone, it's a happier world than this.

JAP: Why can't I leave the shopping district to play? Huh? Why can't I?
FR: Pourquoi est-ce que je peux pas aller jouer ailleurs qu'au marché#? Hein#? Pourquoi#?
OUPS: Why can't I leave the shopping district to play? Huh? Why can't I?

JAP: Another hunter has gone missing! I'm so worried about my husband...
FR: Un autre chasseur a disparu#! Je suis si inquiète pour mon mari...
OUPS: Another hunter has gone missing! I'm so worried about my husband...

JAP: If you don't hunt, you run out of food and starve. But if you DO hunt, the Shades sneak up and kill you!<PAGE>...I really hate this place.
FR: Si nous n'allons pas à la chasse, nous mourrons de faim, mais si nous allons à la chasse, nous nous ferons tuer par des Ombres#! J'en ai vraiment assez...
OUPS: If you don't hunt, you run out of food and starve. But if you DO hunt, the Shades sneak up and kill you!<PAGE>...I really hate this place.

JAP: If push comes to shove, then I'm just gonna have to leave the village. I don't know much about the outside world, but it has to be better than this!
FR: Si nécessaire, je suis prêt à quitter le village. J'ignore tout de la situation à l'extérieur du village, mais ce ne peut pas être pire qu'ici#!
OUPS: If push comes to shove, then I'm just gonna have to leave the village. I don't know much about the outside world, but it has to be better than this!

JAP: If you hadn't saved the village five years ago, none of us would be here. Thank you.
FR: Si tu n'avais pas sauvé le village il y a cinq ans, nous n'aurions pas survécu. Je te remercie.
OUPS: If you hadn't saved the village five years ago, none of us would be here. Thank you.

JAP: They say Shades have been sighted around the Junk Heap. Do you think they've started using machines? That would be the end of us for sure!
FR: Certains ont aperçu des Ombres près de la montagne des robots. Tu crois qu'elles ont appris à utiliser des machines#? Ce serait une catastrophe#!
OUPS: They say Shades have been sighted around the Junk Heap. Do you think they've started using machines? That would be the end of us for sure!

JAP: The Shades are much stronger now, especially the armored ones. So be careful!
FR: Les Ombres sont beaucoup plus puissantes, désormais, surtout celles qui sont blindées. Fais attention#!
OUPS: The Shades are much stronger now, especially the armored ones. So be careful!

JAP: I decided a long time ago that Popola was too important and beautiful to worry about Shades and stuff like that. That's why I dedicated my life to protecting her!
FR: Je me suis rendu compte il y a très longtemps que Popola était beaucoup trop belle et importante pour avoir à s'inquiéter des Ombres et de tout ce qui menace notre village.<PAGE>C'est pourquoi je dévoue ma vie à la protéger#!
OUPS: I decided a long time ago that Popola was too important and beautiful to worry about Shades and stuff like that. That's why I dedicated my life to protecting her!

JAP: She trusts me to keep the library secure, so maybe someday she'll trust me with...other things. Grawwwwl!
FR: Elle m'a confié la garde de la bibliothèque, alors un jour elle me confiera peut-être... autre chose. Ho, ho, ho#!
OUPS: She trusts me to keep the library secure, so maybe someday she'll trust me with...other things. Grawwwwl!

JAP: False hope is better than no hope at all, I suppose.
FR: Un faux espoir est sans doute préférable au désespoir.
OUPS: False hope is better than no hope at all, I suppose.

JAP: A lot of library books were ruined after the ceiling fell in. It's really a shame!
FR: Tant de livres ont été abîmés quand le toit de la bibliothèque s'est effondré... C'est vraiment dommage#!
OUPS: A lot of library books were ruined after the ceiling fell in. It's really a shame!

JAP: Sorry, but the boat's out of service right now.
FR: Tu ne peux pas utiliser ce bateau en ce moment, désolé.
OUPS: Sorry, but the boat's out of service right now.

JAP: I'm just here to make sure no kids climb aboard and start wreckin' stuff.
FR: Je ne suis ici que pour décourager les vandales.
OUPS: I'm just here to make sure no kids climb aboard and start wreckin' stuff.

JAP: If we can ever take care of the Shades, I'd love to plow an honest field of crops right here.
FR: Si un jour nous arrivons à nous débarrasser des Ombres, j'aimerais cultiver un champ ici.
OUPS: If we can ever take care of the Shades, I'd love to plow an honest field of crops right here.

JAP: It doesn't matter how many guards we have. If that giant Shade attacks again...
FR: Peu importe le nombre de gardes qui protègent le village, si cette Ombre géante nous attaque de nouveau...
OUPS: It doesn't matter how many guards we have. If that giant Shade attacks again...

JAP: If that happens, we'll take care of it.
FR: Nous nous en occuperons.
OUPS: If that happens, we'll take care of it.

JAP: You've grown strong, <NIER>.
FR: Tu es plus fort que tu ne l'étais, <NIER>.
OUPS: You've grown strong, <NIER>.

JAP: Mom told me that I can't play outside the shopping district.
FR: Maman m'a dit que je ne peux pas jouer à l'extérieur du marché.
OUPS: Mom told me that I can't play outside the shopping district.

JAP: The shopping district sucks! It's small, and crowded, and all the old people smell funny.
FR: Je déteste le marché#! Il est tout petit, il y a trop de monde et les vieillards qui s'y promènent sentent mauvais#!
OUPS: The shopping district sucks! It's small, and crowded, and all the old people smell funny.

JAP: I wish I could play someplace bigger...
FR: J'aimerais tant pouvoir jouer dans un endroit plus grand...
OUPS: I wish I could play someplace bigger...

JAP: The village defense is much stronger than it used to be, but even still, when I think about the idea of Shades attacking...
FR: Nous avons renforcé les défenses du village, mais tiendraient-elles si les Ombres nous attaquaient#?
OUPS: The village defense is much stronger than it used to be, but even still, when I think about the idea of Shades attacking...

JAP: The shopping district isn't as lively as it once was.<PAGE>I suppose the old atmosphere may never come back, no matter how hard we try to keep the place secure.
FR: Le marché n'est plus aussi animé qu'avant. Je doute que nous puissions un jour restaurer l'atmosphère qui y régnait autrefois, même en renforçant les défenses du village.
OUPS: The shopping district isn't as lively as it once was.<PAGE>I suppose the old atmosphere may never come back, no matter how hard we try to keep the place secure.

JAP: The villagers stay in large groups as much as possible. You never know when something might happen.
FR: Les villageois se déplacent en groupe par mesure de sécurité. On ne sait jamais ce qui pourrait arriver.
OUPS: The villagers stay in large groups as much as possible. You never know when something might happen.

JAP: Even a single sprig of herbs is precious right now. I collect whatever I can find, but it's slow going.
FR: Chaque brin d'herbe médicinale nous est précieux. Je cueille tout ce que j'arrive à trouver, mais ce n'est pas grand-chose.
OUPS: Even a single sprig of herbs is precious right now. I collect whatever I can find, but it's slow going.

JAP: We've gotta be careful. Those Shades could come back at any time.<PAGE>AAAARGH! A SHAAAAAADE!<PAGE>...Oh, wait, no. That's just a shadow.<PAGE>AAAARGH! A SHAAAAAADE!<PAGE> ...Wait. Sorry again. That's just some old box. Gods, I'm so jumpy these days.
FR: Nous devons être prudents. Les Ombres pourraient nous attaquer à tout moment.<PAGE>AH#!! Une Ombre#!!<PAGE>Oh, non, attends... Ce n'est que l'ombre d'un oiseau.<PAGE>AAAH#!! Une Ombre#!!<PAGE>... Ah, je me suis encore trompé. Ce n'est qu'une vieille boîte. Je suis si nerveux ces temps-ci...
OUPS: We've gotta be careful. Those Shades could come back at any time.<PAGE>AAAARGH! A SHAAAAAADE!<PAGE>...Oh, wait, no. That's just a shadow.<PAGE>AAAARGH! A SHAAAAAADE!<PAGE> ...Wait. Sorry again. That's just some old box. Gods, I'm so jumpy these days.

JAP: The men who go hunting keep getting attacked! We're so injured now, there's hardly anyone left who can lift a weapon!
FR: Les chasseurs se font attaquer chaque fois qu'ils sortent du village#! Ils sont tous blessés... Aucun d'eux ne peut brandir une arme#!
OUPS: The men who go hunting keep getting attacked! We're so injured now, there's hardly anyone left who can lift a weapon!

JAP: If only there weren't any Shades to deal with. Then we wouldn't have this!
FR: Si les Ombres n'existaient pas, rien de tout ça ne serait arrivé#!
OUPS: If only there weren't any Shades to deal with. Then we wouldn't have this!

JAP: With times being what they are, every resource is important. When I think of how wasteful we used to be...
FR: Dorénavant, nous devons utiliser chaque ressource le plus efficacement possible. Quand je pense à tout ce que nous gaspillions autrefois...!
OUPS: With times being what they are, every resource is important. When I think of how wasteful we used to be...

JAP: The Shades took over my old village. I barely escaped with my life!
FR: Les Ombres ont envahi le village où j'habitais. J'ai à peine pu m'échapper.
OUPS: The Shades took over my old village. I barely escaped with my life!

JAP: I got separated from my friends. I hope they're okay...
FR: Je ne sais pas où sont mes amis... Nous avons été séparés dans la cohue. J'espère qu'ils sont sains et saufs…
OUPS: I got separated from my friends. I hope they're okay...

JAP: If we can't go hunting, then we have to fish. Thank goodness for the sea!
FR: Si nous ne pouvons plus chasser, nous pêcherons. Nous avons toujours notre rivière, après tout#!
OUPS: If we can't go hunting, then we have to fish. Thank goodness for the sea!

JAP: ...What?
FR: ... Quoi#?
OUPS: ...What?

JAP: W-we aren't doing nothin' wrong!
FR: On fait rien de mal#!
OUPS: W-we aren't doing nothin' wrong!

JAP: Keep up the good work, but try not to overdo it!
FR: Bon courage#! Ne te surmène pas, surtout#!
OUPS: Keep up the good work, but try not to overdo it!

JAP: Come on in, people! Hurry, hurry! This is all the mutton I got left today!
FR: Allez#! Dépêche-toi#! C'est tout le mouton qui me reste pour aujourd'hui#!
OUPS: Come on in, people! Hurry, hurry! This is all the mutton I got left today!

JAP: Be careful. Even the desert is home to the Shades now.
FR: Sois prudent. Les Ombres ont même envahi le désert.
OUPS: Be careful. Even the desert is home to the Shades now.

JAP: Hello. Did you need something from Popola?
FR: Bonjour. As-tu quelque chose à demander à Popola#?
OUPS: Hello. Did you need something from Popola?

JAP: Whew! It's getting hard to cultivate my fields with all the Shades around.
FR: Ouf#! Il est difficile de cultiver mes champs avec tant d'Ombres aux alentours.
OUPS: Whew! It's getting hard to cultivate my fields with all the Shades around.

JAP: Hey, don't loiter around here!
FR: Hé, ne traîne pas ici#!
OUPS: Hey, don't loiter around here!

JAP: Ah, dammit! I can't take this anymore!
FR: Ah, bon sang#! Je ne peux plus le supporter#!
OUPS: Ah, dammit! I can't take this anymore!

JAP: How are things outside town? I hear the Shades are getting pretty close to our little village!
FR: Quelle est la situation à l'extérieur#? J'ai entendu dire qu'on a aperçu des Ombres près de notre ville#!
OUPS: How are things outside town? I hear the Shades are getting pretty close to our little village!

JAP: We repaired the gate before we realized it leads to an area full of Shades. So now we just closed off the path.
FR: Nous avons réparé la porte, mais elle menait à un endroit infesté d'Ombres. Dorénavant, elle sera condamnée.
OUPS: We repaired the gate before we realized it leads to an area full of Shades. So now we just closed off the path.

JAP: Oh. It's you. Yeah, this place has changed a lot since last you came.
FR: Oh, bonjour. Comme vous pouvez le constater, la ville a beaucoup changé depuis votre dernière visite.
OUPS: Oh. It's you. Yeah, this place has changed a lot since last you came.

JAP: The Shades in the southern plains have pretty much cut us off from the rest of the world. And don't even mention that weird Black Scrawl disease that's going around!
FR: Nous sommes isolés du reste du monde à cause des Ombres qui rôdent sur la plaine méridionale. Et que dire de cette étrange nécrose runique qui fait des ravages...!
OUPS: The Shades in the southern plains have pretty much cut us off from the rest of the world. And don't even mention that weird Black Scrawl disease that's going around!

JAP: Where's everyone hiding...?
FR: Où se cachent-ils tous...?
OUPS: Where's everyone hiding...?

JAP: Ack! Don't scare me like that!
FR: Aah#! Tu m'as fait une de ces peurs#!
OUPS: Ack! Don't scare me like that!

JAP: Nobody's ever gonna find me here! Hee hee!
FR: Personne ne me trouvera ici#! Hi, hi, hi#!
OUPS: Nobody's ever gonna find me here! Hee hee!

JAP: Um...they haven't found me yet, right?
FR: Euh... Ils ne m'ont pas encore trouvé, hein#?
OUPS: Um...they haven't found me yet, right?

JAP: Ever since Shades started appearing in the plains, the port's been almost deserted...
FR: Depuis que les Ombres ont envahi la plaine, le port est presque désert...
OUPS: Ever since Shades started appearing in the plains, the port's been almost deserted...

JAP: There aren't too many entry points into town, so we've kept Shade damage under control.
FR: Nous avons pu limiter les dégâts causés par les Ombres car il n'y a que peu de moyens d'entrer dans la ville.
OUPS: There aren't too many entry points into town, so we've kept Shade damage under control.

JAP: Our land routes to other towns are all under siege, so trading has become difficult.
FR: Toutes les voies de transport terrestres menant aux autres villes sont bloquées, alors il est difficile d'entretenir nos relations commerciales.
OUPS: Our land routes to other towns are all under siege, so trading has become difficult.

JAP: You know what? I actually miss that lighthouse lady screaming at me. ...Funny how you never appreciate something until it's gone.
FR: En fait, je m'ennuie des jérémiades de la vieille femme du phare, vous savez... Ce n'est parfois qu'en perdant quelque chose qu'on se rend compte à quel point on lui tient.
OUPS: You know what? I actually miss that lighthouse lady screaming at me. ...Funny how you never appreciate something until it's gone.

JAP: My husband spends all his days drinking. Apparently the world is just too sad and depressing for him.
FR: Mon mari passe ses journées à se soûler. Il dit que le monde est trop triste et déprimant...
OUPS: My husband spends all his days drinking. Apparently the world is just too sad and depressing for him.

JAP: I try to keep tight purse strings on the family budget, but my husband still manages to find money for alcohol. What am I going to do with that man?
FR: J'essaie de faire des épargnes, mais mon mari trouve toujours de l'argent pour acheter de l'alcool. Que vais-je faire de lui#?
OUPS: I try to keep tight purse strings on the family budget, but my husband still manages to find money for alcohol. What am I going to do with that man?

JAP: I haven't heard from my brother lately. I sure hope he's all right...
FR: Je n'ai pas de nouvelles de mon frère depuis quelque temps. J'espère qu'il n'a rien...
OUPS: I haven't heard from my brother lately. I sure hope he's all right...

JAP: The Shades haven't hurt anyone here yet, but we're not taking any chances. All strong men have been drafted into the town security force.
FR: Les Ombres ne nous ont pas encore attaqués, mais nous ne voulons pas prendre de risques. Tous les hommes valides font désormais partie de la garde.
OUPS: The Shades haven't hurt anyone here yet, but we're not taking any chances. All strong men have been drafted into the town security force.

JAP: I fear our lack of trade will lead to food shortages.
FR: Sans commerce, nous pourrions avoir une pénurie de nourriture... Cela m'inquiète.
OUPS: I fear our lack of trade will lead to food shortages.

JAP: Those Shades are wreaking havoc with our shipments. We risk our lives every time we deliver something.
FR: Les Ombres perturbent nos tournées. Nous risquons nos vies chaque fois que nous allons distribuer le courrier#!
OUPS: Those Shades are wreaking havoc with our shipments. We risk our lives every time we deliver something.

JAP: Hard to believe it's been five years since the lighthouse lady died...
FR: J'ai peine à croire que la vieille femme du phare soit décédée il y a déjà cinq ans.
OUPS: Hard to believe it's been five years since the lighthouse lady died...

JAP: I just wish he'd stop singing that weird song...
FR: Si seulement il pouvait arrêter de chanter cette chanson étrange...
OUPS: I just wish he'd stop singing that weird song...

JAP: Sorry, we're not quite ready for business yet. Come back when we're open, okay?
FR: Je regrette, mais nous ne sommes pas encore ouverts. Revenez un peu plus tard, d'accord#?
OUPS: Sorry, we're not quite ready for business yet. Come back when we're open, okay?

JAP: Now that I've got my own boat, I understand how hard the fisherman's life truly is!<PAGE>But I'm not gonna let 'em down!
FR: Maintenant que je possède mon propre bateau, je comprends vraiment combien la vie de pêcheur peut être difficile#!<PAGE>Toutefois, je ferai de mon mieux#!
OUPS: Now that I've got my own boat, I understand how hard the fisherman's life truly is!<PAGE>But I'm not gonna let 'em down!

JAP: I gave that man my boat when I retired, although I wasn't expecting much. But he surprised me by working hard and not complaining at all!
FR: J'ai donné mon bateau au jeunot quand j'ai pris ma retraite, mais je ne m'attendais pas à ce qu'il en fasse grand-chose.<PAGE>Cela m'a beaucoup surpris de le voir travailler aussi dur sans jamais se plaindre#!
OUPS: I gave that man my boat when I retired, although I wasn't expecting much. But he surprised me by working hard and not complaining at all!

JAP: It's a bad time to be a fisherman. There's almost no one left here to buy what we catch.
FR: C'est le pire moment pour être pêcheur... Il n'y a presque plus personne pour acheter notre prise.
OUPS: It's a bad time to be a fisherman. There's almost no one left here to buy what we catch.

JAP: ...Quit staring at me.
FR: ... Arrêtez de me regarder comme ça.
OUPS: ...Quit staring at me.

JAP: The ocean's been angry lately. I hope it's not a sign of more climate change headed our way.
FR: La mer est déchaînée ces derniers temps. J'espère que ça n'annonce pas d'autres changements climatiques.
OUPS: The ocean's been angry lately. I hope it's not a sign of more climate change headed our way.

JAP: Three years ago, a Shade washed up on shore. Ever since then, we've been telling people to stay away from the water.
FR: Une Ombre s'est échouée sur la plage il y a trois ans. Depuis, nous demandons aux gens de ne pas s'approcher de la mer.
OUPS: Three years ago, a Shade washed up on shore. Ever since then, we've been telling people to stay away from the water.

JAP: I can't play in the water, so I'm playing here instead.<PAGE>I miss the water...
FR: Je peux pas jouer sur la plage, alors je joue ici.<PAGE>J'aimerais tant aller me baigner#!
OUPS: I can't play in the water, so I'm playing here instead.<PAGE>I miss the water...

JAP: I'm bored! All we ever do is run around all day!
FR: Je m'ennuie#! On fait que courir en rond toute la journée#!
OUPS: I'm bored! All we ever do is run around all day!

JAP: So few ships use this port anymore...
FR: Peu de bateaux s'amarrent ici de nos jours...
OUPS: So few ships use this port anymore...

JAP: Every fish we catch is precious, so I hope you'll buy some!
FR: Chaque poisson que nous attrapons est un don du ciel. J'espère que vous en achèterez#!
OUPS: Every fish we catch is precious, so I hope you'll buy some!

JAP: Thanks. And come again.
FR: Merci et à bientôt#!
OUPS: Thanks. And come again.

JAP: Damn it all! I finally meet the perfect girl, and she's MARRIED!<PAGE>How could she do that do me!? It's just cruel!
FR: Bon sang#! Je rencontre enfin la femme parfaite et elle est déjà mariée#!<PAGE>Comment la vie peut-elle être si cruelle#?!
OUPS: Damn it all! I finally meet the perfect girl, and she's MARRIED!<PAGE>How could she do that do me!? It's just cruel!

JAP: You really have terrible luck with the ladies!<PAGE>Maybe what you need is a good friend and a strong drink, eh?
FR: Pas de veine avec les filles, hein#? Viens boire un verre avec ton pote, ça te consolera.
OUPS: You really have terrible luck with the ladies!<PAGE>Maybe what you need is a good friend and a strong drink, eh?

JAP: Why bother anymore? Ain't nobody left to buy my fish anyway. Might as well drink to pass the time.
FR: À quoi bon pêcher#? Y a plus personne pour acheter mon poisson. Mieux vaut boire pour passer le temps.
OUPS: Why bother anymore? Ain't nobody left to buy my fish anyway. Might as well drink to pass the time.

JAP: Just go easy, all right?
FR: Allez-y doucement, d'accord#?
OUPS: Just go easy, all right?

JAP: Please, you have to help me! My wife's got the Black Scrawl! Tell me what I need to do and I'll do it!
FR: Je vous en supplie, aidez-moi#! Ma femme a la nécrose runique#! Dites-moi ce que je dois faire#!
OUPS: Please, you have to help me! My wife's got the Black Scrawl! Tell me what I need to do and I'll do it!

JAP: Really, I'll do anything! Quit drinking? Give to charity? Sacrifice my life for hers? Come on! Please, I'm begging you here!
FR: Je ferais n'importe quoi pour la sauver#! Arrêter de boire#? Donner tout mon argent à un organisme de charité#? Sacrifier ma vie#? Je vous en conjure, dites-moi quoi faire#!
OUPS: Really, I'll do anything! Quit drinking? Give to charity? Sacrifice my life for hers? Come on! Please, I'm begging you here!

JAP: With the way things are these days, I can't afford to keep giving my girl gifts.<PAGE>Now she won't even talk to me...
FR: Ces derniers temps, je n'ai plus les moyens de combler ma petite amie de cadeaux.<PAGE>Elle ne m'adresse plus la parole...
OUPS: With the way things are these days, I can't afford to keep giving my girl gifts.<PAGE>Now she won't even talk to me...

JAP: Hi there. Did you need some bait?
FR: Bonjour#! Avez-vous besoin d'appâts#?
OUPS: Hi there. Did you need some bait?

JAP: Come back if you need anything else.
FR: À bientôt, j'espère#!
OUPS: Come back if you need anything else.

JAP: I used to fish here with my grandfather. But those happy times seem very far away now...
FR: Je pêchais ici avec mon mari autrefois. Ces jours heureux semblent si lointains...
OUPS: I used to fish here with my grandfather. But those happy times seem very far away now...

JAP: I wish I could eat steak for dinner again. Just once...
FR: Si seulement je pouvais manger un steak... Juste une autre fois...!
OUPS: I wish I could eat steak for dinner again. Just once...

JAP: The fishermen are having a terrible time of it. I hardly know what to make for dinner anymore.
FR: Les pêcheurs ont la vie dure. Je ne sais plus quoi préparer pour le dîner.
OUPS: The fishermen are having a terrible time of it. I hardly know what to make for dinner anymore.

JAP: Five years ago, I splurged my money and ate like a king!<PAGE>Now I'm lucky to get one meal a day...
FR: Il y a cinq ans, je mangeais tous les jours copieusement et j'ai dépensé tout mon argent#!<PAGE>Ces temps-ci, j'ai de la chance de manger un repas par jour...
OUPS: Five years ago, I splurged my money and ate like a king!<PAGE>Now I'm lucky to get one meal a day...

JAP: I heard the guy in this house died four years ago.
FR: J'ai entendu dire que le propriétaire de cette maison est mort il y a quatre ans.
OUPS: I heard the guy in this house died four years ago.

JAP: Three years ago, a ship with a Shade inside ran aground near our town. Soon after that, the Black Scrawl appeared.<PAGE>...I wish that ship had sunk at sea.
FR: Un bateau qui avait une Ombre à son bord s'est échoué près d'ici il y a trois ans. Peu après, la nécrose runique s'est répandue à travers la ville.<PAGE>Si seulement ce bateau avait coulé...
OUPS: Three years ago, a ship with a Shade inside ran aground near our town. Soon after that, the Black Scrawl appeared.<PAGE>...I wish that ship had sunk at sea.

JAP: The wreckage got blown to sea by a typhoon last year, but the Black Scrawl stayed.
FR: Un typhon a emporté l'épave du bateau l'an dernier, mais la nécrose runique sévit toujours.
OUPS: The wreckage got blown to sea by a typhoon last year, but the Black Scrawl stayed.

JAP: You don't see many people fishing on small boats anymore. Mostly we just rent them to people from out of town.<PAGE>Not that there's a lot of them anymore, either.
FR: Ces jours-ci, peu de gens pêchent sur de petits bateaux. On ne les loue qu'à ceux qui sont de passage dans la ville, et nous n'avons plus beaucoup de visiteurs.
OUPS: You don't see many people fishing on small boats anymore. Mostly we just rent them to people from out of town.<PAGE>Not that there's a lot of them anymore, either.

JAP: I've apprenticed myself with a master so I can learn the way of the sailor.<PAGE>And let me tell you, my master is incredible! There's nothing he can't do!
FR: Je voulais apprendre à être marin, alors le capitaine a fait de moi son mousse#!<PAGE>Le capitaine est formidable#! Il sait tout#!
OUPS: I've apprenticed myself with a master so I can learn the way of the sailor.<PAGE>And let me tell you, my master is incredible! There's nothing he can't do!

JAP: You need materials? 'Cause I've got piles of 'em, and no buyers!
FR: Vous voulez des matériaux#? J'en ai tellement, je ne sais plus quoi en faire#! Personne ne veut en acheter#!
OUPS: You need materials? 'Cause I've got piles of 'em, and no buyers!

JAP: If you need anything, and I mean ANYTHING, you let me know.
FR: Si vous avez besoin de quoi que ce soit, faites-moi signe, hein#?
OUPS: If you need anything, and I mean ANYTHING, you let me know.

JAP: What're we gonna play today?
FR: À quoi on joue aujourd'hui#?
OUPS: What're we gonna play today?

JAP: We can't play in the ocean, and this place is cramped and boring. Booo!
FR: On peut pas se baigner dans la mer et il y a pas assez de place pour jouer ici#!
OUPS: We can't play in the ocean, and this place is cramped and boring. Booo!

JAP: Geez! We can't play anywhere now!
FR: C'est ennuyeux#! On peut plus jouer nulle part#!
OUPS: Geez! We can't play anywhere now!

JAP: Sometimes, when I deliver something to a customer, they give me this huge, ear-to-ear grin.<PAGE>And it's not a happy grin, either! It's like they're losing their minds or something.
FR: Parfois, quand j'apporte un colis à quelqu'un, la personne me sourit, la bouche fendue jusqu'aux oreilles.<PAGE>Ce n'est pas un sourire de joie, loin de là#! C'est un sourire béat et figé, comme si la personne avait perdu la tête.
OUPS: Sometimes, when I deliver something to a customer, they give me this huge, ear-to-ear grin.<PAGE>And it's not a happy grin, either! It's like they're losing their minds or something.

JAP: But it gets weirder! Whenever I see that grin, the person always moves out a few days later. ...What the hell is this world coming to?
FR: Et ce n'est pas tout, chaque fois que j'aperçois ce sourire sur le visage de quelqu'un, cette personne déménage ou disparaît quelques jours plus tard.<PAGE>Qu'est-ce qui peut bien se passer#?
OUPS: But it gets weirder! Whenever I see that grin, the person always moves out a few days later. ...What the hell is this world coming to?

JAP: Hmm... That is a disturbing tale indeed.
FR: Hum... Voilà qui est bien inquiétant.
OUPS: Hmm... That is a disturbing tale indeed.

JAP: Lovely wind, isn't it?
FR: La brise est vivifiante, vous ne trouvez pas#?
OUPS: Lovely wind, isn't it?

JAP: *Huff...huff...*
FR: Ouf... Ouf...
OUPS: *Huff...huff...*

JAP: We've got the latest in weapons from foreign lands!
FR: J'ai les toutes dernières armes de pays lointains en stock#!
OUPS: We've got the latest in weapons from foreign lands!

JAP: Thanks!
FR: Merci#!
OUPS: Thanks!

JAP: Sorry my stock is so low. Just let me know if you see something.
FR: Je n'ai pas grand-chose à vous offrir, mais...
OUPS: Sorry my stock is so low. Just let me know if you see something.

JAP: See you soon.
FR: À bientôt#!
OUPS: See you soon.

JAP: There's not much left, but take a look around.
FR: Je n'ai pas pu me réapprovisionner dernièrement...
OUPS: There's not much left, but take a look around.

JAP: I'll try to get my stock up by the time you return.
FR: J'essaierai de renouveler mon stock dès que possible.
OUPS: I'll try to get my stock up by the time you return.

JAP: That Shade from the ship three years ago ended up killing almost half the town. We've stepped up security to make sure nothing like that ever happens again.
FR: L'Ombre du bateau qui s'est échoué il y a trois ans a tué presque la moitié des habitants de la ville.<PAGE>Nous avons renforcé nos défenses afin qu'une telle tragédie ne se reproduise plus jamais.
OUPS: That Shade from the ship three years ago ended up killing almost half the town. We've stepped up security to make sure nothing like that ever happens again.

JAP: No one mans the lighthouse anymore, but it seems to do a fine job on its own. That thing must be really well constructed!
FR: Plus personne ne s'occupe du phare, mais il ne semble pas avoir besoin de notre aide. Il est vraiment bien construit#!
OUPS: No one mans the lighthouse anymore, but it seems to do a fine job on its own. That thing must be really well constructed!

JAP: Perhaps even in death, the old woman refuses to neglect her duty.
FR: Même après sa mort, la vieille femme refuse sans doute d'abandonner son poste.
OUPS: Perhaps even in death, the old woman refuses to neglect her duty.

JAP: The Shades and their dark illness have torn this town apart...
FR: Les Ombres et la maladie ont ravagé la ville...
OUPS: The Shades and their dark illness have torn this town apart...

JAP: I can't play by the sea anymore, so I'm playing in town.<PAGE>BOOOORING!
FR: Je peux plus jouer près de la mer, alors je joue ici.<PAGE>Je m'ennuie#!
OUPS: I can't play by the sea anymore, so I'm playing in town.<PAGE>BOOOORING!

JAP: Our fishing trips get longer and longer, but there's just nothing out there anymore.
FR: Nous partons en mer pour des périodes de plus en plus longues, mais il n'y a plus rien à pêcher.
OUPS: Our fishing trips get longer and longer, but there's just nothing out there anymore.

JAP: Hey, guys, c-come on... Let's all calm down...
FR: Hé, allez#! Du calme...!
OUPS: Hey, guys, c-come on... Let's all calm down...

JAP: I'd hoped to further my trading career, but we're pretty much cut off from the other towns now.
FR: J'espérais faire prospérer mon commerce, mais nous sommes désormais isolés du reste du monde.
OUPS: I'd hoped to further my trading career, but we're pretty much cut off from the other towns now.

JAP: I don't get it. Can't you establish some sea routes?
FR: Je ne comprends pas... Et vos routes maritimes#?
OUPS: I don't get it. Can't you establish some sea routes?

JAP: The number of towns that can be reached by sea is too small. I imagine they would have trouble obtaining supplies from other towns, or exporting their own goods for sale.

JAP: Yonah...
FR: Yonah...
OUPS: Yonah...

JAP: <LIST=2269>Sell it.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=2269>Vendre la pierre.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=2269>Sell it.</LIST>

JAP: I know it's dangerous outside, but these letters I deliver are important to too many people.

JAP: In times like these, we need places like that fountain to calm our hearts.

OUPS: (Thanks for your help. Please be careful.)

OUPS: Seafront, huh...? Maybe we'll find something out about Emil over there.

OUPS: The paper mentions a house right above the entrance to a "coastal town."

OUPS: Master Emil...I promise I will find a way to cure you someday.

OUPS: Pfft. Here we are, a stone's throw from the ocean, and not a single man in town knows how to fish properly.

JAP: That's good news.

OUPS: Oh, you know how it is. In my line of work, people tend to owe you favors.<PAGE>Anyway, I'd best be off!

FR: ...#Oh, je vois. C'est son bien-aimé qui lui avait envoyé ce colis.

JAP: I don't know what to do here.
FR: Je ne sais pas quoi faire.

JAP: You sure?

OUPS: You sure?

JAP: Mother's?

FR: Ce n'est pas grave. Elle est morte il y a longtemps.

JAP: This is the diary my mother left behind.

FR: Je le feuillette parfois... Il me rappelle l'époque où nous étions une famille normale... une famille heureuse.

JAP: I see...

JAP: Take a look...

FR: Oui, ces derniers temps, je n'arrête pas d'y penser.

JAP: The "world of the recycled vessel"...

JAP: ...My word!

JAP: Something wrong?

OUPS: I feel as if I've just awoken from a most unpleasant dream.

JAP: That happens to me whenever I read this.

JAP: Huh?

JAP: Interesting.

JAP: Didn't think you would.

OUPS: Guy looked like he was a little bit crazy, so go easy. All right?

JAP: Last month, my wife disturbed the sheep that roam these plains,

OUPS: Last month, my wife disturbed the sheep that roam these plains,

JAP: and the foul creatures kicked the very life from her.

JAP: I came here to enact my revenge, but the fate I desire for them

OUPS: I came here to enact my revenge, but the fate I desire for them

JAP: is too cruel for me to carry out on my own.

JAP: ...Oh boy.

JAP: They must suffer as she suffered!
FR: Ils doivent souffrir comme ma femme a souffert#!

OUPS: My good man, we are hardly in the business of punting fluffy animals to death.

OUPS: I hear that you have tamed the wild boars, yes? That you can mount and ride them

OUPS: Here is your payment.

JAP: Hee hee. Eee hee hee hee!
FR: Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha#!

JAP: Come back soon!

OUPS: The Shades inside this temple are far more powerful than I expected...

OUPS: Either way, our work here is done. Let's get back to the king.

JAP: Those Shades are tricky when they work together like that.
