JAP: I doubt this will be the last time we see such a tactic.

JAP: We'd best use caution in the future.

JAP: Man, I was so tired of holing up indoors!

JAP: I'd almost forgotten what the breeze felt like.

JAP: Come back soon!

FR: (Il ne servirait à rien de passer mes journées à broyer du noir.)
OUPS: (No point sitting around moping all day, you know?)

JAP: (...Fyra would yell at me if she saw me doing that.)
FR: (... Fyra me réprimanderait si elle le pouvait.)
OUPS: (...Fyra would yell at me if she saw me doing that.)

JAP: So this was a graveyard, eh?
FR: Alors, c'était un cimetière#?
OUPS: So this was a graveyard, eh?

JAP: Strange... All the headstones look new.
FR: Étrange... Toutes les pierres tombales ont l'air récentes.
OUPS: Strange... All the headstones look new.

JAP: The wolves must have brought down all these people. What a cruel fate.
FR: Ils ont dû être la proie des loups. Quel triste sort#!
OUPS: The wolves must have brought down all these people. What a cruel fate.

JAP: Don't let Emil fall too far behind.
FR: Restons près d'Émile.
OUPS: Don't let Emil fall too far behind.

JAP: Right.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: Right.

JAP: The lad is falling behind!
FR: Le petit va te perdre#!
OUPS: The lad is falling behind!

JAP: We can't leave Emil behind. Let's go back.
FR: Nous ne pouvons pas continuer sans Émile. Allons le retrouver.
OUPS: We can't leave Emil behind. Let's go back.

JAP: Surely you're not planning to abandon those villagers?
FR: Ne me dis pas que tu vas abandonner ces villageois#!
OUPS: Surely you're not planning to abandon those villagers?

JAP: We can't leave Kainé behind!
FR: Nous ne pouvons pas abandonner Kainé#!
OUPS: We can't leave Kainé behind!

JAP: Villagers are under attack over there!
FR: Des Ombres attaquent des villageois là-bas#!
OUPS: Villagers are under attack over there!

JAP: Dammit, Kainé! Get up! You gotta get up!
FR: Bon sang, Kainé#! Allez, debout#! Tu dois te lever#!
OUPS: Dammit, Kainé! Get up! You gotta get up!

JAP: Emil! You watch Kainé! I'll go clean up over there!
FR: Émile#! Surveille Kainé#! Je vais m'occuper de ces Ombres#!
OUPS: Emil! You watch Kainé! I'll go clean up over there!

JAP: All right!
FR: Tu peux compter sur moi#!
OUPS: All right!

JAP: What could that black swirl be...?
FR: Que peut bien être ce tourbillon noir...?
OUPS: What could that black swirl be...?

JAP: The Shadowlord stopped moving!
FR: Le Maître des Ombres s'est arrêté#!
OUPS: The Shadowlord stopped moving!

JAP: I need to kill all the Shades first.
FR: Je dois d'abord me débarrasser des Ombres.
OUPS: I need to kill all the Shades first.

JAP: I need to kill all the Shades first.
FR: Je dois d'abord me débarrasser des Ombres.
OUPS: I need to kill all the Shades first.

JAP: I've never seen a Shade this large around here!
FR: C'est la première fois que je vois une Ombre aussi énorme sur la plaine#!
OUPS: I've never seen a Shade this large around here!

JAP: Be careful. This is a formidable foe.
FR: Sois prudent, elle semble très puissante#!
OUPS: Be careful. This is a formidable foe.

JAP: That's the last of them. Now let's get a piece of that tree root.
FR: C'était la dernière. Allons récupérer un bout de racine.
OUPS: That's the last of them. Now let's get a piece of that tree root.

JAP: Now it makes sense. It attacked people by hiding in giant dust storms. That's pretty smart for a Shade.
FR: Je comprends maintenant. Elle attaquait les voyageurs en se camouflant dans les tempêtes de sable. Pour une Ombre, c'est plutôt malin.
OUPS: Now it makes sense. It attacked people by hiding in giant dust storms. That's pretty smart for a Shade.

JAP: We'd best warn the client about this Shade.
FR: Nous devrions aller en informer le garde de Façade.
OUPS: We'd best warn the client about this Shade.

JAP: But he sure seemed to enjoy your company. I think you made his last days some happy ones.
FR: Toutefois, il semblait apprécier votre compagnie. Je crois que ses derniers jours ont été ses plus heureux.
OUPS: But he sure seemed to enjoy your company. I think you made his last days some happy ones.

JAP: Madness! The wolves who attacked were only a fraction of the pack.
FR: C'est de la folie#! Les loups qui vous ont attaqués ne représentaient qu'une fraction de leur meute.
OUPS: Madness! The wolves who attacked were only a fraction of the pack.

JAP: How will you fight them all?
FR: Comment arriverez-vous à les combattre tous#?
OUPS: How will you fight them all?

JAP: (I will not be defeated.)
FR: (Je saurai triompher.)
OUPS: (I will not be defeated.)

JAP: All right. Count us in.
FR: D'accord, nous vous accompagnerons.
OUPS: All right. Count us in.

JAP: (That is too much for me to ask.)
FR: (Ce serait beaucoup trop vous demander.)
OUPS: (That is too much for me to ask.)

JAP: We're not doing it for you, dumbass.
FR: C'est pas pour toi qu'on le fait, connard.
OUPS: We're not doing it for you, dumbass.

JAP: It's for Fyra.
FR: C'est pour Fyra.
OUPS: It's for Fyra.

JAP: Kainé! You can't speak to a king like that!
FR: Kainé ! Tu ne peux pas t'adresser ainsi à un roi !
OUPS: Kainé! You can't speak to a king like that!

JAP: If this is indeed the plan, then let us make haste. We can ill afford another tragedy.
FR: Si telle est votre stratégie, nous devrions nous dépêcher. Nous ne pouvons guère attendre qu'une autre tragédie se produise.
OUPS: If this is indeed the plan, then let us make haste. We can ill afford another tragedy.

JAP: (My friends...thank you.)
FR: (Je vous remercie... mes amis.)
OUPS: (My friends...thank you.)

JAP: (...I owe you much. If you can make use of this, please take it.)
FR: (Je vous dois tant... Tenez, j'espère qu'elle vous sera utile.)
OUPS: (...I owe you much. If you can make use of this, please take it.)

JAP: (Do we not already have this weapon?)
FR: (Dis, Weiss, ne possédons-nous pas déjà cette arme#?)
OUPS: (Do we not already have this weapon?)

JAP: (Shh! These things happen the second time around.)
FR: (Chut#! C'est bien normal, puisque c'est la deuxième fois#!)
OUPS: (Shh! These things happen the second time around.)

JAP: Beyond this hole lies the robot.
FR: Nous devrions pouvoir atteindre le robot en sautant dans ce trou.
OUPS: Beyond this hole lies the robot.

JAP: I'm going in.
FR: Très bien.
OUPS: I'm going in.

JAP: I wish I had half the courage you possess.
FR: J'aimerais posséder autant de courage que toi.
OUPS: I wish I had half the courage you possess.

JAP: Oh, you're coming with me.
FR: Oh, ne t'inquiète pas, tu vas m'accompagner.
OUPS: Oh, you're coming with me.

JAP: However, it was only now, sitting in the mud with tears
FR: Ce n'était que maintenant, assise dans la boue et le visage barbouillé de larmes
OUPS: However, it was only now, sitting in the mud with tears

JAP: and blood caking her face, that Kainé truly understood the depths of her affection. <STOP>Here was a woman who had seen hard times; who had seen death; who had fought through all these things and somehow emerged on the other side.
FR: et de sang que la jeune fille s'aperçut vraiment combien elle l'aimait. <STOP>C'était une femme qui avait eu la vie dure, qui avait affronté la mort et avait survécu.
OUPS: and blood caking her face, that Kainé truly understood the depths of her affection. <STOP>Here was a woman who had seen hard times; who had seen death; who had fought through all these things and somehow emerged on the other side.

JAP: <STOP>If anyone could understand Kainé's pain and loneliness,
FR: <STOP>Si quelqu'un pouvait comprendre la douleur et la solitude de Kainé,
OUPS: <STOP>If anyone could understand Kainé's pain and loneliness,

JAP: it was her.
FR: c'était elle.
OUPS: it was her.

JAP: ...Eh? A sweater? ...Oh, a LETTER! ...No, sorry. Don't know about that.
FR: ... Hein#? Vous voulez vous soumettre#? Oh, une LETTRE#!... Non, je suis navré. Je ne sais pas de quoi vous parlez.
OUPS: ...Eh? A sweater? ...Oh, a LETTER! ...No, sorry. Don't know about that.

JAP: Hmm?
FR: Qu'y a-t-il#?
OUPS: Hmm?

JAP: I was walking by your house earlier, and I noticed you had some mail. You might want to check it out.
FR: Je passais devant chez toi ce matin et j'ai remarqué que tu avais reçu du courrier. Qui sait, ce pourrait être quelque chose d'important.
OUPS: I was walking by your house earlier, and I noticed you had some mail. You might want to check it out.

JAP: Oh. Thanks.
FR: Ah, merci.
OUPS: Oh. Thanks.

JAP: Kainé! Kainé!
FR: Kainé ! Kainé !
OUPS: Kainé! Kainé!

JAP: Kainé!
FR: Kainé !
OUPS: Kainé!

JAP: Let's just tell the client. We shouldn't tell Gideon.
FR: Retournons au moins apprendre la nouvelle à la jeune femme du village. Je crois que nous ferions mieux de ne pas en parler à Gidéon.
OUPS: Let's just tell the client. We shouldn't tell Gideon.

JAP: Yes, I suppose that would be the wisest plan of action.
FR: Je suppose que c'est la meilleure solution.
OUPS: Yes, I suppose that would be the wisest plan of action.

JAP: What's my favorite food?
FR: Quel est mon mets préféré ?
OUPS: What's my favorite food?

JAP: Cookies!
FR: Des biscuits !
OUPS: Cookies!

JAP: What's my favorite book?
FR: Quel est mon livre préféré ?
OUPS: What's my favorite book?

JAP: That's my magic storybook!
FR: Mon livre de contes de fées !
OUPS: That's my magic storybook!

JAP: What's my favorite place?
FR: Quel est mon endroit préféré ?
OUPS: What's my favorite place?

JAP: Home! ...As long as you're around.
FR: Notre maison... quand tu es là !
OUPS: Home! ...As long as you're around.

JAP: What's my favorite flower?
FR: Quelle est ma fleur préférée ?
OUPS: What's my favorite flower?

JAP: The Lunar Tear, of course!
FR: La larme lunaire, bien entendu !
OUPS: The Lunar Tear, of course!

JAP: Okay, one more question:
FR: Une dernière question :
OUPS: Okay, one more question:

JAP: Who do I love more than anyone?
FR: Quelle est la personne que j'aime plus que tout au monde ?
OUPS: Who do I love more than anyone?

JAP: All anyone talks about these days is Shades...
FR: Tout le monde ne parle que des Ombres ces derniers temps...
OUPS: All anyone talks about these days is Shades...

JAP: Eee hee hee. Welcome...
FR: Hi, hi, hi, hi... Bienvenue...
OUPS: Eee hee hee. Welcome...

JAP: By the way...
FR: Au fait...
OUPS: By the way...

JAP: I'm gonna need some memory alloy.
FR: Il me faudra un morceau d'alliage à mémoire de forme.
OUPS: I'm gonna need some memory alloy.

JAP: Only the real big enemies on the second basement level have them, so watch yourself.
FR: Seuls les robots les plus dangereux du deuxième sous-sol en détiennent, alors faites attention#!
OUPS: Only the real big enemies on the second basement level have them, so watch yourself.

JAP: You got it.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: You got it.

JAP: Yeah. We have to avenge Fyra.
FR: Oui, nous devons venger Fyra.
OUPS: Yeah. We have to avenge Fyra.

JAP: (Fyra was such a good child.)
FR: (Fyra était une enfant si aimable.)
OUPS: (Fyra was such a good child.)

JAP: (How could such a disaster happen?)
FR: (Comment un tel désastre a-t-il pu se produire#?)
OUPS: (How could such a disaster happen?)

JAP: (How could such a disaster happen?)
FR: (Comment un tel désastre a-t-il pu se produire#?)
OUPS: (How could such a disaster happen?)

JAP: I'll make you a kitchen knife if you bring me ten titanium alloys.
FR: Je forgerai un couteau de cuisine si vous m'apportez dix morceaux d'alliage de titane.
OUPS: I'll make you a kitchen knife if you bring me ten titanium alloys.

JAP: Popola called for you, yes?
FR: C'est Popola qui t'a appelé ?
OUPS: Popola called for you, yes?

JAP: Yeah.
FR: Oui.
OUPS: Yeah.

JAP: You got it.
FR: Entendu.
OUPS: You got it.

JAP: The sandstorm's too intense to go any further.
FR: La tempête m'empêche d'aller plus loin.
OUPS: The sandstorm's too intense to go any further.

JAP: What's wrong?
FR: Que se passe-t-il#?
OUPS: What's wrong?

JAP: (Thanks to those thieves who unlocked the seal, the Barren Temple is crawling with Shades!)
FR: (Depuis que les pillards ont brisé le sceau du temple stérile, ce dernier fourmille d'Ombres#!)
OUPS: (Thanks to those thieves who unlocked the seal, the Barren Temple is crawling with Shades!)

JAP: (We need to get in there and seal them away, but they are powerful, and I worry about my people. Plus with the rules and all...)
FR: (Nous devrions aller les éliminer ou du moins, restaurer le sceau, mais elles sont puissantes et je m'inquiète pour mes hommes.)<PAGE>(En outre, nos lois ne nous rendent pas la vie facile...)
OUPS: (We need to get in there and seal them away, but they are powerful, and I worry about my people. Plus with the rules and all...)

JAP: Well, if that's what she wants, let's go to the strange-thing store and see what we can get for it.
FR: Eh bien, si c'est ce qu'elle désire, essayons de la vendre au magasin de curiosités de Façade.
OUPS: Well, if that's what she wants, let's go to the strange-thing store and see what we can get for it.

JAP: Wait!
FR: Attendez#!
OUPS: Wait!

JAP: (Fyra is no longer the only victim.)
FR: (Les loups nous ont attaqués de nouveau.)
OUPS: (Fyra is no longer the only victim.)

JAP: (These damnable wolves continue to claim the lives of my people!)
FR: (Ces créatures ignobles continuent de tuer mes sujets#!)
OUPS: (These damnable wolves continue to claim the lives of my people!)

JAP: (I will not allow them to suffer any more. As their king, I must take a stand!)
FR: (Je ne laisserai pas mon peuple souffrir plus longtemps. En tant que souverain, je dois livrer bataille à nos ennemis#!)
OUPS: (I will not allow them to suffer any more. As their king, I must take a stand!)

JAP: (And if the rules say I can't, then damn the rules!)
FR: (Peu importe si les lois me l'interdisent#!)
OUPS: (And if the rules say I can't, then damn the rules!)

JAP: I answer: They are placed in their corresponding shells.
FR: Je réponds : « Elles sont placées dans le vaisseau qui leur est propre. »
OUPS: I answer: They are placed in their corresponding shells.

JAP: Try speaking with the chief when you get there.
FR: Adresse-toi au chef du village à ton arrivée.
OUPS: Try speaking with the chief when you get there.

JAP: She is closer to the village now.
FR: Elle s'est approchée de la ville.
OUPS: She is closer to the village now.

JAP: You sure it's not just your imagination?
FR: Es-tu certain que tu ne te l'imagines pas#?
OUPS: You sure it's not just your imagination?

JAP: Are you kidding? She was on the far side of the desert before!
FR: Bien sûr que non#! Elle était de l'autre côté du désert la dernière fois#!
OUPS: Are you kidding? She was on the far side of the desert before!

JAP: But I fear that is not enough reason to detain her.
FR: Toutefois, j'ai bien peur que ce ne soit pas une assez bonne raison pour l'arrêter.
OUPS: But I fear that is not enough reason to detain her.

JAP: If I would have just called her over here sooner...
FR: Si seulement je lui avais demandé de venir me rejoindre plus tôt...
OUPS: If I would have just called her over here sooner...

JAP: I met my husband on the job five years ago. We married within a month's time, believe it or not.
FR: J'ai rencontré mon mari au travail il y a cinq ans. Nous nous sommes mariés moins d'un mois plus tard. Incroyable, n'est-ce pas#?
OUPS: I met my husband on the job five years ago. We married within a month's time, believe it or not.

JAP: My dad's flowers are the prettiest around!
FR: Les fleurs de papa sont les plus belles au monde#!
OUPS: My dad's flowers are the prettiest around!

JAP: (Rules define every aspect of daily life here.)
FR: (La loi régit tous les aspects de notre vie quotidienne.)
OUPS: (Rules define every aspect of daily life here.)

JAP: (We need to move on from this. We owe that much to the queen.)
FR: (Nous devons aller de l'avant. C'est ce que notre reine aurait voulu...)
OUPS: (We need to move on from this. We owe that much to the queen.)

JAP: You have a letter, it would seem.
FR: On dirait que tu as reçu une lettre.
OUPS: You have a letter, it would seem.

JAP: Please take care of yourself.
FR: Sois prudent.
OUPS: Please take care of yourself.
